loans.name: Nana Yaa

texts.en:
Nana Yaa sells corn and cassava dough, known by the name 'banku,' in Aburansa, near Elmina. Nana Yaa has received a middle school education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a machine repair worker.

Nana Yaa has been selling banku for three years. She is responsible for paying to support her husband with covering the general family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of corn and cassava, for preparing her banku recipe. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her banku enterprise and to save for her family's future.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of corn and cassava, for preparing her banku recipe.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras Unidas está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están también en el programa de eliminación de pobreza, y su última encuesta muestra que 11 de estas mujeres se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Isabelina quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en el nivel amarillo. Con el trabajo que ella hace como ser trabajos de Costura, le ayuda a su marido en su trabajo de carpintería y también se dedica a la elaboración y venta de Producto de Limpieza  que aprendió con la asesora, y gracias a esto está tratando de mejorar su nivel de vida.
La Sra. Isabelina solicita de este crédito para la compra de los materiales de costura que ella usa en su trabajo como por ejemplo: telas, hilos, cierres, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadoras Unidas group ("hardworking, united women) is on its 3rd loan with the women's committee program of their communal bank.  They are also in the poverty elimination program, whose most recent questionnaire showed that 11 of these women are below the poverty line.

One of the members, Isabelina, showed in the most recent questionnaire that she is in the 2nd poverty level (also known as the yellow level).  With the work that she does in sewing, she helps out her husband in his carpentry work.  In addition, she works making and selling cleaning products, which she learned with others' help.  Thanks to this, she is trying to improve her standard of living.

Isabelina is asking for this loan to buy sewing materials that she uses in her work, such as fabric, thread, clasps, etc.  This will help her to solidify her business plan, which will help her improve her profits.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, clasps, etc.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is married and has six children. She has received schooling through a middle school level. Christiana prepares and sells the rice and bean dish, gari, in Aburansa near Elmina. She also sells raw maize and yams in bulk in her community. She has been selling prepared and raw food for the past 20 years. Her husband is a tailor. Christiana uses her income to help support her family and pay their general expenses. Christiana will use the loan to purchase more beans, rice, red leaves, maize and yams for her prepared and raw food sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christiana plans to grow her food sales business further.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, red leaves, maize and yams for her prepared and raw food sales.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 47 years old, married, and a mother of four children. Her husband is a fisherman. Paulina is engaged in retail selling of the crabs and fish caught by her husband. She has been in this business for about eight years. Each month she earns 2,300 pesos. 

Paulina is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 pesos to purchase a fishing net. Paulina plans to buy in the future, another pump boat used for fishing.

loans.use: to purchase a net for fishing

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: He is a strong-spirited, hard-working man, who has spent his life working hard to provide the best that he can for his family. He is applying for this loan to buy livestock to raise, so that he can continue working and helping his family. He is very happy with the support provided by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Seth

texts.en: Seth is a ground stone seller in Aburansa near Elmina. Seth has received a middle school education.  He is married and has three children. His wife is a farmer. Seth has been selling ground stones for almost 20 years now. He is responsible for supporting his wife and children and for the general welfare of his family. His loan will be used to buy more supplies necessary to run his stone business. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to expand his stone business and save for his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy more supplies necessary to run his stone business.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en: Sergia is 56 years old, married and has one adult child. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Sergia used her last loan to purchase products to sell in her retail store. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase new items and expand her product offerings. This is her third loan from GDMPC. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items for her retail store.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina sells the rice and bean dish, gari, in Aburansa near Elmina. She also sells a variety of footwear in the markets in her community. Mina has received a middle school education. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a Ghanaian lotto operator. Mina has been selling gari and footwear for six years. She is responsible for helping to pay her family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy rice, beans and colored leaves for her gari dish as well as a greater quantity and variety of footwear for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her food and footwear sales and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and colored leaves for her gari dish as well as a greater quantity and variety of footwear for sale.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Ramon está en su primer ciclo donde todas trabajan  y se ayudan por salir adelante organizando actividades de manera grupal. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza y luchan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eusebia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicación de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella  se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo lo que necesitan sus vecinos. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero gracias a su esfuerzo está creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, panificados, lácteos y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Ramon, in its first loan cycle, works together and helps one another to move forward by organizing group activities. The members are participating in the poverty reduction survey, and six of them live below the poverty line and are struggling to get ahead.

Eusebia, one of the members, was living at level two in the last survey. Her hard work, constant efforts, and behavior typical of a successful woman have helped her improve her economic situation. She is a merchant. She sells everything her neighbors need from her well-stocked shop. She says the business began small, but it is growing with her hard work. She is applying for a loan to buy vegetables, baked goods, milk products, and other items to sell and keep offering her customers variety.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, baked goods, milk products, and other items.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda, de 59 años esta casada con Segundo con quien tiene 6 hijos .Ella tiene una casa propia construida a base de esfuerzo y dedicacion y es en éste lugar donde día a día comparte la alegría de vivir en familia.El trabajo de Herlinda consiste en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, su especialidad son las colonias y perfumes. Herlinda visita dia a dia a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares con la finalidad de  vender algún producto o entregar aquellos que ya han sido solicitados con anticipación. Tiene en su casa un pequeño exhibidor en donde también ofrece a la venta estos productos a quienes la buscan en su hogar. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 7 años aproximadamente y conjuga esta labor con la venta de prendas de vestir de distintas marcas en diversas tallas, colores y modelos ya que ella se encarga personalmente de seleccionar y comprar las prendas al por mayor.Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues tiene la libertad de manejar su tiempo y a su vez organizar la visita a sus clientes, al principio tuvo algunas inseguridades para desarrollar su trabajo pero con el tiempo pudo superarlos. Herlinda espera poner una boutique para ofrecer sus productos con mayor comodidad .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para la compra de productos de belleza tales como cremas , talcos , entre otros  y ademas comprara ropa para la temporada de verano, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 59 years old and is married to Segundo, with whom she has 6 children.  She has her own house built from effort and dedication.  It is in this place where every day she shares the joy of living with her family.

Herlinda's work consists of selling cosmetics by catalog.  Her specialty is colognes and perfumes.  Herlinda visits her friends, neighbors, and relatives every day with the aim of selling some product or giving them what they have already ordered ahead of time.  In her house, she has a small display where she also offers these products to those that seek them in her home.

She has been in this line of work for about 7 years and combines it with selling clothing of different brands, sizes, and models.  She personally selects and buys the clothes wholesale.  She likes what she does very much because she has the freedom to manage her time how she wants and at the same time organize visits with her customers.  In the beginning, she had a some doubts about developing her business but with time she was able to overcome them.  Herlinda hopes to start a boutique to offer her products more conveniently.

At this time, she is asking for 1000 sols (US$400) to buy beauty products such as creams, powders, and others.  In addition, she will buy clothes for the summer season.  She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy makeup and clothes.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, 5 de estas mujeres se encuentran por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, resultado que ha arrojado su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. Ella trabaja en la venta de productos de forma ambulante, y vende todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, edredones y demás, y con ello se ha hecho de muy buena clientela y está creciendo día a día.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, edredones y demás y así seguir trabajando para mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Cayetano is in its fourth loan cycle with the women's communal bank program. Five of the women live below the poverty line, according to the poverty reduction survey. Maria, one of the members, was at level two in the last survey. 

Maria is a street vendor, and she sells many kinds of merchandise such as sheets, blankets, and quilts. She has loyal customers, and her business is growing. She is applying for a loan to buy sheets, blankets, quilts, and more to keep working and improving her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, quilts, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more wood and other materials for building and upholstering furniture, doors, and other wooden items.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena is married and has six children. She has received no formal education. Mena sells oranges in Aburansa, near Elmina. She has done this work for one year. Her husband is a fisherman. Mena uses her income to help pay her children's school fees.

Mena will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of oranges for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena plans to grow her orange sale business, and increase her capital base to expand into selling other fruits, very soon.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of oranges for sale.

loans.name: Oisulov

texts.ru: Ойсулов 62 года, вдова, она воспитывает внуков так как родители работают в Росси. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Ойсулов развивает животноводство и земледелие.Дополнительным источником дохода для семьи Ойсулов является пошив и торговля национальных.  Стартовав с суммы в 35,000 сом (KGS) в 2010 году, Ойсулов смогла развить хорошее хозяйство, с ежемесячным доходом в размере 8,000 KGS.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ойсулов обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку  овец для летней выпаски. Доходы Ойсулов планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Oisulov is a 62-year-old widow. She is raising her grandchild as his parents are working in Russia. As a source of income for her family, Oisulov is engaged in raising animals and agriculture. As an additional source of income for the family, Oisulov does sewing and national trade. 

Starting in 2010 with a sum of 35,000 som (KGS), Oisulov was able to develop a good farm with a monthly income of 8,000 KGS. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Oisulov appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for a summer activities. 

Oisulov plans to invest income in further expanding her count of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has six children. She has received no formal education. For many years now, Ama has sold eggplants and tomatoes in Aburansa, near Elmina. Her family is entirely dependent on her income. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase more eggplants and tomatoes to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, she plans to further increase her vegetable sales.

loans.use: to purchase eggplants and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Halimjon

texts.ru:
Халимчон молодой, добрый и ответственный мужчина. Он женат, имеет одного ребенка. С самого детства он помогал своему отцу в разведении скота. Это дело у них является семейным. Халимчон уже знает все преимущества этого дела.  Халимчон работает пастухом, все жители кишлака доверяют ему свой скот,так как он очень добросовестный и ответственный человек. Халимчон пасет скот в горах.   Сам тоже занимается откормом скота так как это дело является очень актуальным в их кишлаке.    Жена его домохозяйка, воспитывает детей но когда он уезжает далеко в горы она присматривает за  скотом. Сейчас Халимчон хочет увеличить поголовье скота и с этой целю обратился в Арванд чтобы получить кредит. 
На полученный кредит Халимчон планирует купить скот и развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Halimjon is a kind and responsible young man. He is married and has 1 child. From his early childhood, he helped his father raise cattle, as this was the family business. He now knows all the ins and outs of raising cows. He works as a stockman, and all the residents of his village trust him with their herds because he is conscientious and trustworthy person. He pastures the cattle in the mountains. He also has his own cattle which he fattens and re-sells, as there is a big demand in his village. His wife is a homemaker who raises the children, but when Halimjon goes far away into the mountains, she takes care of the cows. Halimjon now wants to increase his herd, and for this reason he has come to Arvand for a loan which he plans to use to buy cattle so he can develop his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a farming business. She keeps poultry. In addition to this, she sells tap water and charcoal. The business has been running for five years. Constance has six school-going children.

Constance learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit. She is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings to renovate the tap area and buy more chickens for resale. The extra income she earns as a result of the loan will be added to her savings to purchase more chickens and educate her children. Her desire is also to keep layer hens in the near future.

loans.use: To renovate the tap area and buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Emelia's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two partners, Emilia and Regina. They have been together since 2009. They trade in provisions such as tilapia fish, 'koobi,' and fruit.

Emilia is a 35-years-old provisions and slippers seller. She sells provisions such as milk, Milo, sugar, and biscuits. She has been with ID Ghana for the past four years and is doing very well with her business. Emilia has been running this business for 17 years now. She is grateful to ID Ghana for the training on savings, which motivated her to save to achieve her dream. 

This is Emilia's sixth loan and she needs GHS 1,200 to buy more provisions to sell to her customers.  Emelia and Regina need a total amount of GHS 1,800 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more milk, Milo, sugar, and rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah sells provisions in Aburansa, near Elmina. Sarah has a middle school level education, and she is married with three children. Her husband is a local carpenter in their area. 

Sarah has been selling provisions for around four years. She is responsible for helping her husband with the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her provisions shop.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions.

loans.name: Maame Efua

texts.en:
Maame Efua sells gari, a traditional rice and bean dish, in Aburansa, near Elmina. She also sells maize and eggplants in bulk in the local markets. Maame Efua has received no formal education, and she is widow with one child. 

Maame Efua has been selling gari, maize, and eggplants for the past 30 years. She is responsible for supporting herself and her child alone now that her husband has died. Her loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of rice, beans, and colored leaves for her gari preparation as well as vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the profits from her business to develop her food selling business further and continue to save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for gari preparation as well as vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Wendzoodo Nooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA représente le groupe  WENDZOODO NOOMA. Elle se porte bien ainsi que toute sa famille. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 36ans et le moins âgé a 16ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Mme vent du beurre de karité  depuis 09ans. Son crédit s’est bien passé. Elle s’approvisionne  dans les provinces du Burkina. Ses clients sont ceux qui fabriquent le savon.
Mme veut s’acheter 150 plats de beurre de karité. 
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec  ses  économies. Son ambition est d’avoir des clients dans les pays extérieurs.
texts.en:
Ms. LAMOUSSA represent the group WENDZOODO NOOMA. She is well, and so is her whole family. She is the married mother of three children. The oldest is 36 years old, and the youngest is 16. Two of the children go to school, and she has three persons to support.  

Ms. LAMOUSSA has been selling shea butter for nine years. Her loan went well. She gets her supplies from the provinces in Burkina. Her customers are those who make soap. 

She wants to purchase 150 dishes of shea butter. She wants to bolster her business with her savings. Her ambition is to have customers from abroad.

loans.use: to purchase 150 dishes of shea butter to sell to soap makers.

loans.name: Moussa-Foudou

texts.fr: Jeune revendeur de cartes de recharge à Lomé, Moussa-foudou âgé de 29ans est célibataire  et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. C’est en 2011 qu’il a démarré son activité et il s’approvisionne  dans les sociétés de communication. Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il veut agrandir son activité tout en prenant soin de lui même et plus tard de sa future famille.
texts.en: A young retailer of recharge phone cards in Lomé, Moussa-foudou, 29 years old, is unmarried and has no children to support. In 2011, he started his business, and he gets his supplies from the communication companies. To satisfy his customers, he is requesting an initial loan at WAGES in order to purchase more merchandise. As for the future, he wants to expand his business while taking care of himself and, later on, his future family.

loans.use: to purchase recharge phone cards

loans.name: Diabou Balla

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Diabou Balla célibataire sans enfant fait du commerce depuis 4 ans. Elle part à Touba une ville situé à plus de 70km de là ou elle habite acheter des draps de lit, des tissus, pour ensuite venir les revendre dans son voisinage. Elle habite à quelques mètres de l’IMCEC ce qui lui permet de ne rien minimiser et de constituer une épargne régulière. Elle participe aussi à la dépense alimentaire de la famille. 
Elle désire avoir un grand magasin et des employés à sa disposition.
texts.en: Miss Diabou Balla doesn't have children and has been in business for four years. She travels to Touba, a city about 70 km from where she lives to purchase bed linens and fabrics for resale in her neighborhood. She lives very close to IMCEC which gives her the opportunity to save on a regular basis. She contributes to the food expenses of her household.  She would like to have a big house and to manage employees one day.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and bed linens for resale.

loans.name: Las Vitoriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Victoriosas está en su ciclo 1, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ondina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. Ella se dedica a la repostería, ya que hace todo tipo de tortas y cosas dulces,  es una persona muy trabajadora que con su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia. Su meta es seguir trabajando y ayudando por medio de esto a su familia.
Solicita este crédito para la compra harina, huevos, dulces y demás, para poder seguir trabajando y haciendo los productos que vende. Agradece la oportunidad que tiene ya que esto le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The group known as Las Victoriosas is in their first cycle. They are participating in the survey to eliminate poverty, as 4 members of the group live below the poverty line. [The survey is part of Fundacion Paraguay's innovative "Poverty Stoplight" program aimed at helping individuals lift themselves out of poverty]

One of the members is Ondina, who in the last survey was revealed to be in the second poverty level. She makes a living running a dessert shop, where she makes all types of cakes and sweets. She is a very hardworking person who has gotten ahead through her efforts and the help of her family. Her goal is to continue working and contributing to her family through this work. 

She requests a loan to buy flour, eggs, sweets, and other products, to be able to continue working and preparing the products that she sells. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sweets, and other products

loans.name: Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
El comité Dinámicas está conformado por 12 mujeres que realizan distintas actividades entre ellas la costura, venta de comestibles, empleadas entre otras.
Petrona es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de chipas (alimento típico paraguayo) con lo que ayuda a su familia. Cuenta Petrona que le está yendo muy bien, ya que la chipa siempre es consumida a cualquier hora del día, ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela y está creciendo lentamente gracias a su esfuerzo.
Su meta es ser una gran microempresaria y dar trabajo a los demás.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de chipas para la venta, y así invertir más en su negocio e ir mejorando.
texts.en:
The communal bank Dinámicas comprises 12 woman who have different professions: dressmaking, selling food, and working as an employee, among others. Petrona, one of the members, sells chipas (a traditional Paraguayan food) to help her family. Petrona says business is good because chipas are eaten throughout the day. She has loyal customers, and business is growing steadily with her hard work.

Her goal is to be a good small-business owner and hire others. She is applying for a loan to buy chipas to sell and invest in and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chipas (a traditional food) to sell.

loans.name: Bukari

texts.en:
Bukari sells gari, a traditional rice and bean dish, in the markets in and around Aburansa, near Elmina. Bukari is also a farmer in the area. Bukari has a middle school-level education, and he  is married with two children. His wife is a seamstress in their community. 

Bukari has been selling gari and farming for four years now. He is responsible for supporting his wife and children and for the general welfare of his family. His loan will be used to buy ingredients necessary to prepare his gari recipe as well as supplies needed to operate his farm. He hopes to use the profits to expand his food production business and save to continue investing in his farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for gari and supplies needed to operate his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan is a master carver from Bali who specializes in traditional masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of wood to increase production.

Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is his story:

"I started to learn woodcarving when I was just six years old, together with other children. As a child, I never thought it possible to become an artist. I was lucky to have my father, for he was able to carve and he taught me how to carve. However, it was hard to focus seriously on carving because we had to look after our two cows and also work in the rice fields. Times were hard then, but I had strong support from my parents. Since 1995, carving has become the main sustenance for my family."

"Please receive my most heartfelt thanks for this microcredit. I would like to strengthen my business and make it grow, so this microcredit will be used to get more wood."

Use the link below to view Wayan's hand-carved wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2884

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of wood to increase production

loans.name: Tisa Laville

texts.en:
Tisa Laville is 28 years old. She is happily married and the mother of one child. Her husband is a motorcycle driver.

Tisa Laville is in business providing motorcycle transport in her community. She has been in this business for about a year, and each month she earns 4,200 PHP. 

Tisa Laville is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase a front wheel and other spare parts. Her plan in the future is to purchase another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase a front wheel and other spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Habacuc Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADELEINE  AIDA est la représentante du groupe HABACUC. Elle se porte bien. Mme est mariée et mère de quatre(04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 29 ans et le moins âgé a 13 ans. Parmi ses enfants deux (02) vont à l’école. Elle a cinq (05) personnes en charge.
Mme est vendeuse de pagnes depuis 03 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont partout dans le quartier.
Mme veut s’acheter 20 pièces de pagnes 8Mars.
Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité et aider son mari pour les frais scolaires des enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Ms. MADELEINE AIDA is the representative of the group HABACUC. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 29 years old, and the youngest is 13. Among her children, two go to school. She has five persons to support. 

Ms. MADELEINE AIDA has been a retailer of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for three years. She gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers are everywhere in the district. She wants to purchase 20 lengths of 'pagne' cloth to bolster her business and help out her husband in covering the children's schooling costs. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase 20 lengths of 8Mars 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 40 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 15 and 12.  In 2002, she established her cow-raising business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

Parbati has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy a young milking cow.  In the future, Parbati plans to raise the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase automotive spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school supplies, uniforms, shoes, and tuition

loans.name: Jannat

texts.ru: Жаннат 43 года. В 1993 году,после свадьбы в поисках дохода, Жаннат начала заниматься откормом и перепродажей скота, дополнительно занимается продажей молока, начав с двух дойных коров, подаренных родителями на свадьбу. В настоящее время в хозяйстве Жаннат имеется 6 дойных коров и 20 лошади приносящих около 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жаннат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Жаннат планирует частично вложить в образование детей, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение хозяйства и обустройство будущего детей.
texts.en: Jannat is 43 years old. After her wedding in 1993, she began looking for a source of income and got into the field of fattening and re-selling cattle. She also sells milk, having started out with 2 dairy cows that her parents gave as a wedding present. Today, her farm includes 6 dairy cows and 20 horses, and brings in around 25,000 Kyrgyzstan Som each month from the sale of dairy products and re-sale of cattle. For the purpose of further developing her business, Jannat has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 135,000 Som to buy more livestock. She plans to use part of  the income generated by this loan to pay for her children's education, and part will be put towards the expansion of her farm and her children's futures.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 61 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over six years, she has owned and operated a retail business in the local community to earn a living; she earns 6,800 PHP every month. 

Norma joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee, and sugar. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four school-going children. 

Elizabeth runs a primary school as an investment, and began this out of the desire to provide affordable education to the children in the vicinity. She also employs six teachers in the school.

Elizabeth was introduced to Milango by an employee and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase chairs and stationery.

Elizabeth looks forward to having two streams per class by the time she will be offering class eight education in her school.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and stationery.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and married with four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over five years, she has owned and operated a farm, planting and harvesting coconut for sale in the local community; she earns 4,500 PHP every month. 

Elizabeth joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she is requesting a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the extra income to renovate her home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba, 37, is a married entrepreneur from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She has one child and earns a living from her transport service business. She has been in this business for almost three years now, and she earns 5,400 PHP a month. 

Melba joined GDMPC in 2011, and she is borrowing 15,000 PHP to improve her business by purchasing cab accessories and tires. Before long, she’s plans to buy another tricycle.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires for her transport business.

loans.name: Adita

texts.es:
Adita de 29 años de edad , es soltera y tiene  2 hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente la casa de sus padres.La actividad que realiza Adita es la fabricación y venta de esteras que sirven para divdir paredes en las casas de edificaciones simples. Su trabajo es completamente hecho a mano a base de desperdicios de triplay. Cuenta con un local alquilado donde tiene todos los materiales necesarios para el proceso de elaboración, además cuenta con 3 ayudantes a quienes paga por día trabajado. Realiza sus ventas por pedidos al por mayor y menor, atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes. Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio que fue reinvirtiendo y hasta el momento recibe el apoyo de su hermana en la administración y en la obtención de nuevos clientes.Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda y las buenas ganancias económicas que le deja ya que cuenta con varios pedidos por entregar.
Decidió empezar con su negocio por el deseo de ser independiente y contar con sus propios ingresos, además esto le ayudó a asumir los gastos básicos de sus hijos.En la actualidad, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, quiere continuar con su negocio y aumentar su producción.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para la compra de material utilizado en la fabricacion de esteras como desperdicios de triplay , clavos , pegamentos , entre otros .
texts.en:
Adita, 29, is single and has two children, ages 5 and 10. They live together comfortably in her parents' home. Adita make and sells wood room dividers for modest homes. She makes everything by hand from plywood scraps. She rents a shop where she stores the supplies she needs. She employs three day workers as well. She sells to order at wholesale and retail and treats her customers well. 

She began the business five years ago with her own capital, which she has reinvested. Her sister helps with management and acquiring new clients. The business is quite profitable because demand is good, and she has a backlog of customer orders. She decided to start her own business because she wanted to be independent, have her own income, and provide for her children's needs.

With the strong results she is seeing, she wants to continue and expand production. She is applying for a loan of S/. 1000 soles to buy materials such as plywood scraps, nails, and glue to make room dividers.

loans.use: to buy materials to make room dividers.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 43 года, воспитывает 3 детей. Гулмира на протяжении многих лет  работала в в районной аптеке.По характеру очень дружелюбная и старательная женщина. В 1996 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулмира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой 3,000 сом (KGS) . Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Гулмира сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в 13,000 сом (KGS) и от полеводства в период урожая имеет доход около 70,000 KGS. На сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка и 10 голов МРС. Гулмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100.000 сом (KGS) на приобретение дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulmira is a 43-year-old mother of three. She worked for many years at a regional pharmacy. She is a friendly and hard-working woman. 

While searching for new sources of income in 1996, Gulmira started her own animal husbandry and crop farming business with an initial investment of 3,000 som. Thanks to persistence and hard work she was able to develop her business so that it now brings in a monthly income of 13,000 som and 70,000 som during the harvest season. Gulmira currently owns two dairy cows, two bulls, and ten sheep and goats. 

Gulmira turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 100,000 loan to purchase more heads of cattle. She plans to use the income from the loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows and 2 sheep.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame owns and operates a provisions store in Aburansa near Elmina. Kwame has received a middle school education. He is married and has five children. His wife is a fish monger in their community.

Kwame has been selling provisions for the past 10 years. He is responsible for financially supporting his family and taking care of their general welfare. His loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to expand his provisions shop, and to save for his family's future.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa is taking a second loan, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She is approaching Yehu for a loan amounting to KES 20,000 to pay school fees for her child. She hopes that this will ease her studying.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is married and lives with the family. She has two children who attend school.

Mwanauba learnt the trade of dressmaker, working as a seamstress in school uniforms and trouser suits. She was able to save money over the years, and as a result, was able to return to buy a sewing machine and start up her own business. At the present time, she is one of the best known people for sewing articles of clothing, jackets, curtains, sheets, etc.

The loan that Mwanauba has applied for is intended for the purchase of fabrics and other articles, so as to be able to satisfy her customers’ wishes. In this way, she intends to offer them better service and more speed.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other sewing articles.

loans.name: Lia Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of two partners, Vinolia and Ayishetu, who live in Dansoman. They have been a group for one year, and they are doing very well. Vinolia sells wax print fabrics and Ayishetu sells waakye, a popular Ghanian dish.

Vinolia is 35 years old. She has been selling wax prints for three years. Her customers appreciate her integrity and frankness. 

Vinolia has been with ID Ghana for the past year and hopes to be a member for the rest of her life. She has previously taken two loans and has fully repaid them.  This is her third loan, and she is requesting 800 GHS to help her meet the demand for her product. 

Vinolia and Ayishetu need a total of 1,500 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in and around Dansoman.

loans.use: to buy more wax print fabric.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
El Sauce es un municipio donde sus habitantes se caracterizan por ser humildes y carismáticos que brindan hospitalidad a todos sus visitantes y se ganan su admiración por los tradicionales platos típicos que elaboran como el nacatamal, las sabrosas rosquillas, el arroz con leche.

Tal es el caso de la joven María Isabel que desciende de una de estas familias quienes le han inculcado el amor al trabajo de manera honrada y se gana la vida laborando como conserje en un colegio de la localidad donde tiene varios años de trabajar y este oficio le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.

A pesar que es muy poco lo gana hace el esfuerzo por desempeñar con esmero su labor. 

Está solicitando un crédito para comprar útiles escolares, uniformes y zapatos escolares para sus dos hijos que iniciarán el año escolar ya que no puede cubrir estos variados gastos con su salario.

Pide el apoyo a estas personas de buen corazón que han ayudado a miles de familias de todo el mundo sobre todo los más necesitados para que le brinden este pequeño préstamo para alistar de manera sencilla a sus pequeños y no tengan ningún obstáculo para ir a la escuela.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a town where the inhabitants are characterized as being humble and charismatic, providing hospitality to all visitors. They have won admiration for the traditional dishes which they prepare such as natacamal [similar to tamales], tasty donuts, and rice pudding.

Such is the case of young Maria Isabel that she is descended from one of these families who have instilled a love of honest work. She makes a living working as a janitor at a school in the town. She has worked there for several years and this job has allowed her to bring home the bread every day.

Despite the fact that she earns very little, she makes the effort to carry out her work with care.

She is  requesting a credit to buy school supplies, uniforms and school shoes for her two children who will begin the school year, because she cannot cover these various expenses with her salary.

She requests the support of these good-hearted people who have helped thousands of families from all over the world, especially those most in need, so that they provide to her this small loan for enrolling her children easily and so they have no obstacles to going to school.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, uniforms and shoes

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She has been farming for fifteen years, and now she intends to branch into commercial farming, investing in horticultural products.  She is married with six children, all of whom are in school, and Amina's spouse also earns some income for the family. 

Amina was introduced to Milango by an employee, and she is applying for a loan of 11,350 KES to pay for farm cultivation and to buy seeds and fertilizers. 

Amina believes she can earn more income from this investment and use the funds to educate her children. One of the major challenges she faces is changes in the weather. She looks forward to investing the extra income into her business.

loans.use: to pay for farm cultivation and to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah is happy to have received a loan through Milango. He invested the previous loan in repairs. The family has grown, and Josiah's wife is now looking after the family's salon business. 

Josiah wants to become the major supplier of batteries in his area. He has been selling second-hand batteries and scraps.

Josiah is applying for a loan of 83,500 KES to buy batteries for sale. Despite challenges like competition and an increase in prices, he believes he can improve his income so that he can repay his loans, pay for education for his family, and raise their overall standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase batteries for sale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has a small sewing workshop making uniforms for businesses. She is a highly responsible person with a strong will to improve herself. Such is her cheerful and enterprising spirit that she will undoubtedly achieve all the goals she has set for herself. 

The loan which she is applying for will be used to buy fabric, elastic and thread, amongst other things, which will allow her to continue doing the jobs that her clients bring to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, elastic and thread.

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en:
Subdra is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 19. 

Many years ago, Subdra established her poultry farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chickens for her business.  

In the future, Subdra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, tents, and fabrics.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with four children. She lives in Tiribe, Kenya with her husband, a primary school teacher. They own their own home. 

Dama operates a kiosk, where she sells products like wheat flour, maize flour, and detergents, among other things. Most of her income is used to pay school fees. She has now requested a loan of 50,000 KSH to help pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials including copper, paint and enamels.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 29 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 6.  

In 2005, Rita established her cow raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  

In the future, Rita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. 

 In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and from which methane can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman buys and sells goat meat, fruit, and vegetables. In addition to this business, he also manages a movie shop. He has five children, all of whom attend school. 

Suleiman notes that both of his businesses provide good income because he is a very hard-working man. He used to work as a domestic employee but had to stop in order to care for his children. That was why he started his small businesses. 

Suleiman is requesting this loan to purchase three goats so that he can raise and sell them by Easter.

loans.use: to purchase three goats for sale.

loans.name: Ndzadze

texts.en:
Ndzadze is a 33-year-old ambitious woman living in Tiribe, Kenya. She is single with one 10-year-old child. For three years, she has owned and operated a retail shop. She got the initial capital from her parents, which enabled her to be self-reliant after she finished her studies.

Ndzadze has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy sacks of maize flour and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize flour and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El cliente Cesar vive en Libertad, tiene 50 años. El cliente toda su vidas ha empezado como comerciante de ropa es lo que le ayudado seguir adelante. El trabajo lo realiza junto a su esposa para así poder obtener mejores ingresos. 

En el cual en su negocio vende blusas, jeans, interiores, etc. La dificultad que enfrenta es día a día es la enfermedad de su esposa las cuales las cosas se les hace más dura pero no se da por vencido con la ayuda de Dios sigue adelante para un mejor vivir.
 
Tiene una hija, ella estudia en una escuela fiscal; para ello es que el cliente se esfuerza para así poder hacer realidad los sueños de su hija.

Con el préstamo para comprar productos o mercadería de ropa blusas, jeans e interiores. En el futuro quiere que su negocio siga creciendo y ponerse un local con una tienda.
texts.en:
Cesar lives in Libertad, and is 50 years old.  He has been selling clothing all of his life, and this is what has helped him to make progress.  He works with his wife, because this way they can get better earnings.  

In his business, he sells blouses, jeans, underwear, and other garments.  One difficulty that he faces each day is his wife's illness, which makes things hard for them.  However, they won't give up, and with the help of God they will continue forward to make a better life.      

Cesar has a daughter, and she attends a public school.  The reason he works so hard is so that he can make his daughter's dreams a reality. 

With this loan, Cesar will buy products and merchandise, including blouses, jeans, and undergarments.  In the future, he wants his business to continue to grow, so that he can eventually have a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothing, such as blouses, jeans and undergarments

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is divorced and has two children who are in school.

Fatuma has been a seamstress for more than seven years. She started out with some capital that she earned while working in the neighborhood. Now she has a business where she produces uniforms for educational institutions and sports clubs. Throughout her career, she has gained many customers who visit her home in order to place their orders.

This loan will be used to buy more supplies in bulk, such as fabrics of different types and colors, thread, buttons, and zippers. As a result, her business will be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy bulk tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Bhuma

texts.en:
Bhuma is 27 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 5 and 2. 

 In 2005, Bhuma established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Bhuma plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called “pasal”, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Bintimohammed

texts.en:
Bintimohammed is a divorced woman with one child. She has lived in Tiribe for many years.

For 11 years, Bintimohammed has operated a stall in the market, where she sells fruits, vegetables, and novelty items. Her shop is well-stocked, and she has an established customer base. She says that she started small when her child was a baby and the economy was unfavorable. She gets up very early to open her stall and to buy fresh produce so that she can offer good quality to all her customers.

Today, Bintimohammed is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables so that she can continue to offer her customers a good variety and to give them what they need.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina vive en Curicó, Chile y hace mermeladas de melón y higo principalmente, conservas, queques, humitas y pastel de choclo. Hace 7 años que se dedica a esto y vende sus productos en empresas. Se va a ocupar el préstamo para comprar frascos, frutas y otros insumos. En el futuro quisiera poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y generar bastantes ganancias para comprar los insumos que necesita para hacer sus productos. Ella tiene una hija de 9 años que está en el colegio. Le gusta trabajar con fondo esperanza por la forma que tienen de trabajar y de la manera de cómo orientan para llevar a cabo su negocio.
texts.en: Cristina lives in Curicó, Chile.  She has a business making melon and fig jams, preserves, cakes, tamales, and corn cakes.  She's had this business for 7 years, and she sells her products in companies.  She will use this loan to buy jars, fruit, and other supplies.  In the future, she would like to be able to continue to grow her business, generating sufficient profits to buy the supplies she needs to make her products.  Cristina has a 9 year-old daughter who attends school.  Cristina likes working with Fondo Esperanza because of the way that they work, and the way that they guide her in how to carry out her business.

loans.use: to buy jars, fruit and other supplies

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 34-year-old married man with three children. He describes himself as obedient. For four years, he has operated a poultry business selling chickens. His business is located in a viable business area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes lack of funds for improving the business as his biggest challenge.

Wilson will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy chickens to sell. His goal is to be a poultry distributor within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM .

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 23 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Merlyn owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business for over two years and earns 1,700 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 62 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Evangeline owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been with her business for over ten years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and also small crops. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and also small crops.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке в г Каменка-Днепровская уже 8 лет. Он женат, имеет четверо детей. Старший сын служит в армии, остальные трое детей учатся в школе.

Владимир понемногу развивается, построил теплицы, сделал отопление; планирует еще развитие, так как есть еще участок земли на котором будет ставить теплицы.

Владимир просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 20,000 гривен на закупку угля и дров для отопления теплиц, а также пленки для ремонта теплиц.
texts.en: Vladimir has grown vegetables on his land in the city of Kamenka-Dneprovskaya for eight years.  He's married and has four children.  His oldest son is serving in the army while the three others are still in school.  Little by little, Vladimir has developed, built and heated greenhouses.  He plans further expansion since there's still room on his land to build more.  Vladimir is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to buy coal and wood to heat the greenhouses and also materials to repair them.

loans.use: To buy fuel to heat his greenhouse and material to repair them.

loans.name: Teresa Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa vive en Manta, tiene 54 años de edad. Cuando se casó decidió aportar económicamente en su hogar, empezó cociendo ropa pequeña, luego se fue a un curso de confección y aprendió hacer vestidos de fiestas.

El trabajo lo realiza todos los días desde las dos de la tarde hasta las ocho de la noche, en la mañana no puede porque hace los quehaceres del hogar.

Está casada, su esposo trabaja como chofer de una cooperativa de taxis, tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad que trabajan y aportan en los gastos de la casa.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y una máquina de coser. Su sueño es tener su negocio con mas maquinas de coser para así facilitar los pedidos y darles trabajo a demás personas para que le ayuden a salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa, 54, lives in Manta.  When she married she decided to contribute economically to her home and started sewing small clothing.  Then, she took a dressmaking course and learned how to make party dresses.  She works every day from two in the afternoon until eight at night; she can’t during the morning because she has to do her household chores.  She’s married and her husband works as a co-op taxi driver.  She has two children who are working adults now and who help with household expenses.

She wants to use the loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine.  Her dream is to have more sewing machines in her business so she can fill orders more easily and provide employment for others who will help her get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kalerwe Tuula Tda Group

texts.en:
Faruk, shown raising his hand, is a member of Kalerwe Tula Drivers’ Association, a group formed with the objective of improving the households of taxi drivers. He is 36 years of age, married, and has two children who both attend school. He also takes care of three dependents because their parents are incapable of meeting their educational, medical, nutritional, and clothing needs.

Farouk drives a taxi to earn a living; he mainly works around the city, but on occasion is hired to go to the countryside. He started this job in 2004 after falling to find other employment yet needing a way to meet the growing requirements of his extended family. His major challenge is his health. Farouk developed back pain due to spending a lot of time seated behind the steering wheel and so regularly takes medication to relieve the pain.

Faruk’s dream is to have his house completed so that he can stop paying high rent, money that would be better spent paying tuition for his children and saving for the future.

A very hardworking and honest man, Faruk will use the loan to finish part of his incomplete residential house so that he can soon occupy it. He is hopeful the partnership with UGAFODE will change his financial status for the better.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his incomplete residential house.

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
Radha is 40 years old.  She is married and has two children who are 18 and 14.  In 2000, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Radha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Danitza

texts.es:
Danitza, es soltera no tiene hijos, ella y su madre viven en casa en alquiler, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 16B de julio de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudia la carrera de auxiliar en enfermería en un instituto de la misma ciudad, se dedica a la preparación de una gran variedad de platos que ofrece a su clientela.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar insumos al por mayor como ser: papa, arroz, tunta, verduras. Ya que el precio al por mayor tiende a ser menor y su utilidad será más alta.

El sueño de Danitza es tener un restaurante familiar y también terminar sus estudios.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Danitza is single and has no children.  She and her mother live in a rented house located in the city of El Alto’s 16B de Julio zone.  She’s studying to be a nurse’s helper in a local institute.  She works making a vast variety of dishes to sell to her customers.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients like potatoes, rice, dehydrated potato and vegetables at wholesale since the wholesale price tends to be lower and her profits will thus be higher.  Danitza’s dream is to own a family restaurant and also to finish her studies.  This is the first time she’s asked for a loan from IMPRO and from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a 57-year-old married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail store, where she sells home products. She has been involved in this business for two years; it is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes insecurity within the area as her biggest challenge. 

Tima will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy home products. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay her previous loans of 20,000 and 30,000 KES.

loans.use: to buy home products.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Don Teofilo, es Casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa familiar y pagan alquiler, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Mercedes de la ciudad de El Alto.
Teófilo estudió solo hasta el nivel primaria y actualmente se dedica  al transporte inter-ciudad trabajando todos los días de la semana, el recorrido de su ruta es desde zona de San Pedro de la ciudad a la parada de ciudad satélite de la ciudad del Alto, le ayuda su esposa, ambos mantienen en su alimentación, vestimenta, y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo (un minibús) ya que comenzaron las clases, y se presenta más afluencia de clientes en las paradas. 
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Teófilo is married and has two school age children.  They live in the family home and pay rent; the house is located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Mercedes zone.  Teófilo only completed elementary school and he currently works providing inter-city transportation services every day of the week.  His route is from the San Pedro section of the city to the Ciudad Satelite stop in El Alto.  His wife helps him.  They both provide food, clothing and schooling for their children.  He needs the loan to service his work tool (a minibus) because classes have started and there are more customers available at the stops.  This is the first time he’s requested a loan from IMPRO and from KIVA.

loans.use: to pay to service his minibus.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 39 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Consuelo has her own motor transport service. She has been with her business for over four years to earn a living, and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010. 

Consuelo requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to obtain accessories and tires. She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky is a 34 years old and married with four children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He has his own motor transport service to earn a living and earns 2,000 PHP every month. He's been with his business for over three years. Ricky joined GDMPC in 2011. Ricky is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase spare parts to have better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Jimboy

texts.en: Jimboy is 23 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and manages farmland, planting and harvesting vegetables to sell in the local community. He has been with his business for over two years and earns 1,500 PHP every month. Jimboy joined GDMPC in 2012. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rhyme Rose

texts.en: Rhyme Rose is 22 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling cell phone load. She's been in her business for over two years to earn a living and earns 1,700 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC last year. And now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional cell phone load. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cell phone load

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: sophie est une femme de 58 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont le premier est agé de 35 ans et le dernier de 17 ans. elle possède et gère un stand dans un quartier de la ville où elle vend des poissons fumés. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante. les bénéfices ainsi générés lui serviront pour agrandir son activité et assurer l'éducation de son dernier enfant qui va encore à l'école.
texts.en: Sophie is a woman of 58 years old. She is a widow and the mother of seven children, the oldest of whom is 35 years old and the youngest of whom is 17. Sophie owns and manages a stand in a district of her town where she sells smoked fish. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock of raw materials so that she can meet the demand of her growing clientele. The income Sophie earns with the help of this loan will serve to expand her business and provide for the education of her youngest child, who is still attending school.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin de 27 años esta casada con Rodrigo , con quien tiene dos hijos pequeños .Ella vive en la casa de sus suegros en donde tiene condicionado un pequeño espacio para su familia.El trabajo de Evelin consiste en la compra y venta de repuestos vehiculares por esta razón ha  establecido su negocio en la parte frontal de su casa ya que su esposo es mecánico y repara motos y mototaxis .  Lleva realizando este trabajo por 6 meses gracias al apoyo que recibe de su esposo.
Se siente muy bien con está actividad ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos económicos, así mismo puede estar en su hogar y atender a sus hijos , cuando se iniciaron en este rubro tenían pocos clientes, pero con el pasar del tiempo se han ido incrementando gracias al buen trabajo que realizan.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de repuestos y piezas de reparación vehicular como ejes, faros, bujías, pistones, cadenas, radios entre otros,  por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y a sue vez agradece la oportunidad que le brinda MFP para cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Evelin, 27, is married to Rodrigo with whom she has two small children.  She lives in her parents-in-law’s house where she has a small space set aside for her family.  Evelin’s work consists in buying and selling vehicle spare parts and she’s set up her shop in the front part of her house since her husband’s a mechanic who repairs motors and mototaxis.  She’s been working for six months thanks to the support she gets from her husband.

She feels very good with this activity because it allows her to earn good income while staying home and caring for her children.  When they started out in this line of work they had few customers but as time has passed they have been increasing in number thanks to the good work they do.

On this occasion, she’s asking for a 2,000 sol loan to buy spare parts and auto repair parts like axles, headlamps, spark plugs, pistons, chains and radios, among others.  On the other hand, she commits to make her installment payments punctually and at the same time is grateful for the opportunity MFP gives her to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Akanké

texts.fr: Akanké vit avec son conjoint et leurs 02 enfants de 03ans et 02 mois à Lomé. Âgée de 25ans, elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans une boutique des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2009. Avec son second crédit qu’elle sollicite à WAGES, elle va acheter des marchandises pour revendre à ses clients. A l’avenir, elle souhaite augmenter son niveau de vie et assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille.
texts.en: Akanké lives in Lomé with her husband and their two children, the oldest of whom is three years and the youngest of whom is two months old. Akanké is 25 years old, and has been running her small grocery shop since 2009. She purchases her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé. With her second loan from WAGES, Akanké plans to buy merchandise that she will then resell to her customers. In the future, Akanké hopes to increase her standard of living and ensure a bright future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase general groceries for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy his daughter school supplies

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es soltero no tiene hijos, viven en casa en anticretico, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.

El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja como socio propietario en una de las empresas de  Radio taxi de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para el arreglo del motor de su vehiculo y comprar llantas  nuevas, así mantendrá en buen estado su herramienta de trabajo.

El sueño de José es tener una segunda movilidad, así sus ingresos aumentaran y mejorara la calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: José’s single and has no children.  He lives in a house under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] located in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta zone.  He studied up to secondary school level and currently works as a member/owner in one of La Paz’s radio dispatched taxi firms.  He needs the loan to repair his taxi’s motor and to buy new tires so his work tool will be in good condition.  José’s dream is to own a second vehicle so his income will increase and his quality of life will improve.  This is the first time he’s requested a loan from IMPRO and from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy tires and to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Oldalia

texts.en: Oldalia is 38 years old and married with five children. She lives in Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental. For over 10 years, she has owned and operated a charcoal selling business in the local community. She earns 9,000 PHP per month. Oldalia joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 32,000 PHP for additional capital for her charcoal business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business into a coconut buying and selling business.

loans.use: to buy more chacoal

loans.name: Benvienida

texts.en: Benvienida is 52 years old and married with six children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business over nine years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Gulanda

texts.ru: Гуланде 31 год, замужем. Вместе с мужем воспитывают четверых детей, младшей дочери 2 года. Основная деятельность семьи Гуланды – разведение скота и полеводство. Начатое практически с нуля 10 лет назад с момента создания семьи, хозяйство сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В Зимнее время Гуланда занимается торгоавлей овощей и фруктов на рынке. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота и для весенне пахотных работ, Гуланда обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и удобрений для обработки земли для посева. Доходы от кредита Гуланда планирует вложить покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство и в будущем отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Gulanda is 31 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising four children; their youngest is a two-year-old daughter.  The family mostly works in livestock and agriculture.  Beginning ten years ago with almost nothing, their business now brings in around 20,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  In the winter time, Gulanda sells fruits and vegetables at a market.  With the goal of increasing the number of animals among her livestock and the work available during spring, Gulanda has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy livestock and fertilizer to cultivate the land for planting.  She plans to use the income from the loan to buy two dairy cows which will allow her to improve her financial position and, in the future, make repairs to her home.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and fertilizers

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres forman parte de este grupo que lleva por nombre “Mujeres Luchadoras”, ya que eso es lo que son, 13 mujeres que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas necesitan.
Rosalba es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo. Tiene mucha habilidad con las comidas y es por ello que le está yendo muy bien, y gracias a eso ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida digna.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carnes, verduras, jamón, queso, condimentos y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que estan recibiendo, ya que les será de gran ayuda a ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
13 women make up this group called “Mujeres Luchadoras” [Fighter Women]. That is what they are, 13 women who work hard to get ahead and give their families everything that they need.  

Rosalba is a member of this group. She works selling all types of food. She is very good at cooking and that is why it is going very well for her. Thanks  to that, she helps her family and gives them everything to have a dignified life.

She is asking for this loan to buy materials to be able to keep making her food, such as meat, vegetables, ham, cheese, condiments and more. She is grateful for the help she is getting, since it will be a big help to them and their families.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, ham, cheese, condiments and more.

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr:
Ce membre a intégré le banc villageois depuis son  cycle premier.
Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 5 garçons et 5 filles dont le plus âgé a 27 ans et le cadet 6 ans et scolarisé.
Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne éxpérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.
Son nouveau crédit 365000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer des paniers de poissons séchés secs et frais. Mais également des sacs de légumes qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du marché central de la ville.
Son 9 crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité génératrice de revenus.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants mais également de renforcer ses épargnes dans le but de payer un véhicule de transport à son mari qui est embauché comme chauffeur actuellement par une tiers personne.
texts.en:
Aida has been a member of her local "banc villageois" since its first loan cycle. She is married and the mother of ten children, five boys and five girls. Her oldest is 27 years old and her youngest is six years old and attends school.

Aida has excellent experience in her field due to having been a merchant for quite some time. Her new loan of 365,000 XOF will allow her to purchase baskets of dried and fresh fish. Aida also plans to buy sacks of vegetables that she will resell at the city's central market.

Aida's ninth loan will help her to expand her business. The income she earns will help Aida to pay for the nutrition, health and education of her children.
