loans.use: to purchase more items for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt, and vinegar.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en: Gemalyn is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. To make a living, she raises hogs to sell for a profit. She has had her business for over a year now and earns about 2,000 PHP for each hog. She would like to keep selling healthy hogs. For this reason, she is asking for 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. Some day, Gemalyn hopes to keep making better sales and have stable profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco, tiene la edad de 62 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y los tres hijos actualmente. El quiere compra almacigo para la resiembra de su cafetal y también algunos insumos. El cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es resembrar las zonas más dañadas para así aumentar la cosecha próxima y crecer como un caficultor de la zona. El pretende con estas mejoras generar mayor producción de café y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marco, 62, is married and lives with his wife and three children. He wants to buy seedlings to resow his coffee plantation as well as some supplies. 

He depends on the soil and wants to resow the most damaged areas to increase the next harvest. He wants to become a bigger coffee grower in the area. 

With these improvements he aims to increase coffee production and also generate income in order to keep moving ahead and improve his well being. 

This is the first loan he receives from FUDECOSUR. He has no previous state-run bank loans. FUDECOSUR easily gave him a loan with a low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies and coffee.

loans.name: Koamivi

texts.fr: Père d’un enfant de 02ans, Koamivi est mariée à une revendeuse. Il est frigoriste de profession et a ouvert en 2005 son atelier dans lequel il sert ses clients. Afin d’acheter des pièces de recharge pour la climatisation automobile, il fait un deuxième prêt à WAGES. Son désir est d’agrandir la taille de son activité et d’assurer le bien –être de la famille. Il est âgé de 32ans.
texts.en: Koamivi is a father to a 2-year-old child, and is married to a reseller. He works as a refrigeration and air-conditioning technician, and in 2005 opened his workshop where he provides services for his customers. In order to buy car air-conditioning spare parts, Koamivi has requested a second loan from WAGES. He hopes to be able to expand his business and ensure the wellbeing of his family. He is 32 years of age.

loans.use: To buy car air-conditioning spare parts.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está casada,  vive con sus tres hijos y el esposo  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar tela para hacer la ropa del uniforme para que puedan hir a la escuela y además los cuadernos, lapiceros, maquinillas y los bolsos para llevar los útiles. Ella lo que quiere es que los hijos puedan estudiar para que puedan tener un mejor futuro y una mejor calidad de vida, ya que ellos son de bajos recursos y la única herencia que les pueden dar es el estudio para que se puedan defender en el futuro, es por eso que ella solicita. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Zaida, 35, is married and lives with her husband and their 3 children.  With this loan, she plans to buy fabric to make school uniforms for her children, and also notebooks, pens, pencil sharpeners, and school bags to carry the supplies.  Zaida wants her children to study so that they can have a better future and a better quality of life.  She and her husband have limited resources; the only inheritance that she can give them is an education, so that they will be able to provide for themselves in the future.  This is why she is requesting this loan.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She hadn't taken loans with the state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided her with a loan with better payment terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 42 years old and married with four children. She raises hogs and usually makes 2,000 PHP for each hog sold. She spends her profits on school allowances and as revolving capital in her business. With a loan of 10,000 PHP, Nenita will buy feed and vaccinations for her hogs to increase her profits.  

Ensuring the healthy growth of her hogs helps Nenita to sell them at a higher price and someday lead her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccinations for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Azhar Saeed

texts.en: Mr. Azhar Saeed is a 42 year old man. He runs an auto repair shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is the only source of income for his family. He is an honest and hardworking person. Presently he is interested in purchasing spare parts like nuts, wheels, and screws for his auto repair shop. For that he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his shop and improve family's future life.

loans.use: To purchase screws, nuts, wheels etc. for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, carismática y con ganas de superación, es esposa de Richard con quien tiene 3 hermosos hijos y actualmente se encuentra embarazada de su 4 bebe. Vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia lo cual lo construyó con el apoyo de su pareja.El trabajo que realiza Isabel es la venta de prendas  para damas, caballeros y niños . Realiza el trabajo desde su hogar , lugar a donde llegan sus clientes a ver las ultimas novedades en cuanto a moda se refiere . Empezó a desarrollar esta actividad con su propio capital económico, todos los productos lo envía su primo desde otra ciudad en donde encuentra las prendas de vestir a precios bajos. Realiza este trabajo desde hace 7 años y en todo este tiempo logró ser reconocida entre sus clientes quienes compran sus productos de manera continua.Asimismo, considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que obtiene dia a dia .Por otro lado, comenta que se inició en éste negocio por el deseo de contar con un ingreso propio, sentirse independiente y no depender de los ingresos de su pareja, así como el poder apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar, en todo este tiempo ha tenido buenos resultados. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles para la compra de ropa como polos , blusas ,prendas interiores, camisas y pantalones de diversas tallas y modelos para damas, caballeros y niños.
A su vez omenta estar agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Isabel, 38, is an enterprising woman who is charismatic and has a strong desire to succeed.  Her husband is Richard, and together they have 3 beautiful children.  Right now, she is pregnant with their 4th child.  Isabel lives with her family in her own home, which was built with the support of her husband.  

Isabel has a business selling clothing for men, women and children.  She does this work from her home, where her customers come to see the latest trends in fashion.  She started up this business with her own financial capital.  Her cousin sends all her products to her from another city, where he can buy the garments at low prices.  

Isabel has been doing this work for 7 years, and over this time she has managed to become well known by her customers, who buy from her regularly.  Also, she considers her business to be quite profitable, as it generates daily earnings.  She comments that she started this business because she wanted have her own income, feel independent, and not rely on the income of her partner.  She also wanted to contribute toward the household expenses.  Over all of this time, she has had good results.  Right now, she is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian soles to buy clothing such as: polo shirts, blouses, underwear, shirts, and pants in a variety of sizes and styles for men, women and children.

She comments that she is grateful for the opportunity to access a line of credit in order to carry out her plans, and she promises to make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a vendor living at Manalo with her child and her spouse. She cooks and sells food for snacks and daily meals. She also raises hogs to sell for profits. She manages her businesses well to gain income for the family's sustenance. 

Mary Ann is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy meat, vegetables and other ingredients to cook and sell for her business. 

Mary Ann hopes to continue to make a good profit in her businesses to achieve a simple and better way of living.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and other ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Nelita has been in this business for ten years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nelita aspires to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Ubay, Bohol. Emelia works in the food vending business, selling a variety of home-cooked foods to the people in her neighborhood.

Emelia is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings. With the additional food, she will cook and sell more items, increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings for her food vending business.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor (Faith and Love) 2. Her group is located in Santiago, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business.

Maria is excited to receive her 9th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She has been running her business for around five years. She started selling groceries in a small stall and now, she is running a 'colmado' (small food market). This loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, eggs, rice, beans and other goods. She will use the profit to reinvest in her business. She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, flour,  vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is the operator of a motorcycle transportation business. It's been four years and three months since she began her business. Nena has also engaged in direct selling and the farming business. She is married to an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and has been blessed with three children. Nena would like to help her husband in generating funds. That's the reason why she patiently manage her businesses in order to generate additional income.

Nena aims to have a better way of life, educate her three children and have a stable source of income. To make all these things realistic, she is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP17,000. This loan amount will allow her to renew the registration of her motorcycle and some amount will be used in buying sprockets to avoid any trouble in transporting passengers. She hopes to get this loan amount in order to maintain the safety of her passengers and gain a better income. Nena is looking forward to approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to be used in renewing the registration of her motorcycle and in buying sprockets for her transportation business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a resident of the Nkubu area in Central Kenya. She is aged 49 years and has been in the farming business for twenty years growing mainly maize and beans. She is married with four children, they are all adults. Her main farming produce and source of income has been maize but she is focusing on diversifying this.

Julia has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy dairy goats. She says the venture into dairy farming will help improve her farming income. She reiterates that the loan will open ways for her to grow her farming business toward buying dairy cows in the future.

Julia mentions pests and diseases as the major challenges she faces but believes dairy goats are more resistant to drought and will help improve her living standards.

She says she chose Juhudi Kilimo since she believes it is the best micro finance institution.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats

loans.name: Yelian Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YELIAN est formé de sept personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Jeanne Béatrice, est âgée 42 ans. Jeanne Béatrice est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Jeanne Béatrice est mariée à un certain Hubert. Le couple à treize enfants à leur charge, dont six représentent leurs propres enfants. Jeanne Béatrice et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Jeanne Béatrice a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Jeanne Béatrice vend des produits congelés, des vivres et du charbon de bois à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Jeanne Béatrice désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Jeanne Béatrice sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe YELIAN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
YELIAN is a group which comprises seven women who live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative, named Jeanne Béatrice, is 42 years old.  She is also the group member raising her hand in the photo.  She is married to a man named Hubert.  Together, they have thirteen children in their care, six of whom are their own children.  Jeanne Béatrice and her husband live with their children and jointly take care of the various household expenses.  Jeanne Béatrice left school at the primary level.

Jeanne Béatrice sells frozen products, food supplies and charcoal from her home, an activity which allows her to meet her family's needs without any major difficulty.  Eager to better satisfy her customers' needs, she would like to strengthen her activity.  In order to do so, she is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the YELIAN group.

loans.use: to buy frozen products, food supplies and charcoal.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Juan reside en la cuidad  de Masaya, cuna del folklore Nicaragüense, es soltero y tiene la edad de 22 años, comerciante, su núcleo familiar es de 5 personas su mama y tres hermana. 

Juan posee su propio negocio, y consiste en una línea de ropa, electrodomésticos y cosméticos. Lo inicio con el propósito de ayudar con ingresos al hogar ya que su mama es madre soltera y necesitaba  apoyarle en la compra de los medicamentos por su enfermedad.
 
Su clientela pertenece a Masaya y Nandaime municipio al que tiene que viajar para ofertar sus productos, trabaja por encargo, el cliente le solicita el producto y el posteriormente se lo lleva.

 El adquiere sus productos en el mercado municipal de Masaya. Actualmente esta teniendo mucha demanda motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo que le ayudara a incrementar su negocio y por ende sus ventas. 

El crédito lo usará para la compra de paca de ropa usada, Shampoo para niño, crema para manos, crema para cabello, polvo compacto.
texts.en:
Juan resides in the city of Masaya, cradle of Nicaraguan folklore.  He is single, 22 years old and he is a merchant.  His family nucleus is made up of five people including his mother and three sisters.

Juan has his own business and it consists of a line of clothing, household appliances and cosmetics.  He started it with the purpose of helping with the household income since his mom is a single mother and he needed to support her in the purchase of medicines for her illness.  His clientele belongs to Masaya and the municipality of Nandaime to which he has to travel to offer his products.  He works by orders, the customer requests the product from him and later he takes it to them.  He purchases his products in the municipal market of Masaya.  Currently he is having a lot of demand, which is why he is requesting a loan that will help him to increase his business and therefore his sales. 

He will use the loan for the purchase of a bale of used clothing, children’s shampoo, hand cream, hair cream and compact powder.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothing, children’s shampoo, hand cream, hair cream and compact powder.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 35, lives with his wife in Nkubu in Central Kenya He has been farming for ten successive years producing mainly cereals and dairy farming.

Charles has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to build a modern dairy unit, called a zero grazing unit, for his dairy cows. He hopes it will help protect his animals and improve their production capacity, hence improving his farming income.

He mentions that the main challenges to the farming business are the lack of animal feeds, crop pests and animal diseases. He hopes to improve his family living standards by improving his farming business.

loans.use: To buy materials for the construction of a modern enclosure to protect his dairy cows.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a father of two children, and their ages are eighteen and four years. They are both in school. Henry is 41 years old and has ten solid years in active farming in his home area. Besides farming, he runs a retail business at the local market.

Henry has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help improve his farming business. He will use the loan to buy a chuff cutter and construct a dairy unit for his cows. He says the improved farming income will help him give a better education to his children and improve his family's living standards substantially.

Henry mentions lack of rain, animal diseases, and pests as the main challenges farmers grapple with. He says he chose Juhudi Kilimo for funding since it is the best loan institution for smallholder farmers in the area.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit and buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Luis Alejandro

texts.es:
El joven Luis, es originario  del municipio de Masaya, es soltero, con 22 años de edad, su núcleo familiar se compones  de 4 personas (su padres y un hermano). 

comerciante, Su negocio  tiene 3 años de tenerlo y consiste en la venta de Ropa usada y perfumes, este último producto sale a comercializarlo casa por casa en toda la ciudad de  Masaya.

 Este negocio lo inicio con el propósito de contar con ingreso para continuar estudiando y aspira a convertirse en un profesional, en el día sale a vender y por la noche acude a la escuela.

Como le ha funcionado el negocio, desea invertir en más mercadería a través de un financiamiento  que le permitirá comprar  zapatos para hombre, zapatos de niño, licuadora, bolso de dama, mochila para niño, DVD, cosméticos cubrecama, perfumes variados, nintendo.

 Cabe mencionar que los sueños de él es superarse, tener un mejor nivel de vida  para con su familia para ir  mejorando las condiciones de su casa y así contar  con un hogar digno.
texts.en:
The young Luis is a native of the city of Masaya. He is single and is 22 years old. His nuclear family consists of 4 people (his parents and a brother).

He is a businessman. He has had his business for 3 years. It consists of selling used clothing and perfumes. He goes out to sell this last product door to door in the whole city of Masaya.

He began this business with the objective of having income to continue going to school. He hopes to become a professional. In the day he goes out to sell, and in the evening he goes to school.

Seeing how the business has worked out for him, he wants to invest in more merchandise through a loan, which will allow him to buy men's shoes, children's shoes, blenders, women's bags, children's backpacks, DVDs, cosmetics, bedspreads, various perfumes, and nintendos.

It is worth mentioning that his dreams are to better himself, to have a better standard of living for his family, and to continue improving the conditions in his house and thus have a worthy home.

loans.use: to buy men's shoes, children's shoes, blenders, women's bags, children's backpacks, DVDs, cosmetics, bedspreads, various perfumes, and nintendos

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 56 years old and she is a widow. She has a daughter. She has a kiosk in the market. She is now applying for a $ 1000 loan from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such such as, oil, cigarettes, slippers, onions and garlic. 

She opened her kiosk in 2003 with her own working capital of $50.00. She is making a good income. She has paid her first loan of a $600.00 on time and this is her second loan. She is a good customer.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, oil, cigarettes, slippers, onions and garlic.

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es:
José Armando es originario de la linda ciudad de Matagalpa es casado y tiene un hijo en edad escolar. José se caracteriza por ser una persona de buenos valores morales con la misión y visión de darle una mejor vida a su familia.
Actualmente es trabajador de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace más de seis años desempeñándose como operador de equipo. Con los ingresos que obtiene en su trabajo lo aporta para él los gastos del hogar y para la educación de su hijo.

Con el financiamiento que solita José tiene destinado invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento y ladrillo ya que está realizando  ampliación en su vivienda.
texts.en:
José Armando is a native of the beautiful city of Matagalpa. He is married and has a son of school age. José is characterized as a person of good values and morals with the mission and vision of giving a better life to his family.

He has now worked for more than six years for a water and sewer service business, where he is an equipment operator. The income that he obtains from his work goes to support the household expenses and the education of his son.

With the loan that he is applying for, José is going to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, and bricks, since he is enlarging his home

loans.use: to buy construction materials: bricks, sand, and cement

loans.name: Ja-Cob Group

texts.fr: JA-COB est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Sènami Olufunmilayo (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Sènami Olufunmilayo est mariée à un certain Gilles et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Sènami Olufunmilayo vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Sènami Olufunmilayo n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de vingt ans que Sènami Olufunmilayo mène comme activité la vente de bijoux (boucles d’oreille, chaines, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Sènami Olufunmilayo mène cette activité afin de pouvoir à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de ses enfants. Sènami Olufunmilayo s’approvisionne au Nigéria et dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sènami Olufunmilayo sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupe JA-COB. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
JA-COB is a group which comprises three women who are friends.  The group's representative, Sènami Olufunmilayo (raising her hand in the photo), is 34 years old.  She is married to a man named Gilles and the mother of two children who both attend school and are the couple's dependents.   Sènami Olufunmilayo lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.   

Sènami Olufunmilayo did not attend school.  For over twenty years now, she has been selling jewelry (earrings, chains etc.) at a market.  She works in this field in order to meet her needs as well as those of her children.  She stocks up in Nigeria and at a market located in Benin.  Eager to satisfy her customers' needs, she is requesting a first loan, along with the other members of the JA-COB group.  This loan will help them to better meet the demand from their customers and will increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy earrings and chains.

loans.name: Satinsa

texts.ru: Сатинса успешно завершила предыдущий проект. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Сатинсы имеется 8 коров и 25 овец.На сегодняшний ежемесячный доход составляет 8,500 KGS. Сатинса обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и бычков.Доходы планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Satinsa successfully completed her previous project.  She now owns eight cows and 25 sheep and makes a monthly income of 8,500 som (KGS).  

Satinsa has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a new loan of 55,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some cows and young bulls.  She plans to use her earnings to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase cows and bulls.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 54 года, мать 4 детей. Дети Гульмиры взрослые и самостоятельные. Гулмира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня хозяйство Гулмиры приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 7 голов овцематок. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 54 years old and the mother of four adult children who now live on their own.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1995, and this activity represents the main source of income for her family.  Having started in this field with a capital of 5,000 som (KGS), she now makes about 8,000 som (KGS) a month from the sale of dairy products.

In order to further develop her business, Gulmira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy seven sheep (ewes).  She plans to invest the revenues from her loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase 7 sheep.

loans.name: Kpemahuton 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPEMAHUTON 1 est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Estelle Assiba est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Estelle Assiba est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Cyrille. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Estelle Assiba a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Il y a près de seize ans que Estelle Assiba exerce comme activité, la vente des produits divers et des produits cosmétiques ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Estelle Assiba désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Estelle Assiba sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KPEMAHUTON 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Kpemahuton 1 group is composed of three persons living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, by the name of Estelle Assiba, is the one raising her hand in the photo. This is the first time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to expand their business. Estelle Assiba is 43 years old; her husband’s name is Cyrille. They have five children, some of whom are in school, and all of whom are in their care. Estelle Assiba has completed only primary school. For almost 16 years, she has been selling cosmetic products and miscellaneous items, which allows her to provide for her family reasonably. In order to better meet customer expectations, Estelle Assiba would like to expand her business. In order to do so, Estelle Assiba, together with the other members of the Kpemahuton 1 group, is seeking her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and miscellaneous items [for resale].

loans.name: Maili

texts.en: Maili is 39 years old. She is married and has one child aged 20. In 2006, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy small chicks for her business. In the future, Maili plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks

loans.name: Luzdina

texts.es:
Luzdina, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ansias de progresar, además es alegre y sociable, le gustan los negocios. Esta divorciada del padre de sus 4 hijos con quienes vive cómodamente en su casa propia .
La ciudad de Pucallpa tiene un clima muy caluroso y esta característica hace que sus pobladores busquen constantemente distintos postres refrescantes, es por eso que Luzdina prepara gelatinas, mazamorras , helados de hielo  elaborados a base de frutas, estos postres  ayudan a la población a combatir la ola de calor que sufren a diario . Estos postres son vendidos en su hogar , lugar a donde llegan todos sus clientes o comensales , los cuales se ha ido ganando con el pasar de los años ya que lleva 5 años en este negocio, tiempo que le ha servido para acentuar el gusto y sabor perfecto que caracterizan a sus postres.Le agrada su trabajo por que puede disfrutar de los momentos en familia ya que no tiene un horario de trabajo fijo .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500 soles para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de postres tales como esencia de frutas, flan, gelatina, envases descartables ,entre otros , a su vez se muestra agradecida por la ayuda financiera brindada por nuestra entidad.
texts.en: Luzdina is a 40-year-old woman with a strong desire to make progress. She is happy and sociable, and she enjoys business. She is divorced from her husband with whom she has four children, who live comfortably in a home she owns. The city of Pucallpa has a very hot climate and this makes it so the inhabitants are constantly looking for distinct dessert refreshments. It's for this reason Luzdina prepares gelatins, mazamorras (a corn-based drink) and fruit-based sorbets. These desserts help the population combat the heat they suffer through daily. She sells these items at her home, where all of her customers and guests have passed by over the years, since she has had the business for five years. Over that time she has perfected the taste and flavor of her desserts. She likes the work because she can spend time with her family because she doesn't have a fixed schedule. She is requesting the loan to purchase the ingredients she needs to make her products, such as fruit essences, flan, gelatin, disposable containers and other items. She is grateful for the financial help provided through our institution.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make desserts.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es habitante y originaria de Estelí es casada tiene 4 hijos pero todos son independientes, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer noble, trabajadora y con mucha entrega a su familia en especial a su progenitores.

Actualmente Francisca trabaja de lunes a sábado en un restaurante desempeñándose en el área de atención al cliente, por más de ochos años demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en su labores.

doña Francisca solicita a ceprodel un crédito, lo va destinar para la compra de medicamento para su papa ya que esto momento se encuentra mal de salud y solo con el financiamiento brindado por kiva va ser posible la compra de esto costoso medicamento.

 A la misma vez Francisca agradece a kiva y ceprodel ya que de esta manera están facilitando el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en: Francisca is a native of Estelí. She is married with four children, all of whom are grown up. She is known as a noble, hardworking woman with a great dedication to her family, particularly her parents. Francisco currently works Monday through Saturday tending to customers at a restaurant. For more than eight years she has demonstrated responsibility and honesty in her work. Francisca is soliciting Kiva partner CEPRODEL for a loan that she plans to use to purchase medication for her father, who at this time is in poor health and only the funding provided through Kiva will make it possible to cover the cost of the medicine. Francisca is grateful for Kiva and CEPRODEL for helping her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase medication for her father.

loans.name: Rosa Esmildia

texts.es:
Rosa Esmildia es originaria de la bella ciudad de  Estelí conocida como la capital del tabaco. Rosa es soltera y tiene un hijo cursando los estudios superiores.

También es importante mencionar que ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y con el buen ánimo de luchar por su familia.

Actualmente es trabajadora de una empresa de correo de Nicaragua desde hace mas de nueves años con los ingresos obtenido en su trabajo lo destina para los gasto del hogar, gasto universitario de su hijo entre otros.

El financiamiento que solicita lo destinara para la compra de una computadora, ya que es una herramienta de gran utilidad para que su hijo pueda realizar sus trabajos universitarios.
texts.en: Rosa Esmildia is a native of the beautiful city of Estelí, known as the tobacco capital. She is single and has a son attending college. It is also important to mention that she is known as an enterprising woman with a strong desire to fight for her family. She has worked for a Nicaraguan mail company for more than nine years, and she uses the money she makes to pay bills and cover her son's education, among other things. She is requesting a loan to purchase a computer for her son, since it will be a great tool for his collegiate studies.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es un mujer de 30 años de edad casada, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación, junto a su esposo tienen 3 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela, ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura en la siembra de maíz, frijoles, hortaliza, Chile dulce, pepino, etc. ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que sus padres eran de bajos recursos y no pudieron apoyarla, pero desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar la tierra dicha actividad fue enseñada por su padres hoy en día junto a su esposo agregando otros productos para la siembra. su producto es vendido y comercializado en los alrededores de su vivienda, en el mercado local y con algunos intermediarios mismos que califican su producto como un producto sano, no contaminado, ni adulterado con químicos u otros que hagan crecer de una forma acelerada. La tierra que ellos trabajan no es de forma propia ya que donde ellos viven alquilan y al mismo tiempo el propietario les ayuda con el permiso y consentimiento de trabajar la tierra para suplir sus necesidades como alimentación, vestimenta, medicina y principal mente los estudios de sus hijos.

Norma necesita ayuda para la compra de una bomba de riego electrónica la cual le beneficiara mas que la bomba que ellos tienen actualmente, ya que su funcionamiento es a bese de combustible y debido a la alza e inestabilidad de este producto los costos se le incrementan y no logran ver ganancias.

Sus sueños son poder ver a sus hijos graduados en un nivel universitario para que tengan mejores oportunidades de empleo, mejores ingresos y tengan un mejor estilo de vida, como también seguir apoyando a su esposo a diario en sus ideales y salir adelante juntos como familia.
texts.en:
Norma is a 30 year old woman and is married. She is a fighter, a businesswoman and has a lot of desire to get ahead. Together with her husband, she has three children who are studying in school. She and her husband work in agriculture planting corn, beans, vegetables, sweet chiles, cucumbers, etc. She does not have any education because her parents had very few resources and were not able to support her, but she learned to work the earth when she was very young. Her parents taught her this activity. Today she, together with her husband, are adding other products for planting. Their produce is sold and marketed in the areas around their home, in the local market and through brokers who certify their produce as healthy, without contamination and not treated with chemicals or other items that make them grow at an accelerated rate. The land that they work on is not their own property because they rent where they live. At the same time, the owner helps them by giving them permission to work the land to provide for their necessities like food, clothes, medicine and most importantly, the studies of their children. 

Norma needs assistance to purchase an electronic irrigation pump. It will benefit them more than the pump that they have right now because the current one uses combustible fuel and, due to the rise in pricing and instability of this fuel, it increases their costs and prevents them from getting earnings. 

Her dream is to be able to see her children graduate from a university so that they can have better employment opportunities, better earnings and a better lifestyle and also to continue supporting her husband each day according to their ideals and to get head together as a family.

loans.use: to buy an electronic irrigation pump for her crops.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. Two children are in school.

Marissa buys and sells livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan to purchase additional livestock to sell. Marissa has owned her business for 11 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Carolina Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Carolina vive en la cuidad de Managua, es casada y tiene tres hijos menores, ella tiene una pulpería en su casa que la atiende para ayudar en los gastos familiares y sus gastos de estudios en la  universidad, ya que ella estudia la carrera de derecho para poder superarse y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familiares al realizarse como profesional.

Es por esta razón que esta solicitando a kiva y ceprodel un crédito para invertirlos en el pago de su titulo universitario y gastos de su  Monografía.
texts.en: Carolina lives in the city of Managua, is married and has three young children. She runs a convenience store out of her home to help with household bills and her college expenses. She is studying for a law degree to be able to move up in life and improve her and her family's quality of life once she becomes a professional. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner CEPRODEL to pay for her college degree and cover monograph expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her college degree.

loans.name: Jolito

texts.en:
Jolito is a 44-year-old man from Garcia, Bohol. He has worked in the sari-sari or variety store business for one year now. He sells detergent, soft drinks, shampoo, soy sauce and vinegar. His store is his only income and used to meet his financial needs.

Jolito is requesting a loan to buy items such as canned goods, toiletries, noodles, coffee, sugar, soft drinks and food snacks. He will then sell more in his neighborhood, and his income will increase. In the future, Jolito hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, toiletries, noodles, coffee, sugar, soft drinks and food snacks to sell in his store.

loans.name: Sani Maya

texts.en:
Sani Maya is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, ages 20, 22 and 23.  In 2000, she established her goat raising business.  Sani Maya sells goats and their milk in the local market. Sani Maya currently owns five goats.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

Sani Maya has successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. This recent loan will be used to purchase baby goats for her business.  In the future, Sani Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy baby goats for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, a 43-year-old married woman, earns her income through her sari-sari or variety store business by selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area. Her greatest dream is to expand her business and to make it a success. As of now, Susan needs a loan to buy additional stocks of items such as canned goods, rice, soda, coffee, milk, other beverages, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit.
Susan also wants to save money for reinvestment in the same venture and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of items such as canned goods, rice, soda, coffee, milk, other beverages, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Josefino

texts.en:
Josefino is a 54-year-old married man from Anda, Bohol. He has four grown children. He has been engaged in the hog-raising business for 10 years now. He sells and raise pigs. He earns 8,000 PHP per month. This is the source of his income.

Josefino is requesting for a loan to buy feed for his pigs. Through this loan, he can supply what his pigs need to grow faster.

In the future, Josefino hopes to expand his business and to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
Noel Hernandez de 47 años, casado, Originario del Municipio de Somotillo, se caracteriza por ser una persona muy trabajadora  con valores morales, responsable, honesto, profesional entregado a su trabajo  y  familia. conformada por   su esposa y sus 3 hijos,  dos menores y uno   saliendo de la secundaria.

Actualmente se acerco a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un préstamo para el pago de la matricula y aranceles del primer y segundo trimestre de la universidad de su hijo que iniciara a estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil y su mayor anhelo y deseo  es que su  hijo sea  un buen profesional en el  futuro, para desarrollo de su familia y municipio.
texts.en: Noel is 47 years old, married and a native of Somotillo. He is known as a very hardworking person who values morality, responsibility and honesty and is devoted to his job and his family. He and his wife have three children, two who are younger and a son who is finishing high school. Recently Noel came to the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan to pay for the tuition and fees of the first two trimesters of college for his son, who will be studying for a civil engineering degree. Noel's main goal and wish is for his son to become a good professional in the future, for the development of the family and the town.

loans.use: to pay for the first two trimesters as his son begins college.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more supplies and merchandise products for her direct selling business. She is in this business for eight years now. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Erlinda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a resident of Nkubu, in Central Kenya, where she lives with her 4-year-old child who attends school. Jacqueline farms wheat, potatoes, cowpeas, maize, and beans. She also runs a salon. She is 29 years old and has been in farming for three consecutive years.
Jacqueline has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy birds for a poultry farming business. She says the loan will help to improve her farming income, which she will use to educate her child.
Jacqueline mentions inadequate funds and drought as the main challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Balai Rakyat 9 Group

texts.en:
This group, "Balai Rakyat 9" from North Jakarta, is asking for its fourth loan from VisionFund. It is thanks to the efforts of each and every one that they are getting ahead. The group is very united.
One of the members of the group is Helena. Her husband passed away a few months ago. She has a business collecting used plastic and used metal to recycle. She has been in this business for 6 years. From this income, she can repair her house. She is very excited to run her business because she can help the old men who collect the used plastic and metal also. Usually, she buys 100 sacks every week. Now, she has seven sellers. Sometimes she worries about the value of the dollar being down because it will be reflected in the cost of her goods. With her business, she is growing and helps her family. Her wish for the future is to open a salon and a traditional restaurant. She has a dream of sending her child to study teaching.
Helena is asking for this loan to buy goods, such as used plastic cups, plastic beverage bottles, and used metal.

loans.use: to buy used plastic and metal materials from the people who collect it.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Judith works hard to support her family.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconuts. Judith is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dianah

texts.en:
Dinah is a resident of Nkubu and is married with one child of schooling age. She has been in farming business for seven years with tea being her main produce for the local market. She is aged 40.

Dinah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry birds. She says this will help diversify her farming income sources and ensure continuous flow of the same. She plans to buy more parcels of land for more commercial farming.

Dinah is glad doing farming business and funding through Juhudi, and she believes she will give a better education to her child.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luisa, 54, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, an employee, and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Luisa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Luisa dreams to give her children a good life and future and hopes to expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya where he lives with his wife and 1-year-old child. He has been in farming for five successive years and currently sells milk to the local market to meet his family’s basic needs. He runs a tailoring business within the local market for additional income.
Joshua has requested a loan of 25,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutter, which will ease the feeding process on his farm. Joshua plans to expand his dairy business and to rank among the main suppliers for the local market.
Joshua says he chose Juhudi Kilimo for the loan because he has seen the lives of smallholder farmers being transformed through such loans.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 59-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has engaged in the sari-sari or variety store business for five years now. She sells detergent, soap, coffee, sugar, canned goods, and shampoo. This is the source of her income and for the rest of their needs.

Letecia is requesting for a loan to buy additional canned goods, coffee, sugar, bread, shampoo, detergents, and milk. These items will help her to gain more income. Through this loan, she can buy such items and sell them in her store. 

In the future, Letecia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, coffee, sugar, bread, shampoo, detergents, and milk.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business of selling used clothes (jeans, trousers). She has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on wholesale and retail.  Her major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to import used clothes and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Rorotan Indah Group

texts.en:
This group of seven women was created during the first cycle of the "Rorotan Indah" and groups together women from the same village and surrounding villages, united by strong social and professional bonds. 

The group leader, Salminah, is standing third from the left of the photo, dressed in a pink blouse. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Salminah has been selling children's snacks and fried snacks for two years. Her new loan of 2,000,000 IDR will allow her to buy instant drink, children snacks, and some boxes of instant noodles. The profits generated by her business will enable her to take care of her children's food, education, and health needs. Sometimes she faces the trouble from the weather if she sells ice and sometimes she doesn't sell all of her goods and they are wasted.

loans.use: to buy instant drink, some boxes of instant noodle, and children's snacks

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Mr. Akram is running a small hotel in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This hotel is the only source of income for his family. He is a father of four children and all of them are students.

Mr. Akram has requested for a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase variety of products for his hotel. With the loan amount he will purchase flour, sugar, oil, pulses, rice, and variety of vegetables. 

He is hopeful that the loan will bring out positive changes in his family's life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil, pulses, rice, and variety of vegetables for a hotel business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy, 56, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alvin and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Nancy maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nancy hopes that her business will grow bigger, and she dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda is a hog raiser within her own village. She has had this kind of business for seven years. Gained income from her hog raising business goes toward their daily consumption, is invested in her new business of direct selling, and some amount was used to finance her 1 hectare of rice field.

Bernalda is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), which will be used in ensuring proper nutrition of her hogs. She will use her requested loan in buying livestock supplies such as hog feed,vaccines and vitamins for her hogs. She knows that through sustaining her hogs with proper nutrition, she could make them healthier upon reaching their maturity period. In addition, she could obtain better income enabling her to improve her way of life and make it progressive business.

loans.use: to buy livestock supplies such as hog feed, vaccines and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than six years now together with her husband. Helen is asking for a loan to buy fertlizer and pesticide for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and eventually, their harvest.

In the future, Helen has hopes of making her business a success and saving money for the schooling of her three children.

loans.use: to buy fertlizer and pesticide for the farm.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda, de 46 años es una mujer alegre y saludable. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Jhonatan y Milton, a los que cuida en la casa rustica que heredó hace 18 años. Posee terrenos agrícolas en el valle, muy cerca de la población, eso es una ventaja para la comercialización, el trasporte y mantenimiento de sus terrenos. Según comenta desde muy joven aprendió todo lo necesario para ser una buena agricultora, de eso ya 18 años. “En ese entonces no contaba con terrenos propios, alquilaba o me asociaba con otros agricultores”, comenta. 
Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas, cebada, quinua y alverja, los cuales cuida todos los días sin descanso conjuntamente con la actividad de ganadería que también desarrolla. En la actualidad sus hijos se encuentras creciendo y espera poder brindarle la mejor educación superior, por lo que planea aumentar la producción de sus alimentos sembrando en mayores cantidades y mejorando su ganadería que le brinda ingresos extras.Este es el primer crédito con MFP, se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero recibido pues le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Promete ser puntual cpn el pago de  sus cuotas . Olinda esta solicitando S/. 1000 soles , con el cual comprará sacos de abono orgánico, pues muy pronto sembrará papa y otros tubérculos.
texts.en:
Olinda is 46 years old and a cheerful and healthy woman. She lives with her two sons: Jhonatan and Milton, who she raises in her rural house that she inherited 18 years ago. She has farmland in the valley, very close to the town. This is an advantage for marketing, transportation, and maintenance of her land.

She says that when she was very young, she learned everything necessary in order to be a good farmer, as she has been for 18 years. 

“At that time, I didn’t have my own land; I rented or went into partnership with other farmers,” she says. Her main crops consist of potatoes, beans, barley, quinoa and peas, which she cares for every day without rest, together with the livestock farming that she also does. 

Currently, her children are growing, and she hopes to be able to give them the best higher education. Because of this, she plans to increase production of her food crops in greater quantities, and increasing her livestock that will give her extra income. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She feels grateful for the financial support that she received, as it will help her to improve her earnings and increase her working capital. She promises to be punctual with the repayment of her quotas. 

Olinda is requesting S/. 1000 soles, with which she will purchase sacks of organic fertilizer, because very soon she will be planting potatoes and other root vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Vieira

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos, 2 dos quais ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.
É negociante e dono do seu próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, arroz, peixe, refrescos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para auxiliar no transporte da sua mercadoria, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é investir mais no seu negócio para obter mais lucros e pagar devidamente o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Married with 4 children, 2 of whom are still attending school, Vieira lives in his own home and does not support anyone apart from his children.
He is the owner and sales person of his own retail business, selling various products. He intends to buy more product with this loan (such as peanuts, rice, fish, soft drinks and others) to increase his available merchandise.  
In the future, he wants to expand his house and buy a car to facilitate transportation of the merchandise, for this reason he committed to repaying the Hluvuku loan in order to be able to request further loans.  His goal is to invest more in his business, in order to make more profits and pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy products (such as peanuts, rice, fish, soft drinks, and others) to increase the amount of his available merchandise.

loans.name: Kou-Masse Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KOU-MASSE est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Elise, est âgée 39 ans. Elise est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Elise est mariée à un soudeur nommé Guillaume. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Elise et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Elise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elise vend du charbon de bois, du savon liquide et de la bouillie de maïs à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Elise désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Elise sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KOU-MASSE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Kou-Masse group is made up of 3 people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Elise, is 39 years old. Elise is the one with her hand raised in the picture. She is married to a welder called Guillaume. The couple have 4 dependent children, some of whom attend school. Eilse and her husband live together with their children and both take care of the various household expenses.

Elise did not go to school. She sells charcoal, liquid soap and corn porridge from her home, which enables her to meet her family's needs without too much difficulty. Elise would like to strengthen her business, so that she can better satisfy her customers. In order to do this, she is requesting a 2nd loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Kou-Masse group. The previous loan has been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of wheat flour, bags of sugar, bags of charcoal and liquid soap.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil, age 27, operates a polythene bags shop in the Lahore area. He sells plastic/polythene bags, packing boxes, and packing bags of various sizes. He is a young and energetic person who believes in hard work and who doesn't like to waste time. 

He has been running his shop for the past few years and considers it to be a very successful business for supporting his small family. Therefore, he has requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 Pkr from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan in order to purchase more products for his shop. 

He is very thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase polythene bags, packing bags, and packing boxes to offer for sale

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy all the needed items needed in her variety store. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedita dreams to have other businesses and hopes to give her family a good future. Mercedita meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Peter Sankale

texts.en:
Peter operates a motorcycle transport business and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has been engaged in this business for the past three years. He earns an additional income through farming.

Peter serviced his previous loan successfully and the business is doing very well. He is requesting his third loan in the amount of KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd, which he will use to purchase another motorcycle to expand his business and employ another person to operate the new vehicle. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

He has a dream of expanding his business by purchasing more motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: to buy another motor bike for the business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, age 34, sells polythene bags at a marketplace in the Eastland area of Nairobi. She mostly sells to farmers who trade their goods at the same market. She and her husband have two school-going children. She has been in her business for the past three years and it has been profitable.

This is Christine's first loan term, and she plans to use her loan funds to buy a stock of polythene bags to offer for sale. She anticipates generating more income, since the demand from her customers is usually high. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

Christine hopes to expand her business by setting up another polythene selling shop in another market in the region.

loans.use: to buy polythene bags to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her general store.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en: Isidora earns a living through her sari-sari store. She lives with her family in Ubay, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 30 years now. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her area. Isidora is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, chips and biscuits. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, chips and biscuits.

loans.name: Agaliawamu-Nsaamu Gropu Group

texts.en:
Henry, age 31, is a farmer. For additional income, he also trades in fish. His customers are members of his community. His primary business challenge is limited capital. In the picture, Henry is shown with his hand raised. 

Henry and his wife have two small children and a baby. 

Henry would like to expand his vegetable garden and increase its output by buying organic manure. He will make this investment with the loan he is acquiring from Ugafode Microfinance Limited. 

Henry's dream is to build rentals and shops in the near future. He is hard-working and determined.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Sankuya

texts.en:
Sankuya is 31 years old from Ntulele in Kilgoris, which is located in the Rift Valley province in Kenya. He is married and supports a family of four children who are in school.

He is a hardworking man who is determined. He is one of the farmers whose targets are well set.  He operates a small-scale farming operation and comfortably makes an income of KES. 15,000. He has been doing this business for the last nine years.

He is taking his third loan from KADET LTD, to purchase maize seeds and pay laborers since this is the right season for farming. He will be using the anticipated profits to grow the business into a larger scale. His dream is to become a renowned farmer in the region.

loans.use: to purchase maize seed and pay laborers.

loans.name: Blancaflor

texts.en:
Blancaflor is 45 years old, married to a tricycle driver named Roberto and they have three children. To make a living, her spouse provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village while she raises hogs to sell. Together, they generate income to sustain the needs of their family.

Blancafor is aiming for a more profitable business and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy gasoline for the motorcycle and buy hog feed and medicines for sustainability. Additional capital will maintain the businesses and help achieve more profits.

Blancaflor hopes to achieve good profits and earn enough to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the motorcycle and hog feed and medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy biscuits and cold drinks for a canteen business.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Marianne, age 35, runs a sari-sari (general store) business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past nine years and earns PhP 20,000 monthly. She lives in Alicia, Bohol, with her husband and their three children. The eldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 11.
 
Marianne is requesting a loan in order to buy a coffee machine for her store, as well as to purchase soft drinks and other assorted goods to offer for sale. This will help her to gain more profit. With the help of this loan, she can offer a greater variety of items to her customers.
 
In the future, Marianne hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a coffee machine for her store, as well as to purchase soft drinks and other assorted goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has done well in her business after making great sales in the months of December and January. She would like to replenish her stock and expand her business further.

She has applied for her third loan which she will use to buy more stock of shirts, skirts, blouses, trousers, handbags and shoes. She hopes to grow her business and start selling clothes in wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, blouses, trousers, handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is engaged in a mobile store wherein she offers various kinds of vegetables, fruits, charcoal and fish. She has been engaged in this kind of business for four years and two months. Aside from a mobile store, she also engages in livestock, direct selling and vending of second hand RTW's as her additional source of income.

Marita is married with four children. Three of them are still studying and the other one is married. Marita and her husband has been working together in order to earn a greater income. The couple aims to give their three children a quality education and brighter future. With her determination to fulfill it, Marita is seeking additional capital in the amount of PHP 18,000 which will allow her to buy various kinds of vegetables, fruits, sacks of charcoal and fish for her mobile store business. She knows that with this loan, she could further increase her sales and profit. Marita is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of vegetables, fruits,sacks of charcoal and fish for her movable store.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is now a 51-year-old business lady. She is still married to Robert who is now a police man. She has been running her retail shop for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 25,000, which she uses to support her family.

Lucy is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD and she will use the loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, and stationary. With the anticipated profits she will pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and stationary.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita runs a business buying and selling palay (unhusked rice) and bagoong (fish paste) to earn an income. She works hard with the primary purpose of getting her three children out of poverty. Now that she has expanded her family, she is always looking for ways to generate income for her family so that she can cover all their basic expenses. 

Julita is requesting a loan that will provide her with additional working capital in the amount of PhP 50,000, which she will use to purchase palay and bagoong. She is very grateful for the success of her business because she has been able to provide for her family. 

Her goal is eventually to earn a higher income, which will allow her to lift up her family from poor living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase palay (unhusked rice) and bagoong (fish paste) to offer for sale

loans.name: Nadeem

texts.en:
Nadeem, age 39, makes and sells embroidered dresses in his shop, which is located at a primary marketplace in the Lahore area. He established his shop in 2007. He is married and is the responsible father of two children.

Nadeem's shop has proven to be a successful business for supporting his family. He is interested in purchasing embroidery materials such as thread in various colors, a variety of decorative stones, and cloth. For this reason, he has requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 Pkr from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one, both for his business and for his family. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials such as thread in various colors, a variety of decorative stones, and cloth

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina, age 63, is a vegetable farmer. She has been engaged in this business for several years now and it is the source of her income. She lives with her husband and family in Ubay, Bohol.

Marcelina is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable farm. With this investment, she will be able to grow healthy and high-yielding crops on her farm. 

In the future, Marcelina hopes to expand her venture so that it will continue to generate the revenue necessary to meet the needs and expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a vegetable vendor from Ubay, a town in Bohol. She grows some of the vegetables herself and buys additional stocks from neighboring farms in her community to sell at the market. 

Margarita is requesting a loan from CEVI in the amount of PhP 5,000, which she will use to buy more vegetables to offer for sale at the market. With this investment, she will be able to improve her business as well as her earnings. 

Her goal is to increase her savings. 

She is confident that she will repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell at the market

loans.name: Adora Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Fitriah, age 39, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fitriah lives in the village of Bale Kambang east of Jakarta with her husband, who is a driver, and their three children, who currently attend elementary school and junior high school. 

As her husband's income is not enough to fulfill their needs and pay their children's school fees, Fitriah sells ready-to-wear clothing to earn additional income. This is necessary because the children are enrolled in a private school, where school fees amount to 250,000 IDR per month and books cost 500,000 IDR. Fitria has been engaged in her clothing sales venture for three years now.

With the help of this loan, Fitriah and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Fitira will use her share of the loan (2,500,000 IDR) to buy blouses, jeans, long pants, and Muslim fashion items in larger quantities to add to her current stock and to offer for sale.

Her dreams are to establish a shop and to see her eldest daughter become a flight attendant.

loans.use: to buy blouses, jeans, long pants, and Muslim fashion items to offer for sale

loans.name: Dúo La Joya Group

texts.es:
DUO LA JOYA
ESTA CONFORMADO POR DOÑA CARLOTA ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE CHIMALTENANGO. DESDE HACE YA VARIOA AÑOS DOÑA CARLOTA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE EMBUTIDOS Y ES MUY CONOCIDA POR LA LOCALIDAD TIENE PEDIDOS DE CHORIZOS  POR CIENTO A DIARIO Y TAMBIEN MUCHA GENTE LLEGA A SU CASA A COMPRAR SUS PRODUCTOS Y DOÑA ELENA PAR MAS DE DIEZ AÑOS SE HA DEDICADO A LA ELABORACION DE REFACCIONES Y VENTA DE COMIDA. DOÑA CARLOTA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PORQUE QUIERE COMPRAR UN MOLINO DE CARNE PARA QUE SE LE HAGA MAS FACIL LA ELABORACION DE SUS EMBUTIDOS, ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO SOLICITADO.
texts.en:
La Joya Duo

Carlota, who is from San Martin Jilotepeque Chimaltenago, is a member of this group. For several years, Carlota has made a living making sausages. She is very well-known in her community. She has orders for chorizo every day, and many people also come to her home to buy her products.

Elena has made a living making snacks and selling food for ten years.

Carlota has applied for a loan because she would like to buy a meat grinder to make the task of making sausages easier. She hopes that you will be able to help her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a grinder to grind meat and make sausages.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Doña María tiene un negocio de pulpería y de comida corriente, su negocio lo inicio desde hace once años con esfuerzos propios.
Contiguo al negocio de su pulpería tiene un ranchón donde vende comida corriente y refrescos naturales.
