Como comerciante se ha proyectado en mejorar su actividad comercial y necesita de la colaboración financiera para fortalecer su microempresa.
Ella es madre soltera y con deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
María has a small grocery store and fast food business. She started this business eleven years ago with her own effort.

Adjacent to her grocery store, she has a stall where she sells fast food and natural refreshments.

As a businesswoman, she plans to improve her commercial activity and she is in need of financial contributions to strengthen her small business. She is a single mother with a desire to succeed.

loans.use: to buy basic goods such as rice, sugar, beans, and oil.

loans.name: Morayma Ofir De Rosario

texts.es:
Morayma es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha superado varios obstáculos, pues siendo muy joven ya trabajaba en la finca de sus padres, arando la tierra y cosechando los frutos que daban las semillas cultivadas. Ahora ya tiene 52 años, es divorciada, situación que le causó mucho temor en su vida, pero siguió con su vida y ahora vive en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. 
Morayma conoce de agricultura desde que es una niña pero emprendió con esta actividad desde hace 30 años, poco después de haber terminado la secundaria. Invierte todo su día en el cuidado de los cultivos y la venta de los mismos. La dificultad que ha tenido con el crecimiento de su negocio es la falta de capital, sin embargo ha encontrado en Fundación Alternativa mucha agilidad y preocupación por la gente de las zonas rurales. Es por esto que decidió solicitar allí un préstamo para comprar insumos y herramientas que le ayuden a mantener su finca en un estado óptimo, de tal forma que los cultivos no se echen a perder, pues en varias ocasiones la falta de atención a los sembríos, al suelo, a las cercas y demás, ha ocasionado que cantidades grandes de frutas se desechen. Ella espera que con este mantenimiento mejorado que le dará a la finca su producto se genere en mayores cantidades y así poder tener más ingresos de los cuales pueda destinar una cantidad para ahorrar y solventar gastos en sus años de vejez, en los cuales se teme estará sola con el  único sustento de su trabajo. Morayma envía un saludo y mucha gratitud a quienes aportan con sus préstamos en el portal de Kiva  para apoyar los sueños de tantas personas en Latinoamérica y el mundo que han emprendido con sus ideas de negocio.
texts.en:
Morayma is a woman who has overcome several obstacles throughout her life. She began to work on her parents' farm when she was very young, plowing the land and harvesting the fruits of the cultivated seeds. Now she is 52 years old and divorced, a situation which caused her to have fear in her life. However, she continued on and she now lives in the canton of Santo Domingo in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. 

Santo Domingo connects the Sierra region with the coastal region of Ecuador. The city has become a hub of commerce, with many sectors experiencing growth. As a testament to this, many enterprising families who started their small business a few years ago are now small business owners who give employment to the next generation. Studies reveal that the majority of businesses began empirically and have been embraced by tourists, entrepreneurs and travelers who go from one region to another. It is also the third most inhabited city in the country.

Morayma has had knowledge of agriculture since she was a girl, but she started her own business thirty years ago, a short time after finishing secondary school. She invests her entire day in the maintenance and sale of her crops. The difficulty she has had with growing her business is a lack of capital. However, through Fundación Alternativa she has found plenty of flexibility and concern for those who live in rural areas. This is why she decided to apply for a loan through the organization in order to buy supplies and tools which will help her maintain her farm in excellent conditions. This will keep her from losing crops, because on several occasions a lack of attention to the fields, the ground, the fences, and other elements has caused large quantities of fruit to be thrown away. 

She hopes that with the improved maintenance that she will give to her land, her product will generate larger quantities and she will be able to have a better income. She will then be able to save a certain amount to settle her costs in her elderly years, when she is afraid that she will be alone with only the support from her work. 

Morayma sends her greetings and gratitude to the Kiva lenders, who support the dreams of so many people in Latin America and in the world who have set off with their business ideas.

loans.use: to repair and modify her farm to better maintain her crops.

loans.name: Audeliz Ivania

texts.es:
Estimados señores, la señora Audeliz es comerciante de cosméticos en general y recargas  de las compañías claro y movistar desde hace siete años.
Antes de poner su negocio era estudiante de secundaria, y para contribuir económicamente a su hogar decide poner su propio negocio con el apoyo de su mama. 
Actualmente estudia una carrera técnica en contabilidad, y se proyecta en desarrollar su actividad comercial.
Sin embargo necesita un financiamiento para crecer como comerciante y atender la demanda de sus clientes.
Su estado civil es soltero y con un alto potencial de crecimiento socioeconómico.
texts.en:
Dear lenders,

Audeliz is a business woman selling cosmetics as well as phone card replenishments for the companies Claro and Movistar.  She has been in this field for seven years.  Before beginning her business she was a middle school student, and in order to contribute economically to her household she decided to begin her own business with the help of her mother.

Currently she is pursuing a college degree in accounting, and she plans to also continue to develop her commercial activity.  She is single and with high potential for socio-economic growth. However, she needs a loan in order to grow as a business woman and to meet the demands of her customers.  With her loan she will purchase cosmetics like perfume, creme, lipstick, and make-up, and she will also purchase recharge cards for Claro and Movistar.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics like perfume, creme, lipstick, and make-up, as well as phone cards for Claro and Movistar.

loans.name: Igdania Ernestina

texts.es:
Doña Igdania es propietaria de una pulpería donde vende una gran variedad de productos como granos básicos, detergentes, refrescos, cosméticos y ropa.
Necesita de un préstamo para capital de trabajo y mejorar las condiciones de su negocio incrementando sus niveles de venta.
Antes de poner su negocio trabajo en un hotel de las costas del pacifico de Nicaragua, pero al quedar sin empleo inicia su idea de negocio con la que actualmente es un agente económico en su familia.
Su estado civil es soltero.
texts.en:
Ms. Igdania is the owner of a grocery store where she sells a wide variety of products like basic food staples, detergents, soft drinks, cosmetics, and clothes.  Igdania is single.  She needs a loan in order to have capital for her work and to improve the condition of her business by increasing her sales. She will use the loan to purchase basic food staples like rice, sugar, beans and oil.   

Before beginning this business she worked in a hotel along the Pacific coast in Nicaragua.  However, when she found herself laid off, she came up with the idea of the business, which currently allows her to be an economic contributor for her family.

loans.use: To purchase basic food staples like rice, sugar, beans and oil.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija, 39, is from Tiribe, Kenya. She is married and the mother of six children. Two of them, ages 9 and 4, are in her care; the other four are older. 

Hadija works as a farmer, making a living growing maize, wheat and beans. She started her business at the age of 25. She began working with other farmers at a very young age, then decided to work by herself, growing corn and beans for her own family's consumption and to sell to her customers. 

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to pay school fees for the two younger children. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay school fees for two of her children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 33 years old and a secondhand clothing dealer in Mishomuhoroni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of two whose husband makes additional income. She has been in this business for the last seven years and she has done great.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD. Her previous loan was paid successfully and she will use this loan to purchase more bales of secondhand clothes to sell. The anticipated profit will be used to expand her business further. 

She hopes to create job opportunities for the young people who are entering the job market.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Imran Shehzad

texts.en:
Mr. Imran Shehzad is a 35-year-old man. He lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of 5 children. All of them are students.

Since 2000, Imran has been running a small business of rubber making. He makes washing machine rubbers and sells them in the main market. He is a very honest person and always tries to work hard to provide for his family's needs. Presently he is in need of purchasing carbon, zinc and calcium for making rubber. Therefore he has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

He is thankful to all on the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for being so cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase carbon, zinc and calcium for making washing machine rubber.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 30 años es madre de dos niños de 13 y 8 años y actualmente se encuentra embarazada de su tercer niño, vive a lado de su esposo en una casa propia.Ella tiene como trabajo la confección de prendas a base de lycra la cual ella misma diseña y confecciona . Hace poco acondiciono un  pequeño pero muy productivo taller de costura en su hogar ademas las prendas elaboradas las vende al por mayor en algunos centros comerciales de la ciudad. Lleva en este trabajo cerca de 11 años y recibe la ayuda de su hija.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que recibe ingresos diarios, además le permite disponer de su tiempo para descansar . Le gustaría más adelante tener un taller más amplio y con las herramientas necesarias para realizar trabajos de gran magnitud.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles , esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo.Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo tales como telas, hilos de colores, blondas, elásticos, botones, cierres, agujas, además de implementarse con una máquina remalladora para así darle un mejor acabado a sus prendas.
texts.en: Delia is thirty years old and is the mother of two children ages 13 and 8.  Currently she is also pregnant with her third child.  She lives with her husband in their own home.  She works sewing clothing made of Lycra, with patterns that she herself has designed and created.  Recently she arranged a small but very productive sewing shop in her home.  In addition, the clothing that she makes is sold in bulk in some of the commercial centers of the city.  She has been working in this field for about 11 years and she receives help from her daughter.  What she likes most about her work is that she receives daily income.  It also permits her to set her own schedule and have time to relax.  In the future she would like to have a bigger shop with the tools necessary for completing big projects.  At this time she is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency).  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support in order to continuing increasing her capital.  With the requested loan she will purchase materials in order to continue her work, such as fabrics, colored thread, silk and lace, elastic, buttons, zippers, needles, as well as installing a darning machine so that she can put a better finish on her items.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for a livestock business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 49-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has 5 children. The eldest is 26 and the youngest is 9 years old. 

She has been engaged in a food vending business for 20 years now. She sells rice and other foods she has prepared in this area. She earns approximately 6,000 PHP in a month. This is the source of her income and for the needs of the family.

Marissa is requesting a loan to buy rice, meat, vegetables, seasonings and other ingredients. These are what she needs in her business. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy these ingredients so she can start making her meals and selling them.

In the future, Marissa hopes to expand her business. She also wants to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, vegetables, seasonings and other ingredients.

loans.name: Quevic

texts.en:
Quevic is a 27-year-old married woman and the mother of three young children. They live in Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband for more than three years now. Her husband also works as a carpenter. 

Quevic is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these she will be able to improve her rice farming business and eventually their harvest. Moreover, she hopes to expand her business in the future and to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Rosila

texts.en: Rosila is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. Her family lives in Ubay, Bohol. She has operated a rice farming business with her husband for more than five years now. Her husband also works as a carpenter. Rosila is asking for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer for their farm. She believes that this loan could help her to improve her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ivania Francisca

texts.es:
Estimados señores, doña Ivania es comerciante de prendas de oro laminado y cosméticos en general desde hace quince años, con la que ha contribuido significativamente en su familia.
Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes ha crecido como microempresaria, por lo que en estos momentos necesita financiarse para atender algunos encargos de sus clientes.
Es una persona responsable y con deseos de superación personal.
texts.en:
Dear Lenders,
Ivania has been a vendor of gold layered jewelry and general cosmetics for over 15 years, which has contributed significantly to her family.

Thanks to the good service that she gives her customers, she has grown as a small business owner, so that currently she needs financing to take care of some requests of her customers. She is a responsible person with aspirations for personal improvement.

loans.use: purchase gold layered jewelry and general cosmetics

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a 45-year-old businessman. He is married to Corona and they are blessed with four children. Gerald has been buying and supplying green vegetables and dry foodstuffs to learning institutions and some organizations for the past twelve years with a monthly income of about KES 64,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Gerald is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase more green vegetables and dry foods for resale and to pay school fees for his children. 

With the anticipated profit he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to be a wholesale distributor and the most preferred vendor.

loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables and dry foods for resale and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is 47 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She lives in Msambweni, Kenya.

She has a fishing business in the Tiwi and has been in this business for six years. She requested a loan amounting to 25000 KES to buy additional materials for her fishing business, such as paint and a fishing net.

In the future, Mesalimu would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business, such as paint and a fishing net.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn, age 22, is selling different kinds of slippers as a source of income, and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan to buy a stock of slippers that her customers always request. She has been in this business for 11 years, and she is thankful for the ongoing improvement of her standard of living through this business. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough to improve her business as well as for the future education of her child, which was not provided to her.

loans.use: to buy a stock of slippers.

loans.name: Omer

texts.en:
Omer is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is very hardworking. With great effort and dedication he managed to save money and create his business, which today is a store. He works around 12 hours daily. He said that without sacrifice, there is no reward, and if one wants to get ahead, you have to do what you can. 

In order to move forward, he is able to attract his customers because he offers good service. Due to the bad situation in Yemen, his business is unable to increase profits as he did previously, so he applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy fabrics in order to offer a wider variety of products. With this loan, he will be able to have increased profits in order to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in order to offer a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru:
Сафар мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он женат имеет четверых детей. Сафар очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Для него самое дорогое это его жена и дети. Он старается делать все чтобы его семья не в чем не нуждалась. Сафар занимается откормом скота.  Так как он живет в селе этот вид деятельности очень актуальный. Этим видом деятельности он начал заниматься 16 лет тому назад. У него имеется дойная корова которая дает по 10-12 литров молока. Его жена доит корову и производит молочные продукты. Она продает эти продукты своим соседям и знакомым. Таким образом жена помогает своему мужу. Так как это их единственный доход Сафар старается развивать этот бизнес и купить еще одну корову, но на данное время он нуждается в денежных средствах.
 По совету знакомых Сафар решил подать заявку на кредит в организацию Арванд в надежде на осуществление своих планов. На полученный кредит Сафар планирует купить еще одну корову и корм для скота и дальше развивать свою деятельность.
texts.en: Safar is 42 years old and is married with four children.  He is a very kind and hard-working man.  His wife and children are most important to him and he does everything he can so his family has everything they need.  Safar is involved in raising livestock.  Since he lives in a rural village, this line of work is very much in demand.  He started working in livestock 16 years ago.  He has a dairy cow which gives 10-12 liters of milk a day.  Safar's wife does the milking and she makes dairy products, which she sells to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She helps her husband in this way.  Since this is his sole source of income, Safar is trying to increase his business and buy one more cow, but at the moment he is in need of money.  At the advice of of his friends, he decided to apply for a loan with Arvand in hopes of fulfilling his plans.  On receiving his loan, Safar plans to buy one more cow and feed for his animals to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Yasir

texts.en:
Yasir is a 26-year-old man who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2001, he has been running a small electronics shop. He sells a variety of electronic goods in his shop. All of his clients appreciate the quality of goods he delivers. He is a very honest person and always tries to work hard to provide for his family's needs. 

Presently he is in need of purchasing bulb holders, switchboards and cables to sell. Therefore he has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is thankful to all of the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for being so cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase electronic goods like bulb holders, switchboards and cables to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Eva Group

texts.es:
DUO EVA
Este dúo lo forma doña Rosa María, quien nos cuenta que es casada y tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales en su casa desde hace  más de 7 años, ella vende en el mercado de San Raymundo,y tambien en su casa,  ella necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mas animales porque a veces le piden sus clientes y no le alcanzan para surtirles, los chompipes se venden muy bien y cuestan más caros, entonces espera que la puedan ayudar en este momento,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales,(chompipes pollos)
texts.en:
The Eva Duo


Rosa María is a member of this group of two. She says that she is married and has four children who are school students. She has been raising animals at home for more than seven years. She sells at the market in San Raymundo and also from her home. 

She needs a loan in order to invest in the purchase of more animals because sometimes her customers place orders and she is not able to fulfill them. Turkeys are selling well and are more expensive. She hopes, then, for help at this time. She is asking for this loan to buy animals (chickens and turkeys).

loans.use: To buy animals to sell including chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella has been grower of seedless citrus and some vegetables for ten years and two months.She is thankful because through her dedication and hard work, she is able to improve her farm land and increase the number of her citrus trees. 

Estrella would like to maintain her good production of seedless citrus fruit to be able to secure her family's future and obtain a comfortable lifestyle someday. With her aim to have a productive and profitable business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000.This amount will be used in buying three bags of fertilizer and two bottles of pesticides to ensure proper growth of her seedless citrus, free from any diseases.

Estrella believes that her business will continue to grow smoothly because of her proper care and management strategies and the continuous financial support of lenders.

loans.use: to buy three bags of fertilizer and two bottles of pesticides for her fruit farm business

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 37 years old and married with five children; three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lea has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lea has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Lea would like to save enough money to expand her business  and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 39 years old and is a tailor  in Mombasa. She is married and her husband brings in additional income; together they support one child. Angelina has been in this business for the last twelve years and she has done great. 


This being her first loan in KADET  LTD, she will use this money to purchase clothing material and thread for making embroidery and use the anticipated profit to purchase an over-lock machine. She hopes to own a boutique in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material and thread for making embroidery.

loans.name: Haen's Group

texts.en:
Haen, aged 42 and living in a rural village of Kandal Stoeng district, has two children. She and her husband are rice farmers  to make a living. She has been in this business for several years. The current business earns her about US$2 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is a micro loan for Haen’s group of two members who are both female, and she is a fourth-cycle client. The past three loans that she completely repaid have helped her relieve their financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now requesting another loan, Haen, the leader of the group, will use her portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine. She hopes to have a clean, hygienic latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a proper latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Thyy's Group

texts.en:
Thyy, age 55, lives in a rural village in the Sa Ang District. She has four children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. She makes a living as a rice farmer in her area. Thyy and her husband have been in the business for 30 years. She earns about 10,000 riels (KHR) per day which allows her to save about 3,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

This is a microloan for Thyy with Kiva’s partner. She is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a latrine, such as a toilet bowl, tile drainage, etc. Thyy hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a latrine

loans.name: Twizere Group

texts.fr:
Arthémie fait partie du groupe  Twizere et  habite à  Kayanza. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Diomède, un commerçant et agriculteur. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants,âgés de 7mois à 15 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot, farine de manioc,…) depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, farine de manioc,…), à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter un véhicule pour faciliter son commerce,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Arthémie is part of the group Twizere and lives in Kayanza. She is 32 years old and married to Diomède, a merchant and farmer. Together they have five children, from 7 months old to 15 years old; three of them are students.

Arthémie has had a store (rice, beans, cassava flour,…) for eight years. 

She is on her second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many items for her store (rice, beans, cassava flour,…) to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a vehicle to facilitate her commerce and to see her children attend school.

loans.use: to purchase items for her store (rice, beans, cassava flour, …) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 53 years old from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married and the father of four children who are in school. Paul is a farmer and has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd after repaying his previous loans well. He hopes to use the loan to buy farm seedlings and fertilizer. He hopes to become a top farmer in Kitivi area in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Zenaida works hard to support her family. She earns a living by fishing in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 35 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia .El trabajo de Diana consiste en la venta de pescado razón por la cual ha instalado su puesto de ventas en el puerto de perscadores . Se levanta muy temprano para comprar al por mayor sus productos y despues revenderlo a los pobladores por esto selecciona aquellas especies que tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes como “boquichico”, “lisa”, “sardina”, además se abastece de aquellos que no son tan solicitados por el paladar popular pero que tienen muy buen precio en el mercado como “doncella” y “paiche” respetando siempre las etapas de veda.Lleva realizando este trabajo por 5 años aproximadamente y menciona que con esta actividad pudo proveer de alimentación y educación a sus hijos, ahora ella trabaja sola y lo sigue haciendo por que es el único medio que tiene para generar los ingresos de su hogar.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disponibilidad de tiempo para estar con su familia en las tardes a su vez considera que trabajar a su edad ya no es igual que cuando era joven, además siempre fue independiente y se acostumbró a valerse por si misma. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles , está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan por ser  el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y a continuar trabajando de forma responsable como lo ha hecho hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de pescados tales como boquichico , lisa y maparate , ya que se encuentran con mayor demanda en el mercado .
texts.en: Diana is 35 years old. She is married and has 3 children, with whom she lives in a home she owns.  Diana's work is selling fish, and for this she has set up a sales stall in the fishing port. She gets up very early to buy her products wholesale to later sell them retail to the area residents. To do this, she selects the species that are most in demand by her customers, such as boquichico, mullet, and sardine. She also stocks up on those that aren't so much in popular demand but that have a good price in the market, such as doncella  and paiche, always respecting the closed seasons. she has been doing this job for approximately 5 years and she says that with this activity she has been able to feed and raise her children. Now she is working alone and she continues to do so, as it is the only way she has to generate income for her home. What she likes about her job is that she has time to be with her family in the afternoon. she also thinks that working at her age isn't like when she was younger. She has also always been independent and accustomed to doing things on her own. At this time, she is asking for S./ 1000 soles. She is very grateful for this lending opportunity being offered as a financial support she needs to get ahead. She is committed to making her monthly payments on time and to continuing to work responsibly as she has done so far. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy a larger quantity of fish such as boquichico, mullet, and maparate, since these are high in demand in the market.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Descripción	El comité de mujeres de nombre Virgen de Fatima se formo en el año 2007, actualmente está conformado por 24 señoras  que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el ciclo 13, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Marta es parte de este grupo, ella es una persona entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se ha esforzado mucho por crecer y dar a su familia lo que esta a su alcance. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y cuenta que ya se hizo de muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy buenos productos y les da a buen precio. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de toda clase, para poder ofrecerlos a sus clientas y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Description: the women's committee named Virgen de Fatima was formed in 2007. Right now it is made up of 24 women who are working very happily in their 13th cycle together and supportive in the program.  

Marta is a part of this group. She is an enthusiastic person who really wants to get ahead. She has worked hard to grow and give her family what has been within her reach. She sells cosmetics and says that she has established a good clientele because she has always had good products and she gives them a good price. Her goal is to keep working and growing. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying cosmetics of all types, to be able to offer them to her customers and keep working as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Komossi

texts.fr: Komossi est un jeune homme de 27ans. Marié à une couturière, il a 01 enfant âgé de 03ans en charge. Conducteur de taxi moto depuis 2009, il exerce son activité dans les quartiers de Lomé. Il voudrait plus satisfaire les clients c'est pour cela il fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour l'achat d'une seconde moto. Comme perspectives d'avenir, il veut avoir sa famille épanouie et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Komossi is a young man who is 27 years old. Married to a clothier, he has a 3-year-old child to support. A motorbike taxi driver since 2009, he operates in the districts of Lomé. He would like to satisfy his customers further, which is why he is taking out an initial loan from WAGES to purchase a second motorbike. For the future, he wants to have a thriving family and to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette earns a living through operating a sari-sari (variety store) business. She has run her store for more than three years now. This is the source of her income. 

Bernadette is asking for a loan in order to buy items to offer for sale in her store, such as flour, sugar, canned goods, noodles, soap, and toiletries. 

With this investment, she will be able to make more sales and cater to more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy items to offer for sale in her store, such as flour, sugar, canned goods, noodles, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sa Ang district, Sary is 57 years old and married. He has eight children, two of whom are still in school. He and his wife have been farming rice in the local area to support their family for almost 30 years. He is able to earn about 8,000 KHR per day, and manages to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sary is leading his group of three to request his first microloan from Kiva partner VisionFund. He is the leader, and he is going to use his portion of the loan to buy materials for building a decent latrine, such as a latrine bowl, tile drainage, pipes, etc. He hopes this loan will enable his family to have a hygienic latrine and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a decent latrine

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur, age 28, is a young farmer from the village of Akhuryan. He cultivates wheat and potatoes on his farmland, works hard to gather a good harvest, and sells the produce at local markets to earn an income. He and his wife have a young son.
 
Artur has applied for this loan in order to purchase fertilizer for his potato cultivation. It is very difficult for him to cover his family's daily costs while at the same time paying essential farming costs. This is why this loan is very important for Artur, allowing him to be able to gather a good harvest and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his potato cultivation

loans.name: Ngundo

texts.en: Ngundo is 24 years old from Tiribe, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He has owned a grocery and vegetable stall for the last three years. Ngundo has asked Yehu for a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings in order to restock his stall and buy a sack of vegetables and onions. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his income and improve his life.

loans.use: to restock his stall and buy a sack of vegetables and onions

loans.name: David

texts.es: David, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador  y empeñoso,esta casado con Evila y junto a  ella tiene 4 hijos, juntos viven cómodamente en su casa propia .La actividad que realiza David es el dar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su propio mototaxi el es cual es fruto de su esfuerzo, sin embargo la calidad de su vehiculo no es el ideal ya que lo compró usado y requiere ciertas reparaciones.  Le gusta está actividad pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Se inició por la necesidad de contar con un trabajo propio ya que siempre le cerraban las puertas en locales donde se presentaba para trabajar y no podía conseguir un empleo fijo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar sus horarios, además de ser su propio jefe. Tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio comprándose un vehículo de carga pesada ya que el pago es mucho mayor.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para poder refaccionar su mototaxi comprando algunos repuestos y accesarios que necesita para seguir trabajando como llantas nuevas , espejos y tapizado ,además se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos.
texts.en:
David, age 36, is a hard-working and conscientious man.  He is married to Evila, and they have four children.  They live together comfortably in their own house.

David’s business activity is providing passenger transportation services in his own ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  This is his enterprise.  However, the quality of his vehicle is not ideal.  This is because he bought it used, and it needs some repairs.

He likes this business activity.  It allows him to have income with which he is able to pay for the family expenses.  He started out of the need to have his own work.  This is because the doors always closed at the places where he went to work, and he was not able to find fixed employment.

He now feels more secure as he is able to manage his schedule, and he is his own boss.  He has plans to make his business grow by purchasing a heavy transport vehicle because the pay is much greater.

He will now request a loan for 1,000 soles in order to be able to repair his mototaxi.  He will buy some replacement parts and accessories that he needs in order to continue working.  He will buy things like new tires, mirrors, and upholstery.  

He is grateful for the financial help that he has received in order to be able to reach his objectives.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Katupyry” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní.  Todas las integrantes del grupo son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese esfuerzo.
Todas son mujeres de campo y se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, y con eso y sumado a su esfuerzo tratan de ganar el pan de cada día para sus familias. Norma, una de las miembros, solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y con ello poder tenerlos bien para poder venderlos luego.
texts.en:
The group "Kuña Katupyry" is made up of a number of neighbours from the city of Santaní. All of the members of the group are women who are the heads of their households. They are fighting to get ahead and help their families through their work.

All of the women are from the country and work raising and selling farm animals. With this work and effort they hope to provide for their families. Norma, one of the members, is asking for this loan to buy feed for her animals, so that they are in good shape to be sold later.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos es comerciante, se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) hace varios años llevando artesanías de diversos tipos a distintas zonas del país. Vive en pareja con la Sra. Primitiva con quien tiene tres hijos, viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de trabajar decidió emprender su propio negocio y de esta forma fue creciendo de a poco. Ahora ya cuenta con dos motos y  una camionetita, también su negocio ha ido creciendo ya que posee muy buena cantidad de clientes.
El crédito solicitado es para compra de productos como sobrecamas y hamacas, ya que son los que más vende y con ello podrá seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a merchant. He is a street vendor. For several years, he has sold different types of artisanal crafts from different parts of the country. He lives with his spouse, Primitiva, with whom he has three children. They live in Carapeguá now.

Since he comes from a humble family and he wants to work, he decided to open his own business and this way grow little by little. Right now, he has two motorcycles and a pickup truck. His business has also grown and now he has a good number of customers.

He is asking for the loan to buy products such as bedspreads and hammocks. These are what sells the most and with the loan, he can keep filling his customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads and hammocks.

loans.name: Esi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de  savons à domicile madame Esi est mariée à un comptable et a un enfant de 02ans. Elle prépare elle même le savon et revend à ses clients dans la ville de Lomé. Une personne l’aide dans la préparation et elle fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des matières premières (huile rouge et du soda). Après avoir tiré de profit dans la vente du savon,  elle veut voir son activité prendre de l’ampleur et mettre sa famille beaucoup plus à l’aise.
texts.en: A retailer of soap from her home, Esi is married to an accountant and has a 2-year-old child. She makes the soap herself and resells it to her customers in the city of Lomé. One person helps her in producing the soap. Esi is taking out her first loan at WAGES to purchase some raw materials (red oil and caustic soda). After earning profits from selling the soap, she wants to see her business expand and to provide a more comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 'red oil' and some caustic soda to make soap

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
Nget, 39 years old, lives in a rural area in the Sa Ang district, Kandal province. She is married and has three children. Nget and her husband have made a living by farming rice for several years. The current business earns her about KHR 10,000 per day to support the family. 

This is the first loan for Nget with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group members are now applying for a loan of KHR 150,000 each. Nget, the leader, is going to use her portion to buy materials, such as a latrine bowl, tile and pipes for draining, etc., to build a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a hygienic latrine for an improved life.

loans.use: To build a a proper latrine for her family

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn is from a rural village in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. Horn is a 42-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She has struggled to feed her children by farming rice on one hectare of farmland. Horn and her husband have been in this business for several years. 

Horn has just joined Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan of 150,000 KHR each.  Horn is the leader and  will use her portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. She will need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To construct a decent latrine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old, married, and has four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She lives in Tiribe with them and her husband.

Mary runs a general store in Tiribe and has requested a  loan of Ksh.15,000 through Yehu to buy stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, and flour.

She has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, and flour.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Florah, age 53, operates a retail shop in Kapsabet. She has been running her business for a period of 11 years and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. She had her husband have raised five children, now between the ages of 20 and 26 years old.

She is presently requesting her second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd. She intends to use this amount to purchase sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and other such items to offer for sale.

Her primary goal is to expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and other such items to offer for sale

loans.name: Carol

texts.es: Carol, de 30 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad, desde hace mucho trabaja poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño, vive junto a él y a padres en su casa propia.Carol, a diario se dirige a los aserraderos ubicados en los alrededores de la ciudad para conseguir madera de buena calidad y de los precios mas bajos para ponerlos a la venta en el mismo lugar donde los compra, tiene clientes que siempre solicitan su mercancía . Lleva en este negocio un promedio de 5 años y todo le esta marchando de maravilla. Cumple esta labor todos los días y por lo general solo en las mañanas, eventualmente trabaja también tramitando la salida de los camiones de cargas de madera.Esta muy feliz por que  las cosas le están yendo muy bien ya que tiene buenos clientes que a diario lo buscan por la calidad de productos que ofrece, espera seguir trabajando de esta manera y más adelante establecer su pequeño negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por lo que está muy entusiasmado de contar nuevamente con un apoyo crediticio para seguir laborando y poder aumentar su capital de trabajo, ella es conciente que para poder seguir creciendo necesita seguir siendo responsable como lo fue hasta ahora .Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de maderas  que son usadas en construcciones de viviendas.
texts.en: Carol is 30 years old. She is single and has an 8 year old son. For a long time, she has worked to offer her son a better quality of life. She lives with him and her parents in her own house. Carol goes every day to the lumberyards located in the outskirts of the city to get better quality wood at lower prices to sell in the same area where she buys it. She has customers who always ask for her merchandise. She has been doing this business for about 5 years and everything has been going very well. She does her work every day and generally in the morning. Sometimes she also works where the trucks carrying wood go out. She is very happy that things are going well for her, because she has good customers that seek out her quality products she offers every day. She hopes to keep working in this way and in the future open her own small business. At this time, she will ask for S/. 1000 soles. She is very enthusiastic to again have the lending support to keep working and increasing her working capital. She is aware that to be able to keep working she needs to keep being responsible like she has been so far. With the amount she has asked for she will buy a larger quantity of wood used in housing construction.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 43 years old and now a widow. She owns and manages a small restaurant located in a rural community. As it is the main source of her income, she aims to improve and strengthen the business to generate sufficient income to cover their necessities and support the financial needs of her three children. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and other ingredients needed in the restaurant. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve the business and hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and other ingredients needed for her restaurant

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 29-year-old single young man. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has completed his diploma and is employed in aerial surveillance so he is requesting a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him in his work. He hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 25 years old, comes from Naivasha, and is married to James. They have two children, aged seven and five years old, and a one-month-old baby.

Esther has a poultry business and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan well. She hopes to use this loan amount to buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

She hopes to buy a plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy  more  chicks to rear.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude, age 48, is a farmer. She lives with her husband and family in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past 20 years, she has also operated a retail shop business to earn additional income. With the proceeds, she has managed to pay the school fees of her children, who are now enrolled in higher institutions of learning.

Price fluctuation and inadequate capital pose challenges to Gertrude, but she is determined to realize her vision of seeing all her children graduate and acquire reputable jobs.

Gertrude intends to use the loan to pay education costs for her children.

loans.use: to pay education costs for her children

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of Umoja Group in Kakamega South District. She is pictured with 13 One Acre Fund farmers: nine women and four men. Jane is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Jane first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Jane joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Jane described her harvest as good last year but believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and save for the future. Jane’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 6.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Chet's Group

texts.en:
Chet, aged 47, lives in a rural village of the Sa Ang district. He has two children. Chet is a rice farmer to make a living. He and his wife have been in this business for almost 30 years. The current business earns him about KHR 10,000 per day and allows him to save about KHR 2,000 each day after daily expenses. 

This is a micro loan for Chet with Kiva’s partner. He is leading his group of two to ask for a loan. He is going to use his portion to buy materials for building a latrine, such as a toilet bowl, tile drainage etc. Chet hopes this loan will enable him to have a clean latrine for his family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a latrine

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 46 years old. She owns rental houses and a taxi service in Kingorani, Mombasa. She is married and her husband provides additional income. Together they support four people. Susan has been in the rental business for the last seven years, and she has done great. This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to renovate her rental houses; thus, enabling her to fetch more rent and anticipated profit to repay her loan. In the future, she hopes to own several taxis in town.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses to be in good condition.

loans.name: Cadena De Mujeres Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Cadena de Mujeres está en su ciclo número 9 de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas las miembros se encuentran por debajo de la línea de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total. Entre el trabajo que ella hace es la venta de comidas en lo que le está yendo muy bien, ya que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela y está creciendo conforme pasa el tiempo, su sueño es poder tener una gran tienda para seguir creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, huevos y demás, para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, lo cual es su forma de ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called “Cadena de Mujeres” (Chain of Women) is in its ninth cycle of the women's communal bank program.  All of the members were found to be below the poverty line when doing the survey for the elimination of poverty. 

One of the members is Norma.  She is improving her situation of poverty but she is equally aware that this work and effort that she is doing must be continuous and permanent in order to achieve total success.  Among the work that she does in the sale of meals which is going very well for her, as a very good clientele has been made and is growing as time passes.  Her dream is to be able to have a large shop in order to continue growing. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs and so on, to be able to continue making her meals, which is her way of helping her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs and so on.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu, the mother of three school-aged children, is a local villager residing in Kwale District of Coastal Province. She struggles to get food for her family by selling groceries. To supplement her family’s income, she also grows vegetables. This is the first loan for Mbeyu with Kiva's partner Yehu Microfinance. She has managed to use her past income from her farming smartly in order to sustain her lifestyle, cover her children’s education and set aside some money for future needs. For this cycle, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more grocery items to sell including instant noodles, spices, stored foods, etc. She hopes to replenish her grocery items on time and double her income for her children’s sake.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell including instant noodles, spices, stored foods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover half of the cost of an operation for her daughter.

loans.name: Kisakye

texts.en: Kisakye is a 32-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells phone accessories and also has a tender to collect market dues. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees and buy a plot of land. Insufficient electricity supply affects his business. His dream is to buy solar panels and expand his business to new areas. Kisakye intends to use this loan to buy phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Hadi Group

texts.en:
Mariam is the featured borrower of the Hadi loan group. She and her fellow group members joined together to apply for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends and neighbors. Mariam is pictured on the left.

Mariam, age 20 and unmarried, is a teacher. She has been teaching for one year now in order to make her living, cover her basic necessities, and pay for her educational needs. She is applying for a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to pay additional university fees.

Hiba, age 26, is pictured in the middle. She works in a library in order to supplement her husband's income in supporting the family. They have two children. Their daughter Nouri is a year and a half old and their son Hadi is three years old. With her loan funds, she will have necessary maintenance performed on her kitchen ceiling. This will keep her house safe to live in. 
 
Hayat, age 22 and unmarried, has worked in a clothing sales shop for the past two years. She will use her loan funds to purchase necessary medication.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh foods such as cabbages, oranges and passion fruit to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos, vive en casa propia con un acabado de adobe, piso de tierra ocupando una habitación, cocina y baño, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.

El estudió hasta el nivel primario y actualmente se dedica al armado de canaletas con su esposa, ya que tienen que cubrir los gastos de alimentación, vestimenta, agua y luz.

El crédito lo requiere para capital de trabajo, es decir comprar material – aluminio - para canaletas.

El sueño de Carlos es tener una negocio más prospero.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and has four children.  He lives in his own house finished in adobe and a dirt floor with one bedroom, a kitchen, and a bathroom.  The house is located in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz.

He studied through the primary level and currently makes a living making gutters with his wife, because they have to cover their expenses for food, clothing, water, and electricity.

He needs the loan for working capital to buy material--aluminum--for gutters.

Carlos's dream is to have a more prosperous business.

It's the fourth time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the third time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy aluminum to make gutters

loans.name: Amanat Ali

texts.en:
Amanat Ali, age 36, runs a furniture shop in Lahore. He makes and sells furniture to earn a living. This shop is the only source of income for his family.

Amanat Ali has requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 Pkr from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. He will use his loan funds to purchase wood, nails, and iron. This will help him to increase his business and net income. 

With his anticipated profits, he will put aside savings for his children's future. 

He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, and iron for his furniture shop

loans.name: Kreiver

texts.es: Kreiver, de 51 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, solidario y amable, está casado hace 8 años con Dora,con quien tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, junto a todos ellos y su pequeño nieto viven en su casa propia. Kreiver se dedica al servicio de transporte ya que cuenta con un mototaxi que compró con todos sus ahorros . Realiza esta función circulando por las principales calles de la ciudad . Se inició hace 15 años cuando se compró su primera unidad, en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando otras unidades a medida que iban deteriorándose por el uso cotidiano.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Se inició por la necesidad de contar con un trabajo ya que no podía conseguir un empleo estable, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar sus horarios, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra o sufre algunos daños de manera continúa pues le ocasiona muchos gastos que si no los soluciona a tiempo no puede trabajar con tranquilidad, pero aun así logra ver buenos resultados, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su actividad de transporte y espera comprarse otro vehículo para alquilarlo y asegurar su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles y con el monto solicitado refaccionará su mototaxi ya que necesita tapizado y algunos accesorios para que funcione en óptimas condiciones , por otra parte el dinero que sobre lo guardará para la compra de su próximo mototaxi.
texts.en:
Kreiver, 51 years old, is a hard-working, supportive and friendly man. He has been married to his wife Dora for 8 years, with whom he has 3 children who are already over 18. They all live together in their own home, along with his young grandson. 

Kreiver provides transport service with a motorcycle taxi that he bought with all of his savings. He drives along the main streets of the city. He began 15 years ago when he bought his first vehicle. Since then, he has worked repairing other vehicles as they deteriorated through daily use. 

He likes his business because it provides him with an income, which helps him afford his family's expenses. He started out because he needed work, as he wasn't able to find a stable job. Now he feels more secure because he can manage his own timetable and he is his own boss. One the other hand, he says that he doesn't like it when his motorcycle taxi breaks down or gets damaged continually, because these expenses add up. If he doesn't take care of the problems in time he can't work comfortably.

Still, his business has been doing well and for this reason he plans to buy another vehicle to rent out and have more secure earnings. He is asking for 1500 soles, with which he will repair his motorcycle taxi, which needs new upholstery and some parts so that it can work well. He will put any leftover money toward the purchase of his next motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Juan De La Crúz

texts.es:
Juan tiene 23 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. Presta sus servicios en la fuerza armada en el país desde el 2010, decisión que tomo por falta de trabajo en su comunidad, ya que antes se dedicaba a la agricultura y en ocasiones no encontraba trabajo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cemento, hierro, arena, piedra, etc. Para construir su casa, ya que la que posee es de adobe y no presta mucha seguridad a su familia. Él posee una parte del dinero y con el préstamo podrá completar lo que necesita para comprar el material. 

+
texts.en:
Juan is 23 years old. He has a partner and a son. He has been a member of his country’s armed services since 2012, a decision he made because of the lack of jobs in his community. Prior to that he farmed  and was occasionally unable to find work.

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to purchase cement, iron, sand, rocks, etc. in order to build his house since the one he has now is made of adobe and does not provide enough security for his family. He has part of the money he needs, which, together with the loan, will be sufficient to pay for the supplies he needs.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sand, rocks, etc. in order to build a house because the one he has now is made of adobe and does not provide enough security for his family.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children, 9 to 16 years old. She runs a beauty salon that has been in operation for four years and earns a monthly income of KES 14,500. She has applied for a third loan, of KES 20,000, from KADET LTD. She intends to use part of the proceeds to pay school fees for her school-going children, and part to buy a stock of braids and weaves for use in her salon. The profits she earns from her salon will be used to educate her children and repay the loan. Her dream is to ensure that her children get the best possible education.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and buy a stock of braids and weaves for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en: Living in a rural area located in Tiribe, Mombasa, Mupa is married and has ten children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support her family, she has been selling fish locally for four years, while her husband also supplements the family’s income by working for others for pay. This is the first micro-loan for Mupa from Kiva’s partner, Yehu Microfinance. She is applying for a loan of KES 30,000. She is going to use this loan to buy more fish to sell. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income from the current business, so as to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en: Mwero is married and has five children who attend school. He has been a member of Yehu Microfinance since 2012. He buys and sells coal for a living. He started his business with a wooden wheelbarrow, which he still owns. But, over time, he bought other work tools, eventually acquiring an open motorcar for his sales activity and product delivery to customers. The problem is that rainy days pose inconveniences. He is requesting a loan to buy coal to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy coal to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Juan De Díos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 66 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Tiene más de 10 años de trabajar en el muelle trasladando mercadería a las lanchas. Debe de viajar alrededor de siete kilómetros diarios, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cemento, hierro, arena, piedra, etc. Para brindar a su familia más seguridad y comodidad ya que la que actualmente posee no les brinda.
texts.en:
Juan is 66 years old and has two children. He has worked on the docks for more than 10 years, loading merchandise on boats. He needs to travel about seven kilometers a day in order to arrive at his job.

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy cement, iron, sand, rocks, etc. so he can provide his family with more comfort and security because the house they live in now is unsuitable.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, rocks, etc. and provide his family with a more comfortable and secure house, which they currently do not have.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda, from CPG, Bohol, Philippines, is a married woman and the mother of nine children. Imelda has been engaged in seaweed farming with her husband for more than seven years. This is the source of their income. Seaweed is used as a food and as a raw material in making plastic wares, including basins and pails. Imelda is applying for a loan to buy more seaweed seedlings, straw, rope, etc. With this loan, they will be able to improve their seaweed farm and eventually increase their yield.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings and other inputs for their seaweed farm.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 30-year-old married woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells cow ghee (clarified butter), and her customers are mainly hotel operators. Lack of adequate preservation equipment and customers not paying on time affect her profits, and her desire is to become a wholesaler. Sarah intends to use the loan to buy cow ghee to sell.

loans.use: to buy cow ghee to sell.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Ramon  este en su primer ciclo, y están trabajando juntas para salir adelante, doce de estas mujeres en su encuesta de eliminación mostraron estar por debajo de la línea de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felicia es una de estas mujeres del nivel uno, con mucho esfuerzo está trabajando para mejorar su economía y de esa forma ayudar a su familia. Tiene una despensa y está solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser panificados, bebidas, lácteos y demás, ya que con esto podrá seguir con su plan de negocios y seguir surtiendo a su clientela.
texts.en:
"San Ramón" group is in its first cycle and its members are working together to get ahead in life. In a survey, twelve of the group’s members were found to be living below the poverty line.

One of the members is Mrs. Felicia, who is in level one. With great effort, she is working to improve her economic situation and help her family. She has a grocery store and is requesting this loan to invest in buying supplies such as bakery products, beverages and dairy products. With this, she will be able to continue with her business plans and continue serving her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as bakery products, beverages and dairy products.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda offers rice and darak (rice bran) for sale to earn an income. She and her husband have six children, four of whom are grown and married. One is employed as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). The youngest is unable to work and is under medication due to kidney trouble.

Since she has a rice grinding machine, she is able to grind her own darak to offer for sale. This allows her to make additional profits.

Today she is in need of additional capital amounting to PhP 5,000. This will allow her to buy rice and darak to offer for sale within her local community.

She hopes to make her rice and darak retailing business more profitable so that she can save money for the purchase of medication for her youngest child as well as to improve her way of life.

loans.use: to buy rice and darak (rice bran) to offer for sale

loans.name: Harison

texts.en:
Harison lives in Tiribe, Mombasa. He has a very good work project and buys and sells chickens. He sells them to restaurants, diners and other entities; and thanks to the quality of his product, he is making headway.

Harison struggles to get ahead and help his family through his work. His goal is to own a shop one day, and be able to attend to customers there.

He is requesting a loan to buy chickens, to keep up his supply and stay in business.

loans.use: to buy chickens, to keep up his supply and stay in business.

loans.name: Mzalendo Group

texts.en:
Juliet’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Chwele District. Juliet is pictured on the right of Mzalendo Group with her hand raised. Juliet is pictured amongst the 6 men and 4 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet and maize. Juliet joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Juliet joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and purchase new land.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Juliet was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 25 bags per acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy land and a motorcycle. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Juliet’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a merchant. She makes a living selling mainly fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 5 years and she has a place in a popular market in Tiribe where she sells fresh products to her customers every day.

She's a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning, because she begins her work day very early.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Carmen wants to  improve her small variety store and increase her income to satisfy her family's needs. She is 56 years old and has three grown children. Being a responsible mother, she plans to improve their standard of living to give them a better life. To improve the business, she is applying for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy a larger stock of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, fruits, and vegetables to sell. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, she is determined to improve her business and hopes that she will be successful in carrying out her plan.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a married woman and a mother of seven children from CPG, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in hog-raising business and farming ventures.
Ludivina is asking for a loan to buy feed for pigs and fertilizer for plants. 

In the future, Ludivina dreams of making her business a success and saves money for the education of her children. She hopes to see them become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and fertilizer for plants

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella administra su propia tienda de productos de la canasta básica, desde hace 10 años. Toda la mercadería la compra en la ciudad, que esta a una distancia de 15 kilómetros de su casa, los viajes es cada fin de semana y los transporta en autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cemento, hierro, arena, piedra, para construir una habitación a su casa. Debido a que su familia esta creciendo y necesitan más espacio, seguridad y podrá atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and has a son.  She has owned a store that sells basic household products for ten years.  She purchases all the merchandise in the city, which is 15 kilometers from her house.  She makes the trip every weekend by bus.

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to purchase cement, iron, sand, and stone to build a room on her house.  Her family is growing and they need more space and security.  She will also be able to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sand, and stone to build a room on her house.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi lives in Tiribe, Mombasa. She is married and her husband is a farmer.. She buys and slaughters goats, then sells the meat to butcher shops in the area for a living. She has had this business to earn a living to support her family for several years.


She currently has two underage children. She also has a house that she was able to build with all the amenities, thanks to her sacrifice and dedication to her work.

She will purchase goats with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divina Misericordia está en su  ciclo número 1 donde las miembros se esfuerzan y se ayudan por salir adelante y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias a ir creciendo como personas y microempresarias.
La Sra. Mirny es una de las integrantes, ella es de la ciudad de Caaguazú donde tiene su pequeño negocio de una despensa y venta de productos de limpieza. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Kits de productos de limpieza o microfranquicia y  de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group called Divina Misericordia is in their first loan cycle.  The members make an effort and help each other to move ahead.  This work helps their families as they grow as people and small business owners.  

Mirny is one of the group members.  She is from the city of Caaguazú.  Her business selling general household items and cleaning products is also located there.  She hopes that with the passage of time, and with the help of all the people in her area, they can improve their environment and offer better security to their families so that they can give them a better future.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase kits or mini-franchises to make cleaning products.  This will allow her to continue growing her business and give her family what they need to have a life without hardship.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-franchise to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Brenda Mariela

texts.es:
Brenda tiene 20 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. Ella trabaja en una empresa atunera desde hace dos años; como operaria en la manipulación de mariscos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cemento, hierro, arena, piedra, para construir una pequeña vivienda e independizarse de sus padres, su compañero de vida posee un terreno en donde iniciaran con la construcción.
texts.en:
Brenda is 20 years old and has a partner and a son.  She has worked at a fishing business for two years as a seafood handler.  

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to purchase cement, iron, sand, and stone to build a small house and become independent from her parents.  Her life partner has land where they can start the construction.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sand, and stone to build a small house.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 18 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 3, Rehema has been working hard to manage her clothes store, which puts up children's clothes on the market. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock, and will help Rehema to generate greater profits and boost the business. Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to have a well-equipped business. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase stock

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Diego, es un hombre de 27 años, soltero y trabajador que vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos.El trabajo de Diego consiste en el transporte de personas por la ciudad ya que tiene un mototaxi  que le permite realizar esta actividad y el cual fue comprado con sus ahorros , gracias a los trabajos eventuales que se le presentaban.
