Recorre todas las calles de la ciudad en busca de pasajeros que requieran ser trasladados a algún lugar específico .Viene desempeñando esta actividad por 5 años y por su gran habilidad para conseguir pasajeros puede obtener buenas ganancias las cuales le permiten tener lo necesario para solventar los gastos familiares.En el futuro desea comprar otro mototaxi para alquilarlo y de esta forma asegurar otro ingreso económico, pero por el momento desea refaccionar su mototaxi y hacer que  funcione de maravilla para asi poder ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar otro vehiculo ,por esta razòn esta solicitando S/. 500 soles, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos a su vez se compromete a cumplir de manera responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado renovará algunas piezas de su vehículo  como las llantas , tapizado  y faros.
texts.en:
Diego is a 27 year-old hardworking man. He is unmarried and lives in his parent’s house, along with his siblings. His job is transporting people through the city because he has a motorcycle taxi that he bought with his savings from jobs he had.

He travels throughout the city looking for passengers who need to go to some specific place. He has been engaged in this work for five years and, due to his skill is obtaining passengers, he earns a good living which enables him to have what is necessary to pay for household expenses.

In the future he wants to buy another motorcycle taxi and rent it out, thereby insuring another source of income. At the moment, however, he wants to refurbish his motorcycle taxi so that it works great and he can save enough to buy another vehicle. Thus, he is requesting S/. 500 and is grateful to everyone who has made the loan possible. It will enable him to continue achieving his goals. He also promises to make all his payments on time. With the sum he has requested he will upgrade some parts of his vehicle, such as the tires, upholstery and headlights.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a single lady aged 30 years old who is a single mother of two children aged 10 and five years old. She operates a beauty salon and her business has grown earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

She has a loan of 15,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is her first loan and she wishes to purchase hair braid, weaves and hair bands for her salon. 

The anticipated amount she earns will be used to expand her business and start the same business in a different location. Her wish is to ensure that she gives the best service in the town.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids, weaves, and hair bands

loans.name: Imaranjara Tusisimuke Group

texts.en:
Muhamadi is a 43-year-old man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop alongside farming as an additional source of income. Customers who delay to pay and increased levels of competition pose a challenge to his growth, while his dreams are constructing a house and buying a car. 

Muhamadi intends to use the loan to buy sugar, salt and bathing soap to sell. He is a member of the Imaranjara Tusisimuke group in which each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and bathing soap to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa has been engaged in her piggery business for thirty years. She is 45 years old and married with three children. She is thankful because her husband has been very supportive in improving their unprivileged lifestyle. Presently she is raising three piglets and that is what she dedicates her time to. She needs to make them healthier and nourish them to earn more income, so Elsa is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy feed and vitamins. Hopefully her loan request will be approved.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cloth and a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en:
Clovis used the previous loan to buy cattle and local brew to sell. He is a hardworking married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He trades in local brew and cattle, and with the proceeds, he has been able to provide basics to his family.

He was initiated into business by his father and he has since grown to love the business despite the challenges of high license fees and inadequate capital. Clovis intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruits to sell for profit

loans.name: Misemwa Group

texts.en:
Dominic is a member of Misemwa Group in Chwele District. He is pictured with 15 One Acre Fund farmers: nine women and six men. Dominic is standing on the right in a blue checked shirt with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Dominic joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. He joined One Acre Fund so that he could use his increased profits to send his children to school and to reduce hunger and poverty.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Dominic was only able to harvest six bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 10 bags per half acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to allow him to buy more land. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Dominic’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.  

The field officer is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Nelima Group

texts.en:
Benina’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Chwele District. Benina is pictured on the right of Nelima Group with her hand raised. Benina is pictured amongst the two men and eight women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting half an acre with sorghum, millet and maize. Benina first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Benina joined One Acre Fund in order to use increased profits to send her children to school and for loan repayment.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Benina was only able to harvest two bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 4.5 bags per half acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Benina’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Abee

texts.en:
Abee is a 40 year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 12.  All of them go to school.
Abee runs a restaurant, and has been in business for four years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2500ssp to purchase meat, rice, beans, and many other supplies,  She has no other source of income in addition to this business.  In five years Abee would like to expand her business.

Her major challenges include high prices in the market.  Abee says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of KIVA.

loans.use: to buy more food items like meat, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 1, donde 10  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza. Son mujeres trabajadoras y muy emprendedoras, que se esfuerzan por crecer y mejorar día con día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, que es por debajo. Ella hace trabajos de carpintería y con eso trata de salir adelante para poder tener los medios para ayudar a su familia y mejorar también su economía.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de maderas, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando en su plan de negocios y creciendo como profesional.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas [United Women] group is in its first cycle.  There are ten members living beneath the poverty line.  They are hard-working and very enterprising women.  They put forth great effort to grow and improve day to day.

Maria is one of the members.  During the last survey her poverty level was within level one, which is below.  She does carpentry work, and with this she tries to get ahead.  She does this to be able to have the means to help her family and also to improve her financial situation.

She is requesting this loan to buy wood.  With the wood she will be able to continue working on her business plan, and she will continue growing as a professional.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Florene is a member of the Baraka Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers: eight other women and three men. Florene is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Florene joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Florene joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to receive early farm input delivery.


Florene described her harvest as very good last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to buy a cow and to save for the future. 

Florene’s group members will each receive input loans of half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for six acres of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Mwanamai

texts.en:
Mwanamai is a merchant who sells clothes. She is married, lives in Tiribe, Mombasa, and has four children. Mwanamai began selling in the marketplace thanks to the financial assistance from her husband, who is a driver. Gradually she was able to increase her business and now she offers her products throughout the village.


Mwanamai travels to Mombasa and brings back articles of clothing, which allows her to continue offering good prices. The articles of clothing that she sells most are those for women and children such as blouses, t-shirts, shorts, sweatshirts, and lingerie. She is requesting assistance so that she can buy articles of clothing that are in season. Mwanamai wants to be well-stocked with these items so that she can offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing that are in season.

loans.name: Kombo

texts.en: Kombo’s from Tiribe, Mombasa. He has an iron metal shop, an activity he’s been in for 20 years. He’s married and has two children who are the reason he strives. He’s a very hardworking person with good references. Thanks to his hard work, he gives his family everything he can so that they will lack nothing. He’s asking for the loan to invest in his business with the purchase of materials like iron rods to continue working and filling orders.

loans.use: to buy iron rods.

loans.name: Bashiru's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a vocational institution located in Portee, in the Sierra Leone capital city of Freetown. These able and dedicated teachers have come to Kiva’s first local partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) to request a loan of 7,100,000 Leones for their entire team in order to meet their immediate and most pressing needs.  At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.
Abdul is the featured leader of this group. The 47 year-old is a native of Freetown. He is married and has twp children.  Abdul has been a professional teacher for 15 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Meitekini

texts.en:
Meitekini is a 35 year-old man from Kilgoris, which is located in the Rift valley province in Kenya.  He is married and supports four children.

He is a small scale farmer and has been doing it for the last six years, with a monthly income of KES.15,000. He is taking his third loan with KADET LTD.   He will use the loan to purchase maize seed, pay labor and till the land.  He wants to expand the business and become a renowned farmer in the area. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business and the rest to pay school fees. His dream is to be able to maximize his profits and hence, to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds, labor and plowing

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 48-year-old man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in milk sales and also cultivates crops such as beans and bananas.

Like most farmers, he is challenged by the prolonged drought season and diseases.  His dream is to have a milk processing plant in town. As the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University level despite inadequate capital. George intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Masoud

texts.en: Masoud is grateful for the previous loan which has enabled him to expand his business territory. He is now applying for a subsequent loan amounting to KES 50000 to pay school fees for his children.  This will improve school performance of his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     to pay school fees for her children.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Nargilya

texts.ru: Наргиля 32 года, воспитывает 3 детей школьников.  Наргиля работает в школе преподавателем. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, в 2005 году Наргиля начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Наргиля, ее хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли с продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наргиля обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Наргиля планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Nargilya is 32 years old and has 3 school-aged children. She works as a teacher in a school. As a means of supplementing her income, in 2005 she started a business in animal husbandry with just 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) Thanks to her persistent hard work, her farm now brings in a monthly income of around 5,000 Som from the sale of dairy products. For the purpose of further developing her business, Nargilya has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 20,000 Som to buy livestock to fatten and re-sell. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to invest in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sheep

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 37 year-old man who has two children and lives in Fort Portal Uganda.  He operates a mowing machine, and schools and hospitals are his major clients.  He also has a motorcycle that he uses for a transport business, and with the proceeds he has been able to provide basics to his young family.  The high cost of fuel and clients not paying on time affect his business.  His dream is to own at least four mowing machines.  Julius intends to use the loan to buy a mowing machine.

loans.use: to buy a mowing machine

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 43 года замужем. Бактыгул  с 2000 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 бычка и 2 коровы. Дополнительно она ежегодно обрабатывает 0,5 га. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 15,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 нетелей для увеличения дохода от молока Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Baktygul is 43 years old and married. Since 2000, she has been working in animal husbandry, having started this business with only 10,000 Som. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now includes 4 bulls and 2 cows. In addition, she works a 0.5 hectare plot of land each year. Her monthly income from her business is approximately 15,000 Som. For the purpose of further developing her business, Baktygul has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som to buy 4 cows so she can increase her earnings from the sale of milk. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to invest in the future expansion of her herd.

loans.use: To purchase 4 cows

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
IRMA YOLANDA
DOÑA IRMA YOLANDA POSEE UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO Y ESTE ES SU SEGUNDO CREDITO KIVA QUE SOLICITA EN EL CREDITO ANTERIOR FUE BIEN RESPONSABLE Y UTILIZO EL CREDITO PARA SURTIR MAS SU TIENDA. AHORA QUIERE ADELANTAR CUATRO MESES PARA OBTENER OTRO CREDITO Y ASI SURTIR MAS SU TIENDA YA QUE SU NEGOCIO HA CRECIDO POR TENER MAS SURTIDA SU TIENDA ELLA AGRADECE QUE FAPE LA HAYA ABIERTO LAS PUERTAS Y ASI OBTENER UN APOYO PARA SALIR ADELANTE YA, QUE ES MADRE SOLTERA Y NECESITA TENER IGRESOS PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SU PEQUEÑO HIJO DE SIETE AÑITOS.
texts.en:
Irma Yolanda has a grocery store.  This is the second Kiva loan she has requested.  She was very responsible with the previous loan.  She used to loan to stock her store more.

She now wants to get another loan four months in advance.  This way she will stock her store more.  This is because her business has grown by having a better stocked store.

She is grateful to FAPE for having opened the doors to receive help in order to get ahead.  She is a single mother, and she needs income in order to get her little seven year old child ahead.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 24 years old and single.  She has two children, aged eight and two years old.  She owns a retail shop in Kapsabet town, which has been in operation for a period of one year, and her monthly income is KES.10,000.

She has joined a self-help group and now servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD.  She intends to use this amount to purchase stock of  sugar, rice, cooking fat and washing detergents for resale.  The anticipated amount she earns will be used for her family upkeep.  Her dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil and washing detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items such as eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, kerosene, sugar, instant noodles, eggs, snacks etc.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is a 38 year-old mother of two children. Her husband works as a truck driver who delivers agriculture products from villages to downtown. The income generated from the business is often insufficient in meeting their household needs. Two years ago, Emilia initiated a kiosk business to help her with additional income. Emilia provides soft drinks, snacks, cigarettes, candies, etc.  However, the limitation of capital has prevented her from selling more goods. After she heard about TLM, Emilia got interested and applied for an IDR 10,000,000 loan for her business improvement. Emilia would like to spend the loan on more goods, i.e,. instant noodles, sugar, rice, coffee, milk, shampoo, bath soap, etc.  In addition, she also wants to buy building materials, i.e,. zinc, cement, sand, etc. to enlarge her kiosk building.

loans.use: to buy more goods, i.e. instant noodles, sugar, rice, coffee, milk, shampoo, bath soap, etc, and also to buy building materials, i.e. zinc, cement, sand, etc. to enlarge her kiosk building.

loans.name: Vijay Mullah's Group

texts.en:
Meet with this group of teachers from the town of Waterloo, near Sierra Leone’s capital city, Freetown. This group of teachers has come to SMT, Kiva’s oldest local partner, to request a loan of 11,900,000 Leones for the entire group in order to meet their immediate and most pressing needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Vijay is the featured leader of this team. The 38 year-old is a native of Makeni. He is married to a trader and the two have four children. Vijay has been a teacher for 12 years now. In Vijay’s words, he has requested this loan in order “to repair my house and pay school fees for my children and brother’s children”.

loans.use: “to repair my house and pay school fees for my children and brother’s children”.

loans.name: Mboze

texts.en:
Mboze is a 49-year-old entrepreneur from Tiribe, Kenya. She is married with five children. Her husband is a retired worker. She operates a store selling beverages, including fresh milk and soft drinks. She initially started her business to improve herself and her store sold local foodstuffs such as bread and palm oil.

Mboze is seeking a loan of KES 10000 to buy food ingredients, sacks of sugar and bundles of milk packets. In the future, she hopes to own and operate more shops in the area. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients, sacks of sugar and bundles of milk packets.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the materials needed in her tailoring business. She also runs a direct selling business and a mineral water distribution service, which is her current focus.

Elizabeth would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more gallons of mineral water. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elizabeth hopes that her business will get bigger and dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has been able to repay her first loan successfully, given that the weather season in Mombasa is favorable for juice sale. 

She is now requesting for the second loan to purchase more stock of fresh fruits for juice making, and be able to meet the orders from  schools around. 

She hopes to be a more reliable supplier of fresh fruit juice to schools in Mombasa as a whole.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for juice making.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is a 51 year-old man from western Kenya.  He is married and supports a very big family.  His children's ages are 27, 23, 17 and 15 years. 

Ayub has been in the transport business for the last 15 years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000.  He is taking his third loan with KADET LTD., with which he will purchase a new motorbike.  That will help him distribute the newspaper, which is his second business.  He will use the anticipated profit to purchase more motorbikes to expand his business. His dream is to expand the business so as to be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase another motobike for transportation.

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en: Meswalehe is 41 years old.  She is married and has two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in Tiribe, Kenya. She has requested a loan of ksh.30,000 to buy stock to sell, such as canned goods, frozen products, spices and soap.  She has been operating for the last five years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell, such as canned goods, frozen products, spices and soap.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri, age 52, runs a kiosk business. She started her business in order to supplement the income of her husband Ramli, age 47, who works as a civil servant. They have an adopted child named Numila, age 22, who is attending university. 

Sri is proud of her business because it allows her to generate her own income. She is eager to improve her business by adding items to her kiosk that she has never sold before, such as rice, eggs, new varieties of snacks, and sandals. She also wants to buy a display window. 

In order to make these investments, Sri has applied for a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 10,000,000. She is optimistic that her business will grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, snacks, and sandals to offer for sale, as well as to buy a display window

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in Tiribe kenya. She is 28 years old. She lives together with her husband. They have one child. She is a kind and thoughtful woman. She raises livestock. She is taking out a loan to buy cows and calves in order to increase her cattle and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cows and calves in order to increase her cattle

loans.name: Govi

texts.en:
Govi is married and has four children. He lives with his wife and two children in Tiribe. He says that before he started his business he was doing farming. Because of that he and his wife were able to accumulate a significant amount of capital and decided to start his retail shop business. They built their house and decided to open a store with their savings. Thanks to effort and hard work his business has expanded. He now has a steady clientele because of the good and friendly service he provides his customers.

He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for his store, such as beverages, groceries, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his store, such as beverages, groceries, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: El Sr. Fredy sigue con su misma actividad de elaboración y venta de pan y repostería, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de harina y manteca por mayor para la elaboración de pan,   cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que creció en su actividad
texts.en: Fredy continues with the same business, making and selling bread and pastries. At this time he asks for a loan to buy flour and butter wholesale to make bread. He says that he did very well with the last loan, as his business has grown.

loans.use: to buy flour and butter

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 29 лет, замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, Эльмира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве еще 2005 году, использовав для этого стартовую сумму 20,000 сом (KGS). Успешно работая в сфере животноводства и имея доход от продажи молочных продуктов, Эльмира также выращивает кормовые культуры на участке в 1,16 га, что позволяет ей обеспечивать кормами свой скот и иметь дополнительный доход от продажи кормов. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы для увеличения доходов от продажи молока. На прибыль от кредита Эльмира планирует сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Elmira is a 29-year-old married mother of three. While searching for additional sources of income for her family in 2005, Elmira started her own animal husbandry business. Her initial investment was 20,000 som. Successful work in animal husbandry and the sale of diary products has allowed Elmira to grow fodder on a 1.16 hectare plot. This enables her to feed her own cattle as well as to earn extra money selling fodder. 

With future business development in mind, Elmira turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 30,000 som loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase her income from milk sales. Elmira plans to renovate her home with the additional income.

loans.use: To purchase 1 milk cow

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 33 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей - школьников. Динара в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 12 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Динары имеется 4 дойной коровы, 8 овцематок, выручка с продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет 11,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота с целью увеличения надоев. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и покупка дома.
texts.en:
Dinara is a 33-year-old married mother of four school-aged children. She has provided her family's main source of income by working in animal husbandry for the past 12 years. She started her business with an initial investment of 50,000 som and today she has four dairy cows and eight sheep. Her monthly income from the sale of milk and other dairy products is 11,000 som. 

With the goal of future business development, Dinara turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 80,000 som loan to purchase cattle in order to increase her income. She plans to invest the additional income for future improvements on her farm and for purchasing a home.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Al Doha Group

texts.en:
Maha is the featured borrower of Al Doha's group. She got with the other members of the group to apply for this youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends and neighbors.

Maha is a 27-year-old single woman who has been working in photography since three years ago. She loves her business a lot and puts so much effort in developing it as much as she can.

Through this loan that she has applied for, Maha will buy a new flash for her camera, because the present one is not working fine, which affects the pictures' resolution, and will strongly affect her business development.

She hopes that one day she can open a big studio, and recruit people who can help her cover many occasions at the same time.
Maha is the one on the left.

Hala is a 26-year-old single woman who has been working in a medicine warehouse since two years ago. Through this loan, she will make medication she needs. She is the one on the right.

Dalal is a 28-year-old single woman who has been working in a laboratory since three years ago. Through this loan, Dalal will be capable of visiting religious areas outside Lebanon, which she has been seeking to do for a long time.

loans.use: To buy a new flash for her camera.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 40 years old. He is from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with two kids who are in school.

Joel has an agrovet business that he has been doing for the past three years. He has applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy more stock of veterinary medicines to add to his stock.

He hopes to grow his business into a big agrovet one in the near future.

loans.use: To buy agrovet medicines.

loans.name: Hassan's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 11,200,000 Sierra Leone Leones for the entire team. 

With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to buy or invest in things that they would not otherwise be able to buy or invest in  with their salaries alone. Borrowers usually use these loans to buy plots of land, house-building materials, to pay school fees for their children, to buy pieces of furniture, etc. And at the end of each month, they use their monthly salaries to repay the loan. It is their school's bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Hassan is the featured leader of this group. Born in Freetown, the 34-year-old is married to a businesswoman, and the couple has 4 children. Hassan has been a teacher for many years now. He has requested this loan for a number of reasons: he will use part of the loan to pay school fees for his children and  part to buy goods for sale.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and buy goods for sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Doña virginia es comerciante de mariscos, por muchos ha contribuido al desarrollo económico de su familia. 
La forma de comercializar este tipo de producto es de forma ambulante de casa en casa.
Necesita una fuente de financiamiento para distribuir este producto en diferentes canales de distribución como bares y restaurantes de la ciudad de Managua y de esta forma incrementar sus ingresos.
Antes de iniciar su negocio era cocinera de un lugar turístico del municipio de san Rafael del sur
Su estado civil es acompañada y madre de dos hijos, todos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Virginia is a seafood vender. She has contributed to the economic development of her family for many [years]. She sells this kind of product in an itinerant fashion, going house to house. She needs a source of financing to distribute this product in different channels of distribution such as bars and restaurants in the city of Managua, and thus increase her earnings. 

Before starting her business she was a cook at a tourist location in the city of San Rafael del Sur. She has a domestic partner and is the mother of two children, both school aged.

loans.use: to buy seafood, in general.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Mohamed M. He is married and has 3 children aged 4, 3 and 1; one is in school. He has 3 additional dependents, who live with him to be foster and help in business. 

In 2001, Mohamed M. established his nails, hammers, levels, spanners, lamp holders, bulbs, painting brush, extensions etc. business. He began his business because he stopped in Form 4 for lack of support for his education. He used to assist his mother in business and when he dropped out of school his mother gave him some amount of money to start a building materials business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,875,000 Leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Mohamed M. requires a loan in order to buy nails, extension cables, solvents, lamp holders, electric bulb and hammers. In the future, Mohamed M. plans to educate his children and younger ones, build a house and open a shop. This loan will help to improve the business and generate more income. Inadequate capital is his major challenge. He is a hardworking and trustworthy business man. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more tools

loans.name: Shobo

texts.en:
Shabo lives in Tiribe, Mombasa. Shabo works raising goats on his property. He mentions that he has been doing this job for over 20 years. He says that all of his work requires a great deal of sacrifice, which means that it entails a lot of work and care as the animals require constant care. He dreams of being able to double the number of animals he has, in order to earn more for his household.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of more animals to raise and later sell. He says that the loan will be of great use to him and he is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it has provided him.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул 29 лет, воспитывает 2 детей. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, c 2005 года Назгул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Назгул и её семьи, ее хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nazgul is a 29-year-old mother of two children. While searching for new income in 2005, she started an animal husbandry business with an initial investment of 20,000 som. Thanks to Nazgul and her family's hard work and persistence, dairy and meat sales now provide them with a monthly income of 15,000 som. 

With future business development in mind, Nazgul turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 10,000 loan to purchase sheep for fattening and future resale. She plans to invest the additional income to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sheeps for fattening and future resale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia de 36 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 5 años de edad respectivamente, vive a lado de sus hijos en la casa de su madre.El trabajo de Patricia consiste en la venta de zapatos, sandalias, zapatillas y prendas de vestir, las ventas las realiza  entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, empezó desde hace 1 año y le va muy bien. En esta temporada esta ofreciendo ropas de verano y sandalias playeras ya que se encuentran en todo su apogeo. Se siente muy a gusto desarrollando esta actividad ya que le brinda buenos ingresos económicos , pero a su vez ella necesita de alguna ayuda adicional ya que quiere ampliar su mercadería con  prendas femeninas.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles para la compra de cierta cantidad de ropa en las que se encuentran polos , blusas veraniegas,entre otros , es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados ,  a su vez  se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas .
texts.en:
Patricia is 36 years old, single, and has three children who are 17, 15, and 5 years old, respectively. She lives with her children in her mother’s home.

Patricia’s work consists of the sale of shoes, sandals, slippers, and apparel. She sells to friends, neighbors, and family members. She began one year ago, and it is going well for her. This season, she is offering summer clothes and flip-flop sandals since they are right now at their peak. She feels very comfortable carrying out this activity since it provides her a good income, but at the same time she needs some additional help since she wants to increase her merchandise with women’s clothes. 

At this opportunity, she will request S/.500 soles to buy a quantity of clothing, such as polo shirts and summer blouses, among others. It is because of this that she is thankful to all of the people who are making possible the loan, which will allow her to continue working with better results. At the same time, she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 32-year-old married man and a father of one child. He has been working in an agriculture business since 12 years ago. Mohamad is a hard worker; he is specialized in almost all of the vegetables and citrus plants.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary seeds, fertilizers and new plastic tents because the current ones were destroyed in the last snow storm.

Mohamad has a very good reputation in his region, and is well-known at the wholesale market. Mohamad takes good care of his production and makes sure that every plant has the care it needs.

He hopes to keep on expanding his business more and more, and to open his own vegetable market.

loans.use: To buy necessary seeds, fertilizers and plastic tents.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha sells clothing door-to-door to earn a living. Her husband, a city taxi driver, helped her get started in her business by giving her a small amount of savings as start-up capital. They live in Tiribe, Mombasa, with their four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Their combined income enables them to pay for the education of their children and to cover household necessities. 

Mwanaisha has developed an established, regular clientele in her business. She herself is a very responsible person who is motivated by the desire to achieve.

Mwanaisha is seeking a loan in order to buy a variety of clothing items to offer for sale, such as t-shirts, blouses, and pants. This will allow the business to be better-stocked and to generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing items to offer for sale, such as t-shirts, blouses, and pants

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярославу 31 год, холостой. Ярослав имеет незаконченное образование по специальности технолог легкой промышленности. Имеет большой опыт работы в данной сфере. Последние три года он работал ведущим специалистом в аналогичном ателье. Наработав достаточный опыт и клиентов он решил открыть свое ателье. Для начала бизнеса он арендовал помещение и привез все оборудование которое он приобрел в течении всего времени работы в ателье.
За время анализа Ярослав показал себя как очень воспитанный и позитивный человек. Прежде чем начать бизнес и обратится в Микрофинансовый банк "Бай Тушум и партнеры" Ярослав успешно прошел обучение в компании "Сенти", которая предоставляет образовательные услуги. Для того чтобы в полной степени выполнять заказы Ярославу необходима глазково-петельная машина. Ярослав услышав о льготной программе КИВА "СтартАп"  обратилася в Микрофинансовый банк   «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку глазково-петельной машины. Изучив его бизнес план Ярослава, он сможет получать около 20,000 KGS в месяц. Доходы от кредита Ярослав планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса за счет покупки еще одной машинки. Он очень рад что существует такая программа, и благодарит от всех инвесторов КИВА и Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры».
texts.en: Yaroslav is a 31-year-old bachelor. He has a partially-completed education as a technologist in light industry, and has rich experience in this field. For the last 3 years, he has been working as the lead specialist in a tailor studio. Having gained a lot of practical experience and a regular clientele, he decided to open his own tailor studio. To start his business, he rented premises and set up the equipment that he had acquired during the time he worked in the first tailor studio. Yaroslav has proven himself to be a well-mannered and positive person. Before he established his own business, he successfully completed courses in the company "Senti" that provides educational classes. In order to provide full service for his clients, Yaroslav needs to buy a buttonhole machine. When he heard about Kiva's advantageous program "Start Up," he approached the Microfinance Bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS) to buy one. An analysis of Yaroslav's business plan indicates that he can earn around 20,000 Som per month. He plans to use the income generated by this loan to re-invest in his business and expand it by purchasing one more machine. He is very happy that such a microfinance program exists and is grateful to all sponsors from Kiva and Bai Tushum & Partners.

loans.use: To purchase buttonhole machine to start his own sewing business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria de 33 años casada, tiene tres hijos varones todos estudian,  doña Victoria  se dedica a la  venta de ropa típica, en su domicilio desde hace 5 años, empezó con unas cuantas prendas y ahora vende variedad en cortes típicos, blusas típicas, fajas de diferentes diseños, colores, chalinas típicas, y ha crecido su negocio hasta la fecha, doña victoria  sueña que sus hijos logren graduarse que sean profesionales, ella aporta económicamente en su hogar y esperan que sus hijos tengan lo que ellos no pudieron alcanzar.  Agradece la ayuda ya que ella a crecido como micro empresaria con los créditos otorgados, quiere vender ahora sandalias. Comprar un mostrador para su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is 33 years of age, married, and has 3 sons, all in school. She has sold traditional clothing from her house for the last 5 years. Victoria began with just a few items of clothing and, now, she sells a variety in typical styles, including traditional blouses, sashes of different designs and colors, and traditional scarves. 

Her business has grown up to the present. Victoria dreams that her sons will graduate and become professionals. She contributes economically as best she can from her home and hopes that her sons will have what they could not in the past.

Victoria is grateful for the help. She has expanded her micro-enterprise, using the loans provided, and she now wants to begin selling sandals and, also, to purchase a showcase for her business.

loans.use: purchase traditional women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Joseph Kaindi

texts.en: Joseph is a hard-working 59-year-old family man. Married with 11 children, he lives in Nairobi, Kenya. His youngest child is 10 years old; though, he also lives with his three grandchildren who are all attending primary school. From the work he was doing as a driver, Joseph raised initial capital which he used to construct a few units of rental houses, built from corrugated iron sheets. Joseph wants to acquire two Fresh Life toilets which will serve his tenants, as well as his neighbors, for a nominal fee per use. From his expected return, Joseph hopes to increase the number of units for rental, as well as educate his children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama, age 27, started up her provisions business in 2005 with the help of her husband directly after their marriage. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,227,000 every month from this venture. She learned the business from her mother.  She is hard-working and competitive. She cites heavy competition as her primary business challenge.

The tribe into which Mariama was born does not value the education of girls, so she herself did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has no children of her own but has two dependents who live with her because they are her sister's children. They help her with her domestic work. She ensures that both the children attend school. 

Mariama is requesting a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase powdered milk, sugar, Ovaltine, mayonnaise, biscuits, and black mint. In the future, Mariama plans to expand her business and she is looking forward to eventually accessing additional loans in order to accomplish this. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase powdered milk, sugar, Ovaltine, mayonnaise, biscuits, and black mint to offer for sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is running a shop in the area of New Kru Town where she lives. It is one of the early communities in Montserrado County that is well-known in Liberia. She has been running this business for the past seven years. She makes lots of profit since she sells quality fabrics in her community. Her profits are used for house rent, feeding, school fees, and to improve her savings account. A problem she faces is the slow pace of buying during the rainy season. She started this business by selling in a wheelbarrow in her community since she lives close to the local market. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics and to add jeans, trousers, ladies shoes and handbags to her business. She has two children, ages 7 and 9, who are in school and live at home. Hawa is 29 years old and a high school graduate. Her plan is to expand her business and own a store house.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and to add jeans, trousers, ladies shoes and handbags to her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es casada y vive en anticrético en la zona de Eloy Salmon de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio de trajes militares que son confeccionados por ellos.

Nelly solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, botones, cierres y otros para continuar con su negocio.

Nelly necesita impulsar su negocio porque lamentablemente los ingresos que recibe no son suficientes para los gastos que tiene.

El sueño de Nelly es hacer crecer su negocio y poder ahorrar para tener una casa propia.

Esta es la segunda vez que solicita crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Nelly is married and lives under an "anticrético" arrangement [when a tenant pays a fixed sum upon renting a house instead of monthly rent] in the Eloy Salmon district of the city of La Paz.  She and her husband make a living selling military uniforms they make.

Nelly's requesting the loan to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, and other things to continue with her business.  Nelly needs to motivate her business because unfortunately her income isn't enough for her expenses.

Nelly's dream is to make her business grow and be able to save money to have her own house.

This is the second time she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, and buttons to make military uniforms

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo runs a grocery store in her neighborhood. She is a very hard-working woman with four school-going children. She started her grocery store with a few items and began to increase her inventory with the help of her husband and through her own savings. She says that her work requires a lot of sacrifice because she and her husband work are the only family members who work. 

Her dream is to set up a supermarket in her neighborhood.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy herbs, noodles, breads, rice, and other supplies that make up her greatest sales.

loans.use: to buy herbs, noodles, breads, rice, and other supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze makes and sells clothing to earn an income. She was able to improve her business and her home through her previous loan. She operates her business in order to supplement her husband's income, because he was not able to earn enough on his own to support the family. Their life was very difficult, so Nzadze decided to earn her own income. Now they help one another in supporting the family and they are getting ahead.

She needs this loan in order to buy fabric, which will enable her to continue working and meeting her customer’s demands.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Ngumba

texts.en:
Ngumba is married and has two children who are attending primary school. Thanks to the job she is doing, she is able to educate her children and purchase all the household necessities. She has proven to be responsible and honest in her commitments.

Ngumba has her own food market business that she was able to establish by working hard. She started the business with the help of her husband, who is a casual laborer. She is requesting the loan to purchase wheat flour, meat, sugar and other ingredients to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, meat, sugar and other ingredients to continue her business.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi works in agriculture: specifically, goat rearing. She works buying and selling goats and rearing them for resale. She started in this line of work over 1 year ago and has given work to many young people in the area.

Because the work of raising and selling goats generates good earnings, Chizi wishes to increase the quantity of animals. For this she is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES, which she will invest in the purchase of goats for fattening and, later, sale.

loans.use: to purchase goats for fattening and, later, sale.

loans.name: Betty Seneida

texts.es:
Cada provincia del Ecuador guarda historias de hombres y mujeres que dejaron huella, formando así el futuro de los que han de llegar después. Es así que varias culturas ecuatorianas, habitaron en la Parroquia de Río Verde, un lugar histórico de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas. En la Parroquia de Río Verde vive Betty, una mujer de 31 años de edad que fue madre desde muy joven y que decidió vivir con su pareja sin llevar a cabo el contrato de matrimonio, convivencia de la cual nacieron 4 hijos que ahora viven con Betty, ya que ella y su pareja decidieron independizar sus vida y se separaron. Betty tiene aprobada la escuela primaria y trabaja muy duro para que a sus hijos, que estudian actualmente en una escuela fiscal, no les falte nada y puedan un día obtener el título profesional que ella no pudo alcanzar por su falta de recursos.
Betty no ha limitado su labor a pesar de las barreras que su falta de preparación le ha puesto en el camino. A raíz de su separación, ella es la principal proveedora de sustento en su hogar, es por eso que hace 3 años, con algunos ahorros, instaló un local de venta de víveres y frutas el cual atiende desde que sale el sol hasta la noche, completando hasta 14 horas de trabajo, pero su responsabilidad en el hogar es constante, paralelamente a la atención de su tienda, ella se las arregla para tener su casa limpia, atender y ayudar a sus hijos y proveerles el alimento diario. Su experiencia le ha enseñado que es importante contar siempre con productos surtidos en la cantidad necesaria, pues de lo contrario sus clientes buscarán otras alternativas, es por esto que Betty está solicitando un préstamo para adquirir productos que cumplan con la demanda de los clientes y que atraiga más personas a comprar en su negocio, realizando adecuaciones llamativas y cómodas para ella y las personas que lleguen hasta ese lugar. Gracias al apoyo de ustedes, Betty podrá llevar con sus hijos una vida de calidad, sin pasar necesidades y además hará que Betty crezca personal y laboralmente.
texts.en:
Each province of Ecuador passes down stories of the men and women who left footprints, forming the future of those who will arrive later. And so, several Ecuadorian cultures lived in the parish of Río Verde, a historical area of Santo Domingo, the capital of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a province of Ecuador that in recent years has had a sustained high growth. Its capital is a city with the most attractive, appealing and delicious fruit and gastronomy offered there. It also has considerable trade and has become a land port of trade between the mountain ranges and the coastal regions. It also has many tourist attractions accompanied by a warm climate which is frequented by both national and international tourists. It is for this reason that most of its inhabitants have embarked on some commercial activity or service for residents and tourists. 

Betty lives in the parish of Río Verde. She is a 31 year old woman who became a mother at a very young age and decided to live with her partner without a marriage license, and they had four children who now live with Betty, as she and her partner decided to separate and become independent of one another. Betty has a primary school certificate and works very hard for her children who currently attend a public school. They do not require anything and they can one day receive a professional title that she could not because of the absence of resources. Betty has not been limited in her work because of her lack of preparation by the obstacles placed on her path.

As a consequence of her separation, she is the main provider for household expenses. This is why three years ago, with some savings, she opened a grocery and fruit stand and attends to it from sunrise until sunset, working 14 hours a day. But her household responsibilities are constant and at the same time that she tends to her store she also cleans the house and takes care of the children providing them with their daily bread.

Her experience has taught her that it is important to always have a selection of products in sufficient quantity, otherwise customers will search for other alternatives, and this is why Betty is asking for a loan in order to buy products to meet the demand of her clients and to attract more people to shop at her store, fitting it out attractively and comfortably for her and the people who come to her place. Thanks to your help, Betty will be able to give her children a quality life without passing up necessities and furthermore Betty will grow personally and professionally.

loans.use: to buy supplies and make repairs for the growth of her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, age 34, owns and operates a clothing sales business. She sells jeans, blouses, and t-shirts, and has been running her business for eight years. She has two children, ages 10 and 12, and her primary monthly expenditure is the payment of their school fees. The family lives in Tiribe, Kenya.
 
Mariam's business is her sole source of income. Her primary challenges are inadequate capital and price inflation. 
 
She has requested a loan in order to buy more clothing items such as jeans, blouses, and t-shirts to offer for sale. The extra income from this loan will allow Mariam to start a savings account. 

In the future, she plans to import goods from neighboring countries. 

She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing items such as jeans, blouses, and t-shirts to offer for sale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 42 years old, is married and has six children. She lives in Tiribe, Kenya. She has worked in farming for most of her life. She has been growing corn, beans, and potatoes for over 15 years and she sells these products at the local market. She has invested seriously in these crops by providing the crops with good care.

She is now requesting a loan amounting to 15,000 KES to buy potato seeds and manure. She will also pay for the labor to plant and maintain these crops. Her objective is to give greater care to the crops to increase her production volume in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and manure. She will also pay for the labor to plant and maintain these crops.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en: Masika is grateful for the previous loan she received and made repayments with little difficulties. She has now requested her next loan for 20000 KSH to buy a sack of sugar and cooking oil. She points out that the loan has helped improve her living standards as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a single mother of four; all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent, school fees and feeding the family.

She owns a bar and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more beer, soda, gin and local brew. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She hopes to own a fully stocked bar and also to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more beer, soda and local brew for her bar.

loans.name: Eliap

texts.en:
Eliap serviced his previous loan well and in good time. He is a very hardworking man. Since he joined KADET LTD, through his borrowing, his life has really changed. He sells hardware items in a market. He makes a monthly income of KES. 60,000.
 
He is taking his sixth loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase more general goods like pipes and will provide shade for his customers. 

He will use his anticipated profit to open another outlet and to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to better provide for his family and to have a big hardware store in the region.

loans.use: to purchase more general goods like pipes and to provide shade for his customers.

loans.name: Mwachupa

texts.en:
Mwachupa is married. His wife is a farmer. The couple has five children who are enrolled in school. They live in their own home in Tiribe, Mombasa. 

More than five years ago, Mwachupa started purchasing and raising goats to sell for their meat. He started the business with capital from his savings and with much sacrifice and dedication, has managed to progress. The loan will be used to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell them for their meat.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is married, and they have two children who still depend on them.

Mbodze has had her grocery store for the last three years. She has a very good clientele and gets help from her husband. Together, they run the business. 

She’s asking for this loan to buy maize, sugar, oil, meat, tea, rice and other items to be able to offer variety to her customers, thus improving her income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize, sugar, oil, meat, tea, rice and other items.

loans.name: Florence C.

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old, and a high school graduate. Her husband works as a medical doctor. They have three children that are in school and live at home. 

She runs a pharmacy in New Kru Town where she lives. She has been running this business and providing services to her community for the past six years. She makes a good profit since she is the only one who is running a drug store in her community. With her profits she pays rent, school fees, and saves. One problem she faces is the rainy season, which leads to slow buying. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more medicine (paracetamol, folic acid, cough syrup, blood tonic, quinine, etc.) to expand her sales.  Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine to sell in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Bisharofat

texts.ru:
Бишарофат молодая, добрая и ответственная  женщина. Она  замужем, имеет двоих детей. С самого  детства Бишарофат  мечтала стать врачом, но к сожалению её мечта не осуществилась так как ее  отец умер рано и ей  пришлось не учиться а  помогать маме по хозяйству.  Потом вышла замуж, сейчас она работает поваром в кафе, а муж работает мастером в тех станции, он ремонтирует автомашины. 
У этой семьи   маленький дом и давно этот дом они  не ремонтировали. Сейчас дом в очень плохом состоянии, условия очень плохие, поэтому Бишарофат  решила  получить кредит и отремонтировать свой дом, создав своим детям хорошие условия и комфорт.  
На приобретенный кредит Бишарофат планирует закупить строительные материалы и начать ремонт. Она очень рада,что сможет воплотить свою мечту в реальность.
texts.en: Bisharofat is a kind and responsible young woman. She is married and has 2 children. When she was a child, she dreamed of becoming a doctor, but unfortunately her dream could not be realised because her father died young and she had to give up her studies to help her mother at home. She is now married and works as a cook in a cafe, and her husband repairs cars at an autobody shop. This family has a small house that hasn't been renovated in a long time. Now the house is in poor shape and the facilities are in bad condition, which is why Bisharofat is seeking a loan to repair it. She wants her children to have comfortable living conditions. She will use the loan money to buy building materials so she can begin renovations. She is very happy that this dream can come true.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 41-year-old, friendly, hard-working woman. Her husband is a teacher. They have a 16-year-old child living with them. 

She has been involved in agricultural for more than 10 years. This business has always helped her to support the family. With support from husband she is able to increase the number of animals she manages. She is asking for a loan of ksh.15,000 to buy sheep to fatten and resell.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Zokir

texts.ru:
Зокир и его семья   живут далеко в горах. Он занимается выращиванием скота. Кроме этого вида деятельности Зокир больше не чем не занимается, так как в горах только откорм скота актуален. Он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Зокиру очень трудно, но он не сдается и старается развивать свой бизнес. Он понимает,что если он опустит руки его семья не проживет в горах, поэтому Зокир старается идти только вперед и не отчаивается. Один раз в две недели Зокир вывозит своих скотов на рынок и продает их, и сразу же покупает молодых телят.Сейчас у него на счету 10 голов крупно рогатого скота. Он планирует увеличить поголовье скота но денежных средств не хватает и в связи с этим Зокир  обратился в организацию Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. 
 На полученный кредит Зокир хочет приобрести одного теленка и откормив до весны продать за выгодную цену. Он  очень надеется на поддержку от организации Арванд.
texts.en:
Zokir and his family live high up in the mountains.  He is in the business of raising cattle.  This is Zokir's only business because, in the mountains, raising cattle is the only thing that works.  He is the only breadwinner for his family.  Zokir has a very difficult life, but he doesn't give up and he is trying to develop his business.  He knows that if he loses heart, his family will not survive.  So, Zokir tries to keep moving forward and to never despair.  

Once every two weeks, Zokir takes his cattle to the market where he sells them and he immediately buys calves.  Right now, he has 10 head of cattle.  He is planning to increase the size of his herd, but he does not have sufficient financial means to do so.  Because of this, Zokir applied to MDO Arvand for financial support.  

Zokir wants to use his loan to buy one more calf, which he will raise and fatten for sale at an advantageous price this spring.  He is reliant on MDO Arvand's support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Чамшед мужчина в возрасте 28 лет. Проживает в сельской местности. Женат и имеет 2 детей. Супруга занимается воспитаем детей. Сам Чамшед не имеет  высшего образования, так как не было  возможности учиться.
  Зарабатывает на жизнь купле-продажей угля. Этим бизнесом он занимается на протяжении 5 лет, а начинал он его с  10 мешков угля. На данный момент он закупает его тоннами. У него хороший спрос на товар так как сейчас зима и многие люди отапливают свои дома углем.  Это  единственный доход в семье. Так как сам Чамшед не учился он мечтает чтобы его дети учились и получили высшее образование, зарабатывали на жизнь не продажей угля а по профессии, работали в достойных учреждениях. Чтобы воплотить свою мечту в реальность Чамшед трудится день и ночь.
  Чамшед берет кредит  для покупки угля и этим самым он хочет увеличить свой товарооборот. Очень надеется на поддержку от организации Арванд.
texts.en:
Jamshed is a 28 year old man and he lives in a rural area.  He is married and has two children.  His wife takes care of the children full time.  Jamshed doesn't have a higher education because there was never a possibility for him to study.  He earns his living selling coal and he's been in business for 10 years.  He started his business with ten bags of coal, but now he buys it up by the ton.  There is a strong demand for coal right now because it's winter and many people heat their homes with it.  This is his family's only source of income.

Since he never had the chance, Jamshed's dream is that his children will get higher educations and will work, not selling coal, but in respectable professions.  Jamshed works day and night to make his dream a reality.  

Jamshed is taking out this loan to buy coal so he can increase his sales.  He is relying on MDO Arvand's support.

loans.use: to purchase coal

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Enterprising Victor is 33 years old, single and currently living with his parents.  He is looking for a loan as he wants to buy supplies such as fertiliser and pesticide.  He wants to give his coffee plants some help, with the aim of keeping them in good condition while they are growing, so as to have a good quality product.  Victor's only limitation is a lack of money needed to continue growing.  He depends on this work to move forward so he is asking for a loan.  This is his first with FUDECOSUR.  Victor has no loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR has provided him with credit with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.es:
Doña María es propietaria de un local de venta de comida y de tortillas ubicada en la comunidad de masa chapa un lugar turístico por las hermosa playas del pacifico nicaragüense.
Por muchos años se había dedicado a vender mariscos hasta que decide poner su propia microempresa, sin embargo por iniciativa propia decide poner su propio negocio para contribuir en su desarrollo personal y familiar, mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
Su negocio tiene mayor demanda, por lo que necesita mayor capital de trabajo para atender con calidad en su punto de venta.
Es una madre soltera, trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante y ser un agente de cambio en su comunidad y su familia.
texts.en:
María is the owner of a food- and tortilla-selling establishment located in the community of Masa Chapa, a tourist area near the beautiful beaches of the Nicaraguan Pacific. For many years she had made a living selling seafood, until she decided to start her own small business. She took the initiative to start her own business to contribute to her personal development and that of her family, improving her children's living conditions.

Her business has a greater demand, so she needs more working capital to attend to her sales location with quality. She is a hard-working single mother with the desire to get ahead and to be an agent of change in her community and her family.

loans.use: To buy pork, oil and corn.

loans.name: Masturajon

texts.ru:
Мастурачон молодая женщина. Она любящая мать, имеет одного ребенка. К сожалению  муж развелся с ней год назад и она одна воспитывает дочку. Очень трудно воспитывать ребенка без отца.  Мастурачону  конечно же помогают ее родители, но этого мало, ей не хватает мужского плеча на которое она могла бы опереться. 
Мастурачон с малых лет любила что то шить и  вышивать. И когда подросла закончила курсы кройки и шитья. Теперь она профессиональная портниха. У нее очень много заказов, она покупает ткани на оптовом рынке, шьет из этих тканей женские национальные платья и вышивает разные узоры и продает клиентам. Мастурачон настоящая   рукодельница, к тому же это занятие ее кормит.  
Она обратилась в организацию Арванд, чтобы приобрести мебель и холодильник. Мастурачон хочет обставить свою квартиру необходимыми вещами. Она надеется  на финансовую поддержку со стороны организации Арванд.
texts.en: Masturajon is a young woman and a loving mother of 1 child. Unfortunately, her husband divorced her 1 year ago and she is raising her daughter by herself. Of course her parents help her, but this doesn't make up for not having a man's shoulder to lean on. From an early age, Masturajon loved to sew and embroider. When she grew up, she completed dressmaking courses, and she is now a professional seamstress and has a lot of clients. She buys fabric at a wholesale market then sews national traditional dresses, embroiders them with various designs, then sells them to her clients. She is very skilled at sewing and this ability allows her to earn a living. Masturajon has approached Arvand for a loan to buy furniture and a fridge. She wants to furnish her apartment with the necessities. She is hoping for financial support from Arvand.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and a refrigerator

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, actualmente está soltera pero tiene 2 hijos pequeños  de 2 y 8 años de edad y vive junto a ellos en la casa de sus padres.La actividad que realiza Liz es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo tales como cosmeticos , perfumes entre otros y los vende entre sus amistades, familiares y personas conocidas muchas ,veces al contado y otras a crédito, garcias a esta actividad ha logrado buenos resultados y su vez tiene una buena cartera de clientes. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 3 años y siempre ha trabajado sola. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que puede manejar su tiempo libre y asi dedicarle el tiempo necesario a sus niños pequeños , además se siente muy tranquila generando sus propios ingresos económicos con los cuales puede pagar los gastos de su hogar. Por lo contrario comenta que le incomoda cuando sus clientes se retrasan con el pago de sus créditos, pero eso no la desanima y tiene planes de seguir trabajando ya que se siente bien y conforme con su negocio, pues le da la independencia que ella necesita.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1100 soles para surtir su stock de cosméticos comprando distintos perfumes, talcos, cremas y algunas joyas, a su vez se siente agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con un línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en: Twenty-nine year old Liz is hard-working, persevering and really wants to prosper.  She is currently single but has two young children, aged two and eight years old.  She lives with them at her parents' house.  Liz makes a living selling catalog beauty products, such as cosmetics and perfumes.  She sells them to friends, relatives and other people that she knows.  A lot of the time people pay in cash, while others pay in installments.  She has good results in this work and also has a good customer base.  She has had the business nearly three years and has always worked alone.  What Liz likes about the business is that she can manage her free time and so spend the necessary time with her young children.  Moreover she likes generating her own income and using it to pay household bills.  However, she says it bothers her when customers are late with payments though it does not discourage her.  She plans to continue work as she feels good and satisfied with her business. It gives her the independence she needs.  On this occasion, Liz is applying for 1100 Nuevo Soles to stock up on cosmetics and buy different perfumes, talcum powders, creams and some jewellery.  Liz is grateful for the opportunity of being able to count on a loan to advance with her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mayadevi

texts.es:
Mayadevi  es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su mama la cual se encarga de todos los gastos de servicios, ella cuenta con un ambiente la cual es su dormitorio, la habitación es de ladrillo y el piso es de tablón, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como secretaria recepcionista en el aeropuerto de la ciudad de El Alto percibiendo un salario mensual, ella se encarga de sus gastos de transporte y alimentación.
Ella continúa estudiando fotografía y ahora solicita el crédito para el costo de matrícula y útiles necesarios para continuar su carrera.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Mayadevi is single and has no children.  She lives in her mother's house, who takes care of all the bills.  Mayadevi has her own space which is her bedroom.  The room is made of bricks and the floor consists of wooden planks.  The house is located in the Sopocachi area of La Paz city.

Mayadevi is currently working as a secretary/receptionist at the airport in the city of El Alta.  She receives a monthly salary and is responsible for her transport and food costs.

She is continuing to study photography and is currently applying for a loan to cover matriculation costs and the necessary materials to continue with her degree.

This is the second time she has come to IMPRO and Kiva for a loan.

loans.use: to pay matriculation fees and to buy the necessary materials to continue with her studies in photography.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida's group is composed of two hardworking women. Aida is 21 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past four years, Aida has been working hard to manage her boutique, which acquires ladies' clothes for sale. 

To help expand her business, Aida has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve on the business and buy more cartons of clothes to sell, and will help Aida generate greater profits and catch the attention of other customers. Aida hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Aida is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
