loans.use: to improve on the business and buy more cartons of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru:
Бунафша является женщиной 33 лет, она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж находиться в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сама Бунафша   занимается  торговлей  продуктов питания в течении 2 лет. То что присылает ей ее муж не достаточны для проживания семьи, поэтому она сама старается выживать в сложных ситуациях.  За товаром ездит сама в город, старший сын помогает ей в бизнесе хотя ему всего лишь 12 лет. Бунафша мечтает что бы ее дети выросли в достатке и не в чем не нуждались. 
В этом году она хочет провести ремонт в квартире на накопленные средства, а чтобы сделать капитальный  ремонт накопленные средства не достаточны, поэтому она планирует пока увеличить свой товарооборот и расширить свой бизнес. 
 Бунафша на запрашиваемый кредит от Арванд, хочет закупить большой ассортимент продуктов питания.  Она надеется,что сможет накопить нужную сумму и через пол года начнет ремонт в своей квартире.
texts.en: Bunafsha is a 33-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, and she has been working in food sales for the past 2 years. The money that her husband sends home is not sufficient to provide for the family, so Bunafsha tries to make it through the hard times on her own. She travels to the city to stock up on inventory herself, and her eldest son helps her out with the business even though he is only 12 years old. Her dream is for her children to grow up without wanting for anything. This year she wants to use her savings to carry out major renovations to her apartment, but the money she has put by will not be enough to cover such expenses, which is why she wants to increase her turnover and expand her business. Bunafsha will use the loan she receives from Arvand to purchase a wide variety of groceries to sell. She hopes to save up enough money so that in 6 months' time she can begin renovating her apartment.

loans.use: to buy food for her shop

loans.name: Yunensius

texts.en: Yunensius is 48 years old. He is married and has three daughters. Yunensius runs a kiosk business to fulfill his household needs and educational fees of the children. Besides operating the kiosk business, he also sells petrol at retail; he has built a simple shelf from wood to put the bottles on. Yunensius really wants to improve his businesses in order to earn more income, but unfortunately he has very limited capital. That condition leads him to propose a loan from TLM of 3,000,000 IDR. The loan assistance will help Yunensius to buy more petrol and to support his wife with adequate business capital to initiate a business selling cakes.

loans.use: to buy more petrol and to support his wife with adequate business capital to start a business selling cakes.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married with three children--all of whom go to school. She has a business selling cosmetics and has been in this business for four years. She doesn't take care of any additional family members and doesn't have any other income-generating activity.

Stella has applied for a loan in Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cream relaxers, toiletries, bathing soap, hair oil and hair extensions. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully-stocked cosmetics shop and also to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair extensions, toiletries, bathing soap and hair oils.

loans.name: Stanislav

texts.ru:
Станислав эффективно использовал средства, полученные от КИВА в предыдущий раз. Он сделал отопление во всех теплицах, поставил большой котёл, вследствие чего увеличился доход с огорода. Благодаря полученным средствам Станислав смог позволить своей дочери пройти необходимое лечение. У нее было искривление позвоночника. Они пролечились в больнице, прошли курс массажа и ситуация заметно улучшилась. 
В этот раз Станислав надеется вложить 23 000 гривен в закупку удобрений, угля и пленки для покрытия теплиц в новом сезоне. Закупив уголь и правильно утеплив теплицы, Станислав надеется пораньше получить урожай и быстро его реализовать.
texts.en: Stanislav used his previous Kiva loan effectively. He put heating in all his greenhouses, installed  a large boiler, and this allowed him to increase his income. Thanks to these earnings, he was able to pay for his daughter's medical care. She had a curvature of the spine for which she was hospitalised and underwent massage therapy. Now her situation has markedly improved. This time, Stanislav is seeking a loan of 23,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to buy fertilizer, coal, and plastic covering for his greenhouses for the new season. He hopes that buying coal and properly insulating his greenhouses will allow him to get an earlier harvest that he can sell quickly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, coal, and plastic covering

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en: Tamaz is 35 years old. He is single and lives in a small village of Zeda Sakara with his parents who are provided with retirement pensions. Also, Tamaz’s mother gets a refugee pension from the local government. The family is involved in the agricultural business. They have a plot of land where maize is grown. In addition, the family members run a small dairy farm with a milk cow whose milk is used in cheese products. Tamaz sells the cheese and harvested products locally. In addition, he has a pig and sells piglets seasonally. Tamaz has requested credit for the construction of greenhouses. His loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Tamaz will purchase materials to construct greenhouse on the family-owned land (iron pillars and polyethylene). He will grow different kinds of vegetables throughout the whole year. They will sell the harvested products on the local open market. The income of the family will significantly increase. They will be able to combat their poverty and in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to start up a greenhouse business

loans.name: Mamakor

texts.en: Mamakor is 29 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is single and has two children ages 5 and 9 that are presently in school and live at home. She is a high school graduate. For the past nine years she has been running a shop where she sells cement. She started this business when her father was working as a builder. With the little money that she received from him she managed to establish her business, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes lot of profits and it keeps her busy. Most interestingly, she has learned different kinds of local languages. She is requesting a loan to buy more cement to expand her business. Her plans are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cement to expand her business.

loans.name: Shikunga Group

texts.en:
Alfonze’s group has 17 farmers and is located in Kakamega South District. Alfonze is pictured on the right of Shikunga Group with his hand raised. Alfonze is pictured amongst the 5 men and 12 women of his group. He will receive input loans to plant half an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Alfonze joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Alfonze joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer and access the best input prices. 

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Alfonze was only able to harvest five bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 12 bags per half acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school. Alfonze’s group members will each receive input loans for a half acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 8.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en: Mwanarusi is grateful for her previous loan, which has helped expand her business and ensure that she gains her share from the market. She now has requested a loan amounting to 50,000 KES to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a 37-year-old married woman. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a food stall where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located at a viable and busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing food to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standard of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 51-year-old lady from Kakamega county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and a mother of five adult children.

She sells cereals in the center. She has been doing this business for the last 12 years and normally makes a monthly income of KES.13,800. She is taking her seventh loan, which she will use to purchase maize stock, beans, and green grams (mung beans) for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

She hopes to expand her business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase maize stock, beans, and green grams (mung beans).

loans.name: Alfonso Wilson

texts.es:
El cliente Alonso, tiene 59 años, vive en Libertad. Empezó su negocio trabajando desde muy joven, sus padres le enseñaron la actividad. El era ayudante de un taller en Guayaquil luego decidió ponerse su propio negocio en la Península de Santa Elena
El trabajo lo realiza con la ayuda de Dios, todos los días de ocho de la mañana a seis de la tarde, este es su negocio con el que sale adelante día a día para sacar adelante a su familia. 

La dificultad que tiene es la falta de financiamiento. Está casado, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene  dos hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal.
Con el préstamo quiere comprar madera para poder hacer mas muebles y asi comenzar con su sueño de tener una mueblería para así tener mejores ganancias y cancelar los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Alonso is 59 years old and lives in Libertad. He started in this line of work as a young man because his parents taught him this business. Alonso worked as an assistant at a workshop in Guayaquil, but later decided to start his own business on the peninsula of Santa Elena.

He goes about his work with the help of God. Alonso works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. His business enables him to help his family move forward each day. His main difficulty is the lack of financing. Alonso is married and his wife devotes her time to the household chores. They have two children who are studying at a state school.

With this loan, Alonso will buy wood for making more furniture. He can now fulfill his dream of having a furniture shop so that he can generate more income and pay for his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more wood.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раиса – из Новой Каховки. Она уже 10 лет работает в сфере торговли на одном из местных рынков. Раиса торгует б/у одеждой. Ее товар представлен в широком ассортименте, всегда хорошо расходится. 
Сумма в размере 8 000 гривен необходима Раисе для того, чтобы осуществить поездку за  закупкой партии одежды секонд хенд. Полученные от реализации очередной партии товара средства Раиса планирует вложить в последующее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Raisa is from Novaya Kahovka. For the last 10 years, she has been working in sales at one of the local markets where she sells second-hand clothing. She offers a wide range of clothes that sell well. Raisa now needs a loan of 8,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to finance a trip to buy a shipment of second-hand clothes. She plans to use income generated by the sale of these clothes to invest in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Olga Ovidia

texts.es: Olga, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, vive en  el municipio de Esparta Atlántida. Olga tiene 7 años de dedicarse  a la venta de cosméticos, como desodorantes, champú, cremas, lociones, desinfectantes etc. La venta es realizada de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar mas productos de cosméticos y desinfectantes para la venta. Con esta inversión va poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. Su plan es que el negocio siga en crecimiento y lograr que sus hijos se gradúen.
texts.en:
Olga is 47 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the town of Esparta Atlántida.

For the past seven years, Olga has been selling cosmetics such as deodorants, shampoo, crèmes, lotions, disinfectants, and other products. She conducts her sales as a traveling vendor and by taking orders. Olga is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 HNL so that she can buy more cosmetic products and disinfectants to sell. With this investment, she will be able to offer a variety of products to her customers.

Her plans include seeing her business continue to grow and helping her children to graduate.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and disinfectants to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en: Mwanamkasi is applying for a second loan. She is still repaying the previous loan but her business has improved tremendously. She has applied for loan amounting to ksh.25000 to buy cooking oil and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Leticia Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña Leticia es comerciante de mariscos, por muchos ha contribuido al sostén económico de su familia. 
La forma de comercializar este tipo de producto es de forma ambulante de casa en casa.
Necesita una fuente de financiamiento para distribuir este producto en diferentes mercado de Managua y de esta forma incrementar sus ingresos.
Su estado civil es acompañada y madre de tres hijos, todos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Leticia sells seafood. She has contributed a lot to the economic wellbeing of her family. She sells these products door to door. 

She needs a source of finance to distribute her products in different markets in Managua and so increase her income.
She has a common law husband and is a mother of three children, all of whom are school age.

loans.use: to buy seafood

loans.name: Sagrada Familia 2 Group

texts.es:
El Comité Sagrada Familia 2  se encuentra en el 2º ciclo es de la ciudad de Santaní y está integrada por 13 señoras.  Ellas se esfuerzan por salir adelante e ir creciendo en el emprendimiento que cada una hace.
La Señora María, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de comidas, su familia se mantiene trabajando junto  con ella para así poder salir adelante. María quiere, algún día, poder tener un gran establecimiento de comidas, para que de esa forma pueda ofrecer a más clientes sus comidas y también tener mejores ingresos con los que ayudará a su familia.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo y demás, los cuales son los principales que siempre utiliza para poder hacer sus comidas.
texts.en:
The committee known as “Sagrada Familia 2” (Sacred Family 2) is in its second loan cycle. This group is from the city of Santaní and its members include 13 women. They strive to move forward and grow in each of their business enterprises.

One of the members, Sra. María, sells food. She and her family support themselves by working together in order to get ahead. Someday María would like to have a large food establishment so that she can offer food to more customers. This would also enable her to generate more income so that she can help her family.

María is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, and other items. These are the main ingredients that she always uses in preparing her dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Loy

texts.en:
Loy is 19 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 5 years, Loy has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells local drinks. 

To help expand her business, Loy has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more millet that will be used to make the local brew for selling, and will help Loy to generate greater profits and be in the position to provide for herself. Loy hopes that in the future she will be able to own a plot of land. 

Loy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more millet that will be used to make the local brew for sell,

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 17 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Christine has been working hard to manage her bar which sells local drinks. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet to make the local brew. It will help Christine to generate greater profits and be in a position to provide for herself and her family. Christine hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a big house of her own. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy millet to make the local brew

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 7 years. She describes herself to be courageous and jovial woman. She operates a general store where she sells home products, cereals and provides M-pesa services (a mobile-phone based money transfer and microfinancing service). She has been involved in this business for 4 years. 

Her business is located at a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy home products to sell. Her business goal is to run another M-pesa retail outlet within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell.

loans.name: Telnith

texts.es:
Telnith, de 43 años esta casada con Rodolfo  y tienen dos hijos , cuentan con  una casa propia donde reside junto a su familia . Actualmente Telnith se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos ,  ropa, zapatos y otros productos por catálogo, tiene un local en  el interior de su vivienda, desde este lugar atiende muy cordialmente a sus clientes los cuales son sus  vecinos y familiares.Le gusta de su trabajo ya que tiene la posibilidad de realizar otras actividades además de tener ese contacto directo con la gente ya que es muy sociable, siempre está trayendo artículos novedosos y ropa de buena calidad, es por eso que siempre tiene clientes.
Este sera el crédito número 4 con MFP razon por la cual está muy contenta ya que tendra un apoyo financiero para su trabajo , por otro lado ella se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, por esto solicita 1500 soles para la compra de productos de catálogo tales como  cosméticos , perfumes y ropa .
texts.en:
Telnith, 43, is married to Rodolfo and has two children. They live together in their own home. Telnith sells cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and other catalog merchandise. She has a space in her house where she graciously waits on her customers, who are neighbors and relatives. She likes her work because she has a chance to do other things and has direct contact with people. She has loyal clients because she is very social and is always offering new items and good quality clothing. 

This will be her fourth loan cycle with MFP, and she is pleased to have the financial support. She promises to make her payments on time. She is applying for a loan of 1500 soles to purchase catalog merchandise such as cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en: Demetria is a 45-years-old married woman and a fish vendor from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of  her income. Demetria is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market. With this, she will be able to sell and increase her profit. In the future, Demetria hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is now 36 years old. For three years she has practiced mixed-farming as her primary business with a hotel as her secondary business with a monthly income of KES. 15,000 which she uses to sustain her family. 

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy farm fertilizer and sowing seeds. With the expected profit from the business she will venture into large scale farming. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizer and sowing seeds.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a 61-year-old lady. She is married to Daniel and a mother of three children. She sells cereals and also GNLD products. She has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Jemima's third loan from KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy assorted cereals, such as dry maize, beans, and peas, as well as GNLD products for sale. In the future, she wants to open a cosmetic shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of assorted cereals and GNLD health products

loans.name: Abilio Alberto

texts.es:
Abilio es un hombre de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus 5 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lamentablemente hace poco tiempo Abilio sufrió la pérdida de su amada esposa, desde entonces él se ha dedicado completamente a sacar adelante a su familia; desde muy joven Abilio tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres ya que tenía mucho hermanos, motivo por el cual no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios y cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Abilio trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Abilio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño terreno, el cual en poco tiempo empezará a construir para tener su propio hogar, ya que actualmente vive en la una pequeña casa alquila que tiene poca seguridad, así pues Abilio seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindarle sueña buena educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Abilio, 37, lives in the city of Ica in the Santiago district with his beloved five children, who are his reason for living. Sadly, Abilio's wife died recently, and since then he has dedicated himself to providing for his family.  Abilio started working at an early age so that he could help his parents, as he has many siblings; therefore, he couldn't finish high school or study a profession, though he would have liked to have done so.

On his own initiative and with dedication, Abilio works in the fields for a city agriculture fund. He works every day from early morning for as many as 10 hours. He likes his job, which he feels is going well because he works hard and treats others kindly.

Abilio thanks the Kiva lenders, as their support will allow him to buy a small piece of land on which he will soon start building his own house. He now lives in a small rented house that isn't very safe. Abilio will keep working hard to achieve his great dream to give his children a good education and a decent standard of living.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 30 years old and lives in Vanadzor city with his wife, newborn child and parents. Gevorg's father is a driver and uses his minibus to transport passengers, and he shares their family's expenses with Gevorg.
 
Gevorg is engaged in the trading of household goods. He rents a small shop in Vanadzor city which he has comfortably furnished and where he sells hairdryers, irons, food processors, blenders, toasters, electric kettles and different kitchen sets. Gevorg buys the merchandise from wholesale centers in Yerevan and transports them to his shop for resale. Gevorg has been engaged in this occupation for more than 5 years. His business is very profitable as the shop is situated in a remote place of Vanadzor city. Gevorg himself is very pleased. Such activity brings him more revenue, and he hopes to expand his business.

Gevorg decided to run a new stall in his shop for the resale of household goods, and he hopes to receive a good profit from that activity because of the spring holidays in Armenia. 

Gevorg needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Dram to buy a large assortment of household goods, statues, candles, decorative lamps, etc. for resale, which will increase his business income.

loans.use: To buy a large assortment of household goods, statues, candles, decorative lamps, etc., for resale, which will increase his business income.

loans.name: Dúo El Carmen Group

texts.es:
DUO EL CARMEN
FLORINDA ES MADRE SOLTERA TIENE UNA HIJA DE CUATRO AÑOS,  ELLA INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE DOS AÑOS, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE GAS PROPANO, VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD  DE VILLA NUEVA MUNICIPIO DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE GUATEMALA, ELLA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO YA QUE POR SER LA UNICA QUE CUENTA CON VENTA DE GAS EN LA COMUNIDAD NO LE ALCANZAN LOS UNICOS DIEZ CILINDROS QUE TIENE POR QUE EL REPARTIDOR LA VISITA DOS VECES A LA SEMANA,  ES POR ESO QUE QUIERE COMPRAR DE QUINCE A VEINTE CILINDROS MAS YA QUE LO QUE ELLA GANA ES SOLO EL VEINTICINCO POR CIENTO  Y ES POR ESO QUE QUIERE TENER MAS MERCADERIA PARA OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS.   EL SUEÑO MAS GRANDE QUE ELLA TIENE ES TENER SU CASA FABRICADA DE  BLOCKS YA QUE SU CASA ACTUALMENTE ES DE LAMINA ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO SOLICITADO.
texts.en:
Communal bank Duo el Carmen

Florinda is the single mother of a four-year-old daughter. Two years ago, she started a business selling propane gas tanks. She lives in Villa Nueva in Guatemala department. She is applying for a loan to invest in her business since she is the only one selling gas in her town. She can afford to buy just ten tanks when the distributor visits twice a week. She wants to buy 15 to 20 more because she only makes 25 percent. If she has more merchandise, her earnings will be greater. 

Florinda dreams of having a house made of cement blocks, rather then the one made of wood where she lives now. She hopes that the lenders will fund her loan.

loans.use: to buy propane gas tanks to sell.

loans.name: Barrio Alegre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Barrio Alegre está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 9 de las integrantes ya superaron el nivel tres del indicar por medio del acompañamiento y asesoramiento constantes.
Una de las integrantes con quien se esta trabajando es la Sra. Andresa, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Entre el trabajo que ella hace es la venta de productos de belleza Avon la cual empezó recientemente, y en lo que está empezando a crecer y mejorar. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y expandirse, es por eso que solicita de este crédito para la compra de Joyas de plata para acompañar la venta con la venta de avon, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Barrio Alegre” (Cheerful Neighbourhood) is in its 5th cycle of the women’s committee programme. All its members work and help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey and now 9 members have exceeded the level three indicator thanks to the support and constant advice they have received.

One of the members involved is Andresa. In her last survey she had a level of poverty in the level one indicator. She works selling Avon beauty products. She started this business recently and it is starting to grow and improve. Her dream is to continue growing and expanding her business. For this reason she is requesting this loan in order to buy silver jewellery to sell, which will complement her sales of Avon products. This will help her to achieve her business plan which in turn will help improve her income.

loans.use: to buy jewellery for resale

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva, de 38 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo con quien tuvo 3 hijos, a los que adora y educa con mucho esfuerzo. Juntos viven en la casa de material noble que ellos compraron hace 10 años. 
Todo comenzó desde hace 20 años cuando ella y su esposo decidieron formar una familia, la formación de su esposo en este arte de los fuegos artificiales se convirtió en la fuente de ingresos que en la actualidad sostiene su hogar. Ella esta contenta porque trabaja con toda su familia; en las mañanas se dedica a la fabricación de fuegos artificiales y en las tardes atienden a sus clientes en la calidez de su hogar, “ser pirotécnico es todo un arte ya que  en conjunto todos diseñan la manera de sorprender a los clientes, que cada vez son más exigentes ”, comenta. Es así que tienen diferentes precios y cualidades que varían con el diseño de los fuegos artificiales. Además es conciente de la seguridad que  tiene que ofrecer a sus clientes, por ello siempre mantiene en regla los permisos de su gobernación y las normas establecidas como también la seguridad ambiental, estas reglas ha mantienen segura a su familia, “siempre tengo que ser precavida”, comenta. Los meses de mayor venta son los meses festivos y espera poder mejorar cada día  para mantener contentos a sus clientes.Genoveva agradece el apoyo recibido, pues le ayuda a forjar su negocio y a valorar el esfuerzo que realiza día a día. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues aprendió a ser responsable. Genoveva, invertirá los 1500 soles  en la compra de insumos para desarrollar su trabajo como: carrizos pequeños, fierros, alambres y demás.
texts.en:
Genoveva, age 38, is an unassuming woman who lives with her husband.  They have three children, whom she adores and is raising with great effort.  They live together in a house made of sturdy material, which they bought ten years ago.

It all started 20 years ago when she and her husband decided to form a family.  Her husband’s training in the art of fireworks became the source of income that now supports her household.

She is happy because she works with all of her family.  In the mornings she makes the fireworks, and in the afternoons she tends to her customers in the warmth of her home.  “Being a pyrotechnician is an art because together they all design the way to surprise the customers; each time is more challenging,” she says.

That is why they have different prices and qualities that vary with the design of the fireworks.  Also, she is aware of the safety that she has to offer her customers.  Therefore, she always maintains the government permits and the established norms as well as a safe environment.  These rules have kept her family safe.  “I always need to be careful,” she says.

The months that she sells the most are the holiday months.  She hopes to be able to improve each day in order to keep her customers happy.

Genoveva is grateful for the support she has received.  It helps her to shape her business and to value the effort she makes day to day.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She has learned how to be responsible.  Genoveva will use the 1,500 soles to buy supplies to develop her work.  She will buy things like small reeds, metal, wires, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making fireworks.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is married, and his wife operates a green grocery business. They both come from very humble families. They have a young child, and they live in their own home that they obtained with much sacrifice.

Dominic is dedicated to selling goats for meat, since it is a very profitable product that has already helped improve their family's daily quality of life.

For lack of capital, Dominic has decided to apply for a loan of 30,000 KES from Yehu Microfinance to purchase goats for rearing and, later, for selling at a profit.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es: Guillermo Antonio vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene varios años laborando lo que le ha dado experiencia en el rubro convirtiéndose asi en uno de los mejores, obtiene las mejores ganancias, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en un lugar accesible y con mucha incidencia agrícola además muy cercano a su vivienda, tiene mucha clientela y comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad solo producto de calidad, a buenos precios y con excelente servicio ; Guillermo es un hombre entregado a su labor, dispuesto a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus objetivos lo mas impórtate en su vida es su familia y en las ultimas semanas se ha visto de la necesidad de construir un servicio sanitario pues eso ha incomodado en el hogar y se necesita mantener la salubridad, quiere realizar las modificaciones lo mas pronto posible para la comodidad de todos, es un hombre comprometido y no duda que podrá realizar los cambios obteniendo el éxito deseado, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, inodoro, herramientas etc. Guillermo Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, esta agradecido con la ayuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Guillermo Antonio lives with his life partner and their children in his own home.  He farms for a living, specifically corn and sorghum.  He has been working for many years, which has given him experience in this profession and made him one of the best who makes the best profits.  His farmland is in an accessible area with a lot of agriculture and it is also very close to his home.  He has a lot of customers and he sells all around his area.  He only sells quality produce at good prices and with excellent service.  Guillermo is a man who is dedicated to his work and is willing to give his all to accomplish his goals.  The most important thing in his life is his family and over the past few weeks he has realized that he needs to build a bathroom as this has been an inconvenience at home and he needs to keep things sanitary.  He wants to make the modifications as soon as possible for everyone's comfort.  He is a committed man and he has no doubt he will be able to make the changes successfully.  He needs money, but he does not have enough capital, which is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy cement, bricks, a toilet, tools, etc.  Guillermo Antonio has good credit references and he will repay his debt.  He is thankful for the help and he hopes to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, a toilet, and tools

loans.name: Flora Elena

texts.es:
Flora de 44 años de edad, originaria de Jalapa, Nueva Segovia pero actualmente vive en Managua, casada, madre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 17 y 20 años, se dedica a estudiar la carrera de Derecho y al mismo tiempo trabaja vendiendo e cosméticos,  con mucho esfuerzo ha podido estudiar y a la misma vez trabajar para tener ingresos extras y  poder  salir adelante  con sus estudios. Ella decidió estudiar la carrera de derecho porque desea ser alguien independiente y generar ingresos por sí misma, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda a vender sus  cosméticos.
Ella está solicitando el financiamiento para poder pagar el Curso de Titulación. Una de sus metas próximas es poder sacar otra especialidad en derecho, con el propósito de obtener mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Flora, 44, was born in Jalapa, Nueva Segovia but now lives in Managua. She is married and the mother of two children, ages 17 and 20. She is studying law, and she also sells cosmetics. She studies hard, and, at the same time, she works to have extra income and to continue her coursework.

Flora decided to study law because she wanted to be independent and earn her own living. She says her husband is supportive and helps her sells cosmetics. She is applying for a loan to pay for her degree program. One of her goals is to finish her law degree so the she has better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for her degree program.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is 41 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is married with four children between the ages of 18 and 25 years, only one of which lives at home and is in school. She unfortunately did not attend school, and she has been involved in her business for the past 15 years.

Presently, she is selling oil, salt, rice, pepper, onions, tomatoes and charcoal in the local market. She started this business with 1000 LD given to her by her mother, from whom she learned this trade. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, salt, rice, pepper, onions, tomatoes and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Abran Gilberto

texts.es: Abran Gilberto vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia , él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol además para complementar los gastos del hogar vende ganado, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, el terreno esta en un lugar accesible apto para el cultivo y con suelo fértil, todo lo que produce lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además se caracteriza por tener el mejor servicio; Abran es un hombre decidido, responsable y muy trabajador, tiene muchas metas para el futuro y con empeño y constancia piensa alcanzarlas, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, frijol, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. Abran Gilberto tiene buenas referencias de pago, se siente satisfecho con la colaboración, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Abran Gilberto lives with his life partner and children in their own house. He grows corn, sorghum, and beans; he also sells livestock to pay the household expenses. He has farmed for years, and the valuable experience he has garnered helps him produce great harvests. His land is accessible, and the fertile soil is good for planting. He sells his crops all around his community, and he has many customers because they know he offers quality products at affordable prices and with great service.

Abran is determined, responsible, and very hardworking. He has many goals and feels that he can achieve them with effort and perseverance. He took losses during the last growing season that he would like to recoup, but he lacks capital. He is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn seed, sorghum, beans, weed killer, fertilizer, and tools. Abran Gilberto has good credit references, and he is pleased with the collaboration. He is certain he can pay his debt, while offering his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, sorghum, beans, weed killer, fertilizer, and tools.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be jovial, determined and optimistic. 

She operates a food stall where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located at a productive business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a loan of 20,000 KES successfully.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Sergio un humilde señor con deseo de superación, con 53 años de edad, originario de Managua, casado, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de  17 y 20 años respectivamente, se dedica a estudiar  en la universidad, la carrera de derecho, trabaja como pastor de una iglesia Evangélica. Sergio está culminando su último año de la carrera. Él dice que decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta mucho y a la misma vez le permite ejercer su trabajo por cuenta propia, sin necesidad de andar trabajándole otras personas, una vez ya finalizada su carrera, piensa aprovechar el tiempo desempeñado su profesión en el ámbito laboral. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien le ayuda a pagar sus estudios.
Sergio está requiriendo el financiamiento para pagar el Curso de titulación. Esto le ayudara  graduarse de la carrera de derecho, con el objetivo de superarse y poder cumplir uno de sus más grande sueño  salir adelante con su familia, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder establecer una oficina  propia de asesoría y servicios notariales en su casa.
texts.en:
Sergio is a humble man who wants to better himself.  He is 53 years old and he is from Managua.  He is married and has two children who are 17 and 20, respectively.  He is studying law at a university and he works as a pastor at an evangelical church.  Sergio is finishing up his last year of school.  He tells us he chose this field because he likes it a lot and because it allows him to work on his own instead of having to work for other people.  Once he is done with his studies, he plans to practice his profession in a work environment.  He relies on the help of his wife, who helps him pay for his education.

Sergio needs a loan to pay for his final course.  This will help him graduate with a major in law so that he can better himself and achieve one of his greatest dreams: to get ahead with his family.  His future plans include opening his own consultancy and notary in his home.

loans.use: to pay for his final course

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Rene Alonso

texts.es: Rene Alonso vive junto a su pequeña familia su compañera de vida y su hijo; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de granos básicos maíz y maicillo, además cultiva hortaliza pepino para complementar los gastos del hogar; tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de mucha incidencia agrícola  muy cercano a la zona donde reside, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños y ya tiene mucha clientela pues todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Rene es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presentan, en la última cosecha tuvo pérdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, pepino fertilizante, insecticida, etc. Rene Alonso tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, esta muy agradecido con la ayuda por eso asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida llena de las comodidades que se merecen.
texts.en: Rene Alonso lives with his small family: his life partner and their son.  He farms for a living, specifically the staple grains corn and sorghum, as well as cucumbers to cover the household expenses.  He has worked in this profession for several years and he has gained a lot of experience, which allows him to get the best harvests.  His farmland is in an area with a lot of agriculture that is very close to where he lives.  He sells in all the neighboring areas and he has a big clientele as everything he sells is of the best quality, at reasonable prices, and delivered with excellent service.  Rene is an enterprising man who really wants to get ahead.  He is always on the lookout for new opportunities.  He suffered losses with his last crop and he wants to make up for them, which is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan so he can buy corn seed, bean seed, cucumber seed, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.  Rene Alonso has good credit references and he is very responsible.  He is very thankful for the help and he promises to repay his debt while giving his family a better quality of life full of the comforts they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, bean seed, cucumber seed, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Domingo Antonio vive junto  a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, frijol y sorgo además para complementar  trabaja de jornal, los diez años de trabajo le han dado experiencia valiosa que le ha permito obtener las mejores cosechas y al mismo ha obtenido muy buenas ganancias; el terreno donde se cultiva esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda; comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesita a precio accesible además de un buen servicio; Domingo es un hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico, y con muchas ganas de hacer algo mejor  en su vida por eso se entrega al máximo sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito; ahora que aumento la demanda quiere aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, sorgo, insecticida,  herramienta, etc. Domingo Antonio tiene buenas referencias de crédito, es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá llevar seguridad económica a s hogar.
texts.en:
Domingo Antonio lives with his life partner and their two children in their own home. He works in agriculture, specifically growing maize, beans and sorghum. To complement this, he works as a labourer. He has worked for ten years, which has given him very valuable experience enabling him to obtain better crops and make good earnings. His land is located in a highly agricultural area and is very close to his home. 

He sells all around his locality and has very good customers. His customers prefer Domingo because he always has what they need at an affordable price and he gives good service. Domingo is dedicated to his work; he is energetic and wants to do something better in his life. For this reason he is completely committed to his work, as he knows that this is how he will succeed. 

Demand has increased recently and so he wants to increase production. This is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. The loan will provide funds to buy maize, bean and sorghum seeds, as well as insecticide and tools, etc. Domingo Antonio has very good loan references. He is responsible and is committed to repaying his debt as well as hoping that that he will be able to secure his family’s economic situation.

loans.use: to buy maize, bean and sorghum seeds, as well as insecticide and tools etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Garmah

texts.en:
Garmah lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 33 years old, single, and has a 9-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. Garmah stopped school at ninth grade.

Since1997, Garmah has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends.

Garmah is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business. She enjoys her business because of the profit she receives every day. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hugo Alexander

texts.es: Hugo Alexander vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y al mismo tiempo para complementar los gastos del hogar cultiva loroco, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura y se siente orgulloso porque ha logrado obtener mucha experiencia que le permitirá día con día mejorar sus cosechas, las tierras de cultivo son propias y están ubicadas en una zona muy agrícola, el recibe todo el apoyo de su familia ellos le ayudan a comerciar en todos los lugares aledaños ya tiene mucha clientela pues la gente lo prefiere por la calidad del producto por los buenos precios y por el buen servicio; Hugo es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor siempre esta con las ganas de superarse y llegar al éxito,  la temporada pasada tuvo pérdidas y no logró las ganancias esperadas, por eso para esta siembra quiere aumentar la producción y recuperarse pero necesita de capital que lo respalde porque todas sus compras son al contado, es así como decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, loroco, herbicida, abono, etc. Hugo Alexander es responsable con buenas referencias crediticias tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Hugo Alexander lives with his life partner and their children.  He grows beans and corn for a living and he also grows loroco to supplement the household expenses.  He has been in farming for many years and he is proud because he has been able to gain a lot of experience, which allows him to improve his harvests day by day.  He owns the land he plants on and it is located in a very agricultural area.  He gets all of his family's help; they help him sell in all the neighboring areas and he has a big clientele because people prefer him for the quality of his produce, his good prices, and his good service.  Hugo is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work.  He is constantly looking to better himself and succeed.  This past season he suffered losses and he did not meet his projected earnings, so he wants to increase his yield with this crop to recuperate.  However, he needs capital because he makes all of his purchases in cash, so he decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn seed, bean seed, loroco seed, herbicide, fertilizer, etc.  Hugo Alexander is responsible and he has good credit references.  He is certain he will be able to repay his debt while offering his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, bean seed, loroco seed, herbicide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos Alfredo vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas y siempre tener calidad en su trabajo, el terreno donde cultiva es fértil y apto para la siembra, está cercano a la localidad donde vive y comercia en todas las zonas aledañas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Carlos es un hombre dedicado a su labor siempre dispuesto a superarse, sabe que con todo su esfuerzo y entrega logrará el éxito que tanto desea, en la cosecha pasada tuvo muchas perdidas y quiere recuperarse e invertir por eso le solicita a  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ganado, semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, herbicida, herramienta. Carlos Alfredo tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, se siente totalmente agradecido con la ayuda por lo que se compromete a cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Carlos Alfredo lives with his life partner and their children in his own house. He grows corn and beans. He has been farming for many years already and he has a lot of experience in it that allows him to obtain the best harvests and always do quality work. The land he cultivates is fertile and suitable for sowing. It is close to the town where he lives, and he trades in all the surrounding areas. He already has a lot of customers, since people prefer him because he always has what they need at accessible prices and provides unequalled service. Carlos is a man who is dedicated to his work and is always ready to better himself. He knows that with all of his effort and dedication he will achieve the success he wants so much. In the last harvest, he had a lot of losses, and he wants to recover and invest. That is why he is asking Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy cattle, corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and tools. Carlos Alfredo has good payment references and is very responsible. He feels completely thankful for the help, so he promises to make his loan repayments within the established time frame, and at the same time he will give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and tools

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 1 and 4 years. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman.

Eunice operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located at a strategic business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Eurnice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arnold Gabriel

texts.es:
Arnold es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Arnold no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía que desea, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Arnold trabaja lavando platos en un restaurante de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su puntualidad y honradez en su trabajo.
Arnold se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de algunos materiales de construcción, como cemento, arena, ladrillo y fierros, de esta manera podrá iniciar la construcción de un cuarto, ya que actualmente él y su familia duermen en una sola habitación, con ello él podrá brindar mayor bienestar y seguridad para todos, así pues Arnold seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional y desea tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Arnold is 19 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings. He is a kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person with a strong desire to get ahead. Sadly, because of a lack of financial resources and needing to work to help his parents, Arnold has not been able to study the professional career in gastronomy that he wanted, but he would very much like to do so.

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and determination, Arnold works as a dishwasher in a restaurant in his city. He works every day for approximately eight hours.  He says that things are going well for him at work because he is punctual and honest. 

Arnold is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support he will be able to buy various construction materials such as cement, sand, bricks and steel reinforcing bars. He will use these materials to build a room, since he and his family currently sleep in a single room. In this way he will be able to provide better security and wellbeing for all of his family. Arnold plans to continue working and striving to achieve his greatest dream, which is to become a distinguished professional and have his own home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, bricks and steel reinforcing bars.

loans.name: Joselyn Yesenia

texts.es:
Joselyn es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, Joselyn no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar vóley con sus amigas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace 3 años Joselyn trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Joselyn se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción de una de las paredes de su cocina, ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada por la humedad y el salitre que hay dentro, de esta manera ella podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una gran profesional y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Joselyn, a 20 year old youth, lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly person, hardworking and enthusiastic who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately due to lack of financial resources it was necessary for her to work to help her parents. Joselyn could not study for the professional post of secretary, but she would have liked to do so. In her free time she likes to play volleyball with her friends and sometimes she cooks the tasty turkey with rice dish to share with her family.

On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, for the last three years, Joselyn has worked as a field laborer on an agricultural farm in her city. She works every day from the early morning hours and works approximately eight hours. She thinks it is going well because of her good performance and the kind treatment she gives the others.

Joselyn is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to the provided help she will be able to do the renovation to one of the kitchen walls, as it is deteriorated by moisture and potassium nitrate that is inside. In this way she can give greater security and wellbeing to her family, and thus she will continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of becoming a successful professional so she can get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the kitchen walls

loans.name: Ashan

texts.en:
Ashan is 42 years old and from Tiribe, Kenya. She is married with three children who are now all in school. Her main business is selling staple grains, such as corn, beans and sorghum, and she also sells other products such as bananas.

Ashan started this business with her own savings ten years ago. She is known for being a lady of strong entrepreneurial values and is very responsible in her duties.

Ashan is approaching for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase basic grain staples, such as corn, beans and other products, to enable her to further expand her business and increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase basic grain staples, such as corn, beans and other products, to enable her to further expand her business and increase profits.

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.fr:
Fréderic  fait partie du groupe  Twitange et  habite à  Kayanza. Il a 39 ans et est marié  à Domine, une commerçante et agricultrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants dont  3 étudient.
Il prend  soin de 1 enfant  orphelin.

Il fait le commerce de pomme de terre depuis  10 ans. 

Il  est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  pommes  de terre, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait pratiquer l’élevage comme une autre activité,  acheter une moto et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Frédéric is a member of the Twitange group and he lives in Kayanza.  He is 39 years old and married to Domine, a seller and farmer.  Together, they have five children, three of whom are in school.  Frédéric is also taking care of one child who is an orphan.

He has been selling potatoes for ten years.

This is his second loan with Turame.  With the loan that he is receiving from Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of potatoes for resale, in order to make more money.

In the coming years, he would like to get involved in another activity and raise livestock.  He would also like to buy a motorcycle and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a woman of 41 years. She is married to John and is a mother of three lovely children. 

Jane sells phone accessories and electronics like radios. She has been in this business for seven years now, and gets a monthly income of 60,000 Kenya shillings.

This will be Jane's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy mobile phone accessories and electronics for sale. 

In the future, Jane wants to feed her family well and open a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories and electronics for sale.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of five young children. They live in Bohol, a province in the Philippines. 

Analiza has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 15 years. This has been the source of their income. 

Analiza is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters, and other items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, a 31-year-old mother of four children and married to Amos, has had rental houses for six years now, and gets a monthly income of 44,000 shillings. This will be her first loan from KADET LTD with which she will buy building materials such as sand, cement, etc. to finish building some of the rental houses.

Susan wants to expand her business by building more rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Santos Rafael

texts.es: Santos Rafael vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años laborando lo que le ha dado experiencia en el rubro convirtiéndose asi en uno de los mejores, obteniendo las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en un lugar accesible y muy cercano a su vivienda, además para complementar los gastos del hogar trabaja de jornal; Santos es un hombre entregado a su labor, dispuesto a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus objetivos lo mas impórtate en su vida es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de su hogar, la casa necesita modificaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad de todos, es un hombre comprometido y no duda que podrá realizar los cambios  en el tiempo esperado obteniendo el éxito deseado, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, piso, herramientas etc. Santos Rafael tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, esta agradecido con la ayuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santos Rafael lives with his life partner and children. He is a farmer. Specifically, he grows corn and beans. He has been working for many years, which has given him experience in this work, making him one of the best, obtaining the best harvests. The land he cultivates is located in an accessible place very close to his house. He also supplements the household expenses by working as a day laborer. Santos is a man who is dedicated to his work, ready to give everything he has to meet his goals. The most important thing in his life is his family, and in the last few weeks the deterioration of his house has disturbed the tranquility of his home. The house needs renovations and he wants to do them as soon as possible for everyone's safety. He is a committed man and he does not doubt that he will be able to make the changes in the expected time frame and with the success desired. He needs to invest, but he does not have sufficient capital. That is why he is asking for a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy cement, bricks, flooring, tools, etc. Santos Rafael has good payment references and he takes responsibility for paying back the loan. He is grateful for the help, and at the same time he hopes that he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, flooring, and tools

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité Sagrada Familia trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2.006, está integrado por 17 mujeres que realizan distintas actividades para poder ayudar a sus familias y por medio de ese trabajo ir creciendo no solo como persona, sino también como microempresarias. Las mismas se encuentran en el noveno ciclo.
Dina, una de las integrantes se dedica a la costura, tiene un pequeño taller donde hace todo tipo de confecciones, y con ello tiene los medios necesarios para ayudar a su familia. Cuenta que al principio le costó un poco, pero que con su esfuerzo fue abriéndose camino. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y creciendo.
Pide esta ayuda para poder invertirla en la compra de telas e hilos, y así seguir con sus confecciones y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Sagrada Familia has been working with the foundation since 2006. It is made up of 17 women who have various activities in order to be able to help their families and through that work go on growing not only personally but as entrepreneurs. They are in their ninth cycle.

Dina, of of the members, works as a seamstress. She has a small workshop where she makes all kinds of garments, and thus she has the necessary means to help her family. In the beginning it was a little difficult, but through her efforts she has cleared the path. Her dream is to continue working and growing.

She is asking for help to be able to buy fabric and thread and so continue making garments and responding to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for her work as a seamstress.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Rebecca is 17 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past four years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her retail store, which sells sugar, flour, rice and other items. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock and buy more items such as bread and milk to sell, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and meet customers' needs. Rebecca hopes that in the future, she will be able to start another retail shop. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase stock and buy more items such as bread and milk to sell.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina is a single mother of three children, and all of her children go to school. She does not support any additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Fatina generates additional income through selling fresh fruits and frying edibles. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation and also to see her children acquire a good education. 

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Aliyah

texts.en:
Aliyah is a 39-year-old divorced woman and mother of one child. She opened a convenience store in 2005 in order to make her living.

Aliyah is a hardworking woman, with an excellent reputation in her area. She is working hard to make sure that she can provide her child a normal life and to make sure that she will be financially secure as she ages.

Aliyah applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise with special canned food and sweets. 

Aliyah hopes to keep expanding her business more and more, and to respond to her customers' needs as well as she can.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with special canned food and sweets

loans.name: Jhilary Alexandra

texts.es:
Jhilary es una mujer de 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete en el distrito de Imperial con sus 2 hijas, a quienes ama  y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para ellos; gracias a su esfuerzo Jhilary estudió la carrera técnica de secretariado, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar no pudo culminar sus estudios, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras calles de su ciudad.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Jhilari trabaja como ayudante en una granja de venta de cuyes, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y se encarga de la crianza, alimentación, cuidado y venta de estos animalitos, adicionalmente también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas en su hogar.
Jhilary se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias al apoyo brindado podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de golosinas para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella podrá atender a mas clientes, de esta manera Jhilary seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder encontrar un mejor trabajo y culminar sus estudios para convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Jhilary is a 26 year old woman. She lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial area, with her 2 daughters. She loves her daughters and they are the light of her life. She is a very pleasant person, hardworking and enthusiastic. She puts all her effort into providing for her family, as she is mother and father to them. Her efforts have enabled Jhilary to start a secretarial studies course. But, unfortunately due to a lack of finances and as she needs to work, she was not able to complete her studies, but she would like to return to them. In her free time she likes to walk through the small streets of her city.

With a lot of hard work, dedication and thanks to her mother’s support, Jhilari works as an assistant on a guinea pig farm. She works there every day from early in the morning. She looks after the rearing, feeding, care and sale of these small animals. She also has a small business selling sweets from her home.

Jhilary is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as their support enables her to buy a greater amount of sweets to stock her business. In this way she can serve more customers and she can keep working and pushing herself. All this will help her to achieve her dream of finding a better job and finishing her studies to become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy sweets for her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter has always repaid his loans successfully, and this marks his fifth borrowing. He will use the money to pay school fees for his son. He will use proceeds from his taxi business to pay back the loan. He hopes to educate all his children up to the university level.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Ana Vilma Isabel

texts.es: Ana Vilma Isabel vive junto a su pequeña familia en un hogar propio, ella se dedica a al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro de la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas y además las mejores ganancias, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, es muy conocida pues comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que la prefiere por la calidad, buenos precios y excelente servicio; Ana Vilma es una mujer activa, enérgica y dedicada a su labor siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le abran camino al éxito y no piensa rendirse hasta lograrlo, la perseverancia es su mejor don; en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvieron algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Ana Vilma tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Vilma Isabel lives with her small family in her own home. She works growing corn and beans. She has been working in the field of agriculture for some years and that has given her a lot of experience that permits her to obtain the best crops and also the best earnings. The farming land is located in a high incidence agricultural area and very close to her home. She is well known because she sells in all the surrounding areas of the community and she has made many regular customers as they prefer her for the quality and good prices and excellent service.

Ana Vilma is an active woman, energetic and dedicated to her work, always looking for better ways to pave the road to success and not to give up until she succeeds. Her perseverance is her best gift. In the last planting season they had some losses and want to recover and this is why she is asking Integral for a loan that will permit her to buy corn seed, beans, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, etc. Ana Vilma has good payment references and is sure that she can pay off the loan and also believes she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, beans, fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide for her crops.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda is 40 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is married with 9 children between the ages of 5 and 23 years old. Only three live at home and are in school. She stopped her education at 6th grade. She has been selling salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onions, and peanuts in the local market. She started this business with 2000 LRD given to her by her mother, and she learned this trade from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onions, and peanuts for her business. Her future plans are to educate all of her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onions, and peanuts for her business.

loans.name: Florije

texts.en:
Florije is a divorced 23-year-old woman living in Kosovo. Recently, she moved back in with her parents. They all live in very bad conditions. Florije is the main source of income for her family. She works as a hairdresser. She is a very hard-working young woman who puts a lot of effort into earning a living.

Florije is in need of a loan to renovate her house to buy a new door and windows, to reinstall the electricity and to paint the house.
The loan will help them to improve their living conditions. She hopes in the future to get married and to have her own family. Florije’s goal is to be able to save money and to open her own hairdressing shop.  

She appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To renovate her house, to buy a new door and windows, to install electricity and to paint the house

loans.name: Maitta

texts.en:
